loans.name: Ikram

texts.en: Ikram is a 20-year-old Lebanese unmarried woman living with her parents and a relative. She has spent two years working as a female hairdresser and beautician at her domicile where she greets her customers with a great smile. Ikram started her career at a young age with the intention of increasing the family’s revenues. Currently, Ikram wants to get a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l so as to purchase hairdressing tools such as a dryer, hairbrush etc., in addition to cosmetics. Ikram feels like she is meant to work in such a business and states that she is very happy and looks forward to opening her own beauty salon as soon as possible.

loans.use: purchase hairdressing tools such as a dryer, hairbrush, etc. in addition to cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to celebrate his marriage

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane, 45, is a married woman and a mother of three children from San Dionisio, Iloilo. Mary Jane runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Mary Jane has operated her store for almost 13 years now. Mary Jane is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread and biscuits, soap and detergents, coffee and sugar and condiments and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread and biscuits, soap and detergents, coffee and sugar and condiments and animal feed

loans.name: Rutchel

texts.en: Rutchel is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of two grownup children from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She makes a living through a hog raising business. Rutchel has raised pigs for more than 20 years now. Rutchel is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as her income. Rutchel dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a supply of plantains in large quantities.

loans.name: Diane

texts.en: Diane is 31 years old. She is married with five children whose ages are between 1.5 and 12 years. Four of the children go to school. She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 12 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay for labor. The profits from the business will be used to buy medical insurance and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay for labor

loans.name: Jematia

texts.en:
Jematia is a single mother of two based in Kiminda village which is located in the North Rift town of Nandi Hills, Kenya. She owns 1.5 acre of land which she uses to keep 6 dairy cows, 20 heads of poultry, 4 goats and a maize/corn field.

Jematia is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to buy cereal grains. Armed with 30 years of experience in farming, Jematia understands clearly the importance of having a stock of cereals. During planting season, she can use part of the stock as planting seeds. After the planting season, the market gets hit with a temporary shortage of cereal grains which results in an increase in cereal grain prices. Farmers, like Jematia, who have a stock of cereals can sell it then and recover part of the high cost of farm inputs incurred during planting.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Mediko

texts.en:
Mediko is a 46-year-old divorced woman who lives alone in the Senaki district. She earns a living on her own and works at the local meat products factory, where she gets a really insignificant salary. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because she had to start working at a very young age, Mediko was unable to study a professional career.  She works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing maize, nuts and laurel. She always has high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price.  

As the main part of Mediko's income is seasonal, she decided to start a clothing-trading business. She sought credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. The startup program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,000 GEL for purchasing stock of clothing. Mediko will sell among her villagers and neighbors with price mark-ups and will also get private orders.  Mediko will be thankful to all the lenders for helping her maintain the trading business.

loans.use: To trade with clothing and make an additional source of income

loans.name: Chitechi's Group

texts.en:
Chitechi is 60 years old and has 9 children. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very resourceful person. Even though Chitechi is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Chitechi started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community.

Chitechi’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of six acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase plastic footwear

loans.name: Solidario Group

texts.es: Con la esperanza de incrementar el capital de trabajo y mejorar sus ingresos, solicitan por cuarta ocasión el financiamiento en ADIM el grupo “Solidarios”, quienes han demostrado ser unas personas responsables en sus cuotas y que saben administrar sus negocios, quien lo coordina es el señor Gloddys quien tiene la edad de 39 años, acompañado, su negocio es el destace de cerdo y a la vez elabora derivados de este como es nacatamales, cuenta con la ayuda de su compañera de vida para la elaboración de dicho producto, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de un cerdo, esto con el objetivo de incrementar las ventas y así mejorar sus ingresos. El resto de los integrantes son, la señora Yaneth que tiene la edad de 38 años y se dedica a la hecha y venta de nacatamales desde hace tres años, Gloribel una joven que a sus 19 años cuenta con dos años en la comercialización de sandalias en su comunidad, y Pablina una señora que a sus 53 años aún tiene el espíritu para su superación y ha dedicado los últimos años a la venta de cabeza de chancho, un plato tradicional del país. Estos socios se han propuesto seguir creciendo en sus negocios con el objetivo de ofrecer a sus familias los recursos necesarios.
texts.en:
With the hope of increasing working capital and improving their income, for the fourth time the members of the group “Solidarios” are requesting financing from ADIM.  They have proven to be responsible in paying their installments and know how to run their businesses.  Gloddys, 39 years old and married, is coordinating the loan.  His business is a pig butcher shop, and at the same time he makes byproducts such as nacatamales (maize, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf).  His wife helps him make this product.  He is requesting this loan to purchase a pig with the goal of increasing his sales and therefore, improve his income.  

The rest of the group members are Yaneth, who is 39 years old and has made a living making and selling nacatamales for three years, Gloribel, a young woman who, at 19 years of age, has two years of experience selling sandals in her community, and Pablina, a 53-year-old woman who still has the willpower to overcome and has made a living in the last few years selling cabeza de chancho, a traditional dish of the country.  These partners have decided to continue growing their businesses with the goal of providing their families with necessary resources.

loans.use: to buy a pig

loans.name: Yuly Elizabeth

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas (piñas, naranjas, maracuyá, etc.). En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral, en este lugar hermoso se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Santa María
En este lugar vive la señora Yuly, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija y está embarazada nuevamente. El marido atiende un bar en una escuela.
Doña Yuly  es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida como empanadillas, hornado, corviches, entre otros y  también prepara almuerzos ya que ella y su marido tienen a cargo el  bar de una escuela de la localidad. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en este lugar  desde las 6h00 hasta las 15h00. El negocio tiene tres años y les va muy bien, ellos varían el menú que preparan para no cansar a los niños que son sus clientes diarios.
Este crédito es para comprar aceite, plátano, maní y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Tiene 1 año en el grupo de crédito, le gusta la Fundación porque les brinda apoyo y responsabilidad, el servicio médico, créditos emergentes y escolares. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
El Carmen county stands out in agriculture. This is where plantains, coffee, cacao, corn and a large variety of fruits (pineapples, oranges, passion fruit, etc.) are grown. In livestock, the area is known for breeding cattle, horses, pigs and poultry. The members of the credit group Santa María meet in this beautiful place.

Yuly, who is 23 years old, lives here. She is in a committed relationship, has one daughter and is newly pregnant. Her partner tends a snack bar in a school.

Yuly is a good housekeeper who works preparing and selling snacks and fast food like dumplings, hornado (a pork dish), and corviches (a dish made out of green bananas and fish), among others. She also prepares lunches since she and her husband are in charge of running a snack bar at a local school. She works Monday through Friday from 6:00am until 3:00pm. Their business is three years old and is going very well. They vary the menu to keep the kids who are their regular customers from getting bored.

This loan is for buying oil, plantains, peanuts and other staples for food preparation. They have been with the credit group for one year. They like the group because it gives them support and accountability, medical services, support in case of emergencies and school credits. They dream of having a great restaurant.

loans.use: buy oil, bananas, peanuts and other supplies.

loans.name: Raylen

texts.en: Raylen is a 31-year-old married man and a father of two children aged nine and four. Raylen lives in San Dionisio, Iloilo with his family. Raylen has owned and operated a photocopier machine for several years now. He also sells school and office supplies like paper, pencil, color pens, glue and others. Raylen is asking for a to loan to buy a new photocopier machine and school supplies like paper, pens and pencils and others. A loan will help him increase his stock and he will also cater to more customers in his photocopier shop. Raylen dreams of improving his business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy a new photocopier machine and school supplies like paper, pens and pencils and others

loans.name: Thomas's Group

texts.en:
Thomas is 44 years old and has 5 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Thomas has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Thomas also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Thomas's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.es: Dos mujeres y un varón con negocios diferentes y un objetivo en común, incrementar el capital de trabajo de sus negocios, se unieron para solicitar el financiamiento en ADIM y así cumplir dicho objetivo. Quien lo coordina es la señora Claudia que tiene la edad de 34 años, casada y madre de tres hijos que dependen económicamente de ella y son su mayor motivación para su superación, es propietaria de un taller de zapatería, este negocio lo impulsó hace diez años y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para la elaboración de los productos, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de cuero, forro, conos de hilos, pega blanca y amarilla y suelas, ella se ha propuesto incrementar la producción de modo que le permitirá ofrecer una vida más acorde a la realidad del país. Los otros miembros del grupo son, Jessica que tiene la edad de 26 años y cuenta con cinco años de experiencia en la comercialización de prendas de platas, y Hollman un joven de 19 años, quien desde muy joven aprendió lo que era la elaboración de bolso y se independizó y hoy en día elabora dicho producto. Estos socios se han propuesto lograr un buen récord crediticio en la institución para que le brinde los financiamientos y así mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
These two women and young man have different businesses but a common goal. They have come together to seek financing from ADIM to increase the working capital in their businesses to meet their common goal. 

Señora Claudia is their coordinator. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of three children who are financially dependent on her. They are the main source of her inspiration to get ahead. She owns a shoemaker’s shop. She started this business ten years ago. Her husband helps her to make her products. She is seeking the loan in order to buy leather, lining, cone thread, white and yellow glue and soles. She would like to increase production to be more in step with the reality of the country.

The other members of the group are Jessica and Hollman. Jessica is 26 years old and has five years experience making silver jewelry, and Hollman is a 19 year old young man who learned at a very young age how to make bags. He is on his own and now makes them himself. These members have resolved to have a good credit history with the institution so that they may have loans and improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy leather, glue, soles, thread, etc.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a sari-sari store owner from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She has operated her retail store for several years now. This is her source of income. 

She is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips, soda and beverages, coffee, eggs, condiments, and others. 

Clarita believes  that a loan will help him improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, she wants to expand her store in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips, soda and beverages, coffee, egg, condiments, and others

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
A 32-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Angela earns a living through a sari-sari store. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Angela is asking to take a loan to help her improve her stock. A loan will used to buy stock like bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, soda and noodles, rice, condiments, detergents, cooking oil, and others. 

A loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy stock like bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, soda and noodles, rice, condiments, detergents, cooking oil, and others

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of seven grown-up children from San Dionisio, Iloilo. 

She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Gertrudes is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks such as candies, bread and biscuits, chips, and other snack foods. 

This loan will help her improve her stocks which will attract more buyers to her store. Gertrudes dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stocks such as candies, bread and biscuits, chips, and other snack foods

loans.name: Blaise

texts.en:
Blaise is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from San Dionisio, Iloilo. 

She makes a living through  the hog raising business. Blaise has been in the business for more than five years now. 

Blaise is asking to take a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en:
Rose Mary is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Iloilo. 

Rose Mary has been earning a living through her sari-sari or retail store business for more than six years now. This is the source of her income. 

Rose Mary is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments,  bread and snack food,s and others. 

A loan will help her improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers in her store. Rose Mary dreams of making her business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned buy buy goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments,  bread and snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy  cow and expand her farming activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow to enable him expand his farming activity.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is thankful that she was granted a 11,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able meet her family's daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source for sustaining her family's basic needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Priscilla dreams of having a bigger General Store and venturing into other business to provide a much better life for her adopted child. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages, needed in her business.

loans.name: Martha Lucy

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer muy sonriente es toda una guerrera, hablando un poco de su vida a sus 45 años de edad es cabeza de hogar, la separación con su esposo la obligo a hacerse cargo de su hogar que lo termina de constituir 3 hijos todos ellos hombres.
Con su negocio de transporte de personas logra generar los recursos para toda su familia y ella una conductora se ha trazado un sueño el cual es conseguir un taxi y a este sueño le pacto una fecha de 5 años.
Su negocio fue una sugerencia de su hermana la cual sabía que siempre se genera una necesidad de transporte y que ellas la podían atender. 
Martha en el momento tiene una dificultad su vehículo necesita hacerle un mantenimiento, por tiempo, por funcionamiento y por la seguridad de sus pasajeros, pero en el momento no cuenta con capital para mandar el vehículo al taller, por ello solicita un préstamo para realizar las reparaciones y mantenimientos necesarios, asegurándose de que su carro pueda prestar un óptimo y seguro servicio.
texts.en:
Martha is smiling woman who is totally a warrior. Talking a bit about her life at 45 years old, she is the head of her family. The separation from her husband forced her to take charge of her household which consists of 3 children all males. With her business of transportation people she manages to generate the resources for the whole family. Being a driver she has created a dream which is to obtain a taxi and this dream she has been chasing for five years.

Her business was a suggestion from her sister who knows that there is always need for transport and that they could service it. Martha at this moment has some difficulty with her vehicle and needs to do maintenance for timing, performance and the security of her passengers. But at this time she does not have the capital to send the vehicle to the shop so she is requesting a loan to do the repairs and maintenance needed, assuring that the vehicle can offer an optimal and safe service.

loans.use: to do repairs and maintenance needed on her vehicle.

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr: Ayawavi est une femme mariée et âgée de 55 ans. Ayawavi vit à Adakpamé avec ses enfants. Dans son quotidien, elle vend du maïs et du riz à son domicile et les transporte au marché pour avoir plus de gain. Ayawavi trouve son bénéfice pour aider ses enfants à s’épanouir mais nécessite encore plus de moyens. Ayawavi achète son stock six fois par mois au marché d’Attikpodji. Pour commander des sacs de maïs et du riz, Ayawavi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et faire plus de revenus.
texts.en: Ayawavi is a married woman, 55 years old, who lives in Adakpamé with her children. During her day, she sells corn and rice out of her home and transports the goods to market, so as to earn more. She seeks profits to help out her children that they may thrive, but she needs more funding. She buys her inventory of goods six times a month at the Attikpodji market. To order sacks of corn and rice, Ayawavi is asking for this loan to make her purchase and to make more income.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn

loans.name: Thamar

texts.en:
Thamar is 45 years old. She is married with eight children aged between 5 and 26 years. They all go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 22 years. Also her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To pay workers.

loans.name: Habel's Group

texts.en:
Habel's Group is formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Habel, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 29 years old, is married, and has 3 children. Habel has been a farmer for ten years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Habel isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Habel will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Habel's Group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Dúo Calle Alemán Group

texts.es: Dúo calle alemán El cual esta integrado por la señora Rosa quien tiene un hijo a su cargo y es una mujer viuda pero que con esfuerzo y sacrificio a sacado adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos ya que ella aun tiene sueños y metas para los cuales espera en DIOS poder logarlos y en esta ocasión ella toca las puertas de la institución para que juntamente con la ayuda que ustedes le brinden ella pueda cumplir cada uno de los sueños y metas que ella tiene, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos para la venta.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of a lending duo called Calle Aleman. She is a widow with one dependent son and, through her sacrifice and hard work, she has made progress for her children. She sells cosmetics, and still has dreams and goals that he hopes God will help her achieve.

Rosa is asking the institution to work together with this help that you all provide so that she can meet all of her dreams and goals. She is asking for a loan to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Channel Group

texts.en:
Roseana, who is in her early 40's, is single with two children who are still in school.  She has been running a grocery store for six years now.  She works from 8 AM to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Roseana's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy a fridge for her store and restocked the out of stock drinks.  

She has managed to pay back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to  increase the grocery drinks and meet her customers' demand.  She dreams of owning a pub.  

Roseana will share this loan with her loan group, Channel,  which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the grocery drinks and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase pasta

loans.name: Los Ideales Group

texts.es:
CYNTHIA ALIS, forma parte del grupo "Los ideales" formado por siete socias. Ella es una joven de 27 años que se dedica a la elaboración de artículos de bisutería, ésta es una actividad que aprendió desde muy jovencita y que ahora le permite sustentar sus gastos y el de sus tres hijos menores.
Le gustaría más adelante poder tener una empresa de fabricación de accesorios de bisutería y poder surtir a las grandes cadenas de venta de Lima.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como hilos, alambres, correas, tiras de cuero, seguros para pulseras y aretes, etc.
texts.en:
Cynthia Alis is part of the “Los ideales” group, formed by six partners.  She is a young, 27-year-old woman who makes a living making costume jewelry pieces.  She learned this profession when she was very young and now it allows her to cover her expenses and those of her three younger children.

In the future, she would like to have costume jewelry accessory production business and to be able to supply to the large retail chains in Lima.  She will invest the loan that she receives to purchase materials such as thread, wristbands, leather strips, bracelet and earring clasps, etc.

loans.use: to invest in materials for her costume jewelry business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 39, comes from Kabiber village in the North Rift region of Kenya. This year, Joyce celebrates her 15th year in marriage with Julius, the father of her four children. To support Julius in providing for their family, Joyce started farming in the year 2012. Today, her two-acre farm holds two dairy cows, 20 heads of poultry, and a field of maize/corn. 

Joyce is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase cereal grains. These grains will act as seeds during the planting season, food to Joyce's family, and a commodity for trade. Enterprising farmers usually aggregate cereal produce from local farmers and sell it in lucrative urban markets that offer better prices. 

This trade helps farmers, like Joyce, to roll back cereal profits into the business and use the money to settle part of the high cost of inputs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Gerardine

texts.en:
Gerardine is 45 years old. She is married with four children aged between 13 and 21, and they all go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 28 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay for the laborers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: To pay for the laborers.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 42 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 6 and 18 years, and they all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 21 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy medical insurance and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay workers.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson lives in Hoima, Uganda.He is a very hardworking man who is married with seven children, five of whom attend school. He deals in farming mainly cassava, rice and maize, supplemented by incomes from produce and motor cycle transport. He intends to become a commercial farmer in order to meet the demands of the local market. He will use the loan to plant ten acres of maize to sell.

loans.use: to plant ten acres of maize to sell.

loans.name: Lelys Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lelys es una mujer de 40 años de edad, quien tiene un negocio de confección donde oferta empleo a dos personas, es madre de una pequeña de 6 años de edad.
El negocio de la confección lo inicio hace años, un amigo fue su guía y le enseño todo acerca del negocio.
Desde que inició su negocio Lelys ha seguido unas políticas para prosperar su idea principal es ser una empresa generadora de empleo y siempre le apunta a esto, tener sostenibilidad del negocio, ser competitivo en el negocio y caracterizarse por ser una empresa donde los tiempos de confección y entrega sean óptimos.
Pensando en este último ítem, Lelys quiere optimizar sus tiempos de producción por ello piensa comprar una maquina fileteadora pero no cuenta con el capital, por ende solicita un préstamo para a compra de una maquina fileteadora   esperando a que esta máquina sea el inicio de una nueva empresa y que genere un empleo.
texts.en:
Lelys is a 40-year-old woman who has a dressmaking business, where she provides employment to two people.  She is the mother of a small child who is 6 years old.  She started the dressmaking business years ago; a friend guided her and taught her everything about the business.

Since she started her business, Lelys has followed some methods in order to thrive.  Her principal idea is for it to be an employment-generating company.  She always aims toward this, as well as having business sustainability, being competitive, and characterizing it to be a business where the production and delivery times are optimal.

Considering the last item, Lelys wants to optimize her production times.  This is why she is thinking of purchasing an overlock sewing machine, but she does not have the capital.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase the overlock sewing machine, with the hope that this machine will be the start of a new business that will generate a job.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Julia, often described as an extremely experienced farmer. She is 42 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  She is married and has four children.

Julia is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Julia says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2013, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Julia will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose, pictured above, has eight children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Rose is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Rose has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to earn enough to feed her family, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this coming season, Rose is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 5.5 acres will be planted by Rose's Group, and among them they will receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Moses's Group

texts.en:
Moses, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 60 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Moses likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Moses plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Moses’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Francis's Group

texts.en:
Francis, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 15 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 56 years old, is married and has 5 children.

Francis likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Francis plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Francis’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 48-old-married father of 5 children aged 23, 21, 19, 16 and 13; all the children go to school. He is a tea farmer from Kyampembwa Swazi Kyamuhunga In Bushenyi, Uganda. He does not have any other children that live in his family so he is part of a nuclear family. He works eight hours a day, and he started this tea-farming business in 2007 to raise funds for educating his five children. 

This is his first loan from this institution. He is borrowing UGX 2,500,000 to buy fertilizers to spread in his tea plantation to increase tea output and to purchase timber, since the timber business is another source of income for his family. His clients are all categories of people and tea factories from around Bushenyi district. He hopes to build a better house for his family through these two businesses. He is mostly affected by price fluctuations of tea leaves and high prices for timber. He is honest and shrewd; that’s why he promised to be loyal to the institution by paying his loan on the due date.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Socorro Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Socorro es una señora muy trabajadora y emprendedora, quien administra y posee una pulpería en su comunidad alejada de la ciudad, ella sale dos veces a la semana a comprar al mercado departamental y luego lleva sobre sus hombros la mercadería, pues donde ella vive no entra vehículo hasta su domicilio, ella con mucho esfuerzo hace esa tarea y demuestra que las mujeres si se proponen tienen el valor y la fuerza suficiente para hacer todo el trabajo que un negocio requiere, todo esto lo hace a sus 52 años de edad y tiene este negocio desde hace doce años, ella inició este negocio con ayuda económica de su esposo, quien es una persona ya jubilada. Doña Socorro requiere más capital para invertir en granos básicos como es arroba de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, galletas, toallas sanitarias, papel higiénico, tabcin, etc., ya que son productos que se venden a diario en su comunidad, se ha propuesto aumentar y diversificar los productos ofrecidos para continuar mejorando los ingresos y así aportar a los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Socorro is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who owns and runs a grocery store in her community away from the city. She goes two times a week to make purchases at the departmental market, and then she carries the merchandise on her shoulders, since in the area where she lives, vehicles cannot enter as far as her home. She does this work with much effort and she shows that women, once they make a decision, have sufficient courage and strength to do all the work that a business requires. All this she does at her age of 52, and she has had this business for 12 years. She began this business with economic help from her husband, who is already retired.

Doña Socorro needs more capital to invest in basic grains such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, crackers, sanitary napkins, toilet paper, cold tablets, etc., since these are the products that are sold every day in her community. She has decided to increase and diversify the products she offers in order to continue improving her income and thus support the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains for her store, since they are products that are in daily demand in her community

loans.name: Janepher's Group

texts.en:
Janepher's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Janepher, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 47 years old, is married and has 4 children. Janepher has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Janepher isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Janepher will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Janepher's Group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en:
Paul is a 60-year-old proud father of 9 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Paul has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Paul described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Paul’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rael's Group

texts.en:
Rael, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 45 years old, is married and has 6 children.

Rael likes to think of herself as a very friendly person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Rael plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Rael’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: James Mauricio

texts.es:
James es un joven de 20 años de edad, que quiere estudiar, trabajar, ser alguien en la vida, salir de la pobreza, sacar su familia adelante, en el momento se desempeña como vendedor de frutas y verduras un negocio algo improvisado que inicio por necesidad económica pues no quería seguir viendo a su familia pasar necesidades.
Con sus modestos ingresos se paga su estudio y logra aportar capital para la alimentación de su familia, pero sueña con que las cosas pueden mejorar, quiere solicitar un préstamo pero quiere tener su apoyo, el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de legumbres, como lo son zanahoria, cilantro, tomates, cebolla, tomates, yuca, plátanos, entro otros vegetales, surtirá algo de frutas y comprara pintura para darle una mano a su negocio.
texts.en:
James is a young, 20-year-old man who wants to study, work, be someone in life, escape poverty, and carry his family forward.  Currently, he works as a fruit and vegetable merchant in a somewhat improvised business that he started as a result of economic necessity since he did not want to continue seeing his family suffer hardships.

With his modest earnings, he pays for his studies and manages to provide resources to feed his family, but he dreams that things will improve.  He wants to request a loan and have your support.  He will invest the money in the purchase of vegetables such as carrots, cilantro, tomatoes, onions, yucca, plantains, as well as others, to stock fruit, and to purchase paint to help improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase carrots, cilantro, tomatoes, onions, yucca, plantains, as well as other vegetables, to stock fruit, and to purchase paint to help improve his business

loans.name: Gaudencia's Group

texts.en:
Gaudencia is a 40-year-old proud mother of 7 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Gaudencia has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Gaudencia described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Gaudencia’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
Ella es Mariana una madre cabeza de familia de 38 años de edad, excelente trabajadora, muy cumplida, comprometida con su negocio y clientes, amigable y sonriente, tiene un restaurante donde oferta desayunos, almuerzos, pasa bocas, productos fritos, gaseosas y cervezas, genera un empleo y gracias a su negocio que inicio en el año 2013 genera el sustento en su hogar donde la espera un pequeño de 8 años de edad.
Su idea con su restaurante es ampliarlo para ubicar más mesas, que le traerá muy buenos beneficios como lo son un aumento de clientes, y generaría otro empleo.
Mariana quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertir en la compra de utensilios para su cocina, realizar una ampliación para ubicar 3 mesas de más, con la ayuda de este préstamo su negocio podrá atender más clientes, aumentaran sus ganancias, su punto de venta será más amplio y hermoso.
Mariana sueña con poder comprar una vivienda para dejarle de herencia a su pequeño.
texts.en:
Mariana, 38, is the head of her household. She is an excellent worker - she is accomplished, dedicated to her business and customers, friendly and smiling. She has a restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch, snacks, fried products, sodas and beers. She has one employee and, thanks to this business that she started in 2013, she generates income to support her home and her 8-year-old son.

She wants to increase the space in her restaurant so that she can add more tables. This will have benefits like increasing her customers and adding another job position.

Mariana is asking for a loan to buy cooking utensils for her kitchen, and to amplify the space to add three tables. With the help of this loan she can serve more customers, increase her profits, and her space will be bigger and more beautiful. Mariana dreams of being able to buy a home so that she can leave her son an inheritance.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and amplify the space to fit three more tables.

loans.name: Over Antonio

texts.es:
Over es un trabajador, entregado hombre de 62 años de edad junto con su esposa atienda un negocio de tienda de abarrotes, manteniéndolo abierto entre 15 y 16 horas, turnándose para poder descansar.
Se ha trazado junto con su pareja a quien pueden ver en la foto comprar una vivienda, ellos son muy unidos y se apoyan mutuamente para lograr sus objetivos, su tienda es la única fuente de ingresos que tienen por ello trabajan tan duro esperando ganar ingresos de más para no solo mantenerse, tiene la idea de progresar continuamente.
Over solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar en general como lo son frijoles, arroz, panela, aceite, leche, queso, refrescos, productos enlatados, harina, panes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Over is a hard-working, dedicated man of 62. He and his wife run a grocery store business, keeping it open between 15 and 16 hours daily, working in shifts so that they can rest.

He and his wife, who is seen in the photo, plan to buy a house. They are a very close-knit couple; each one helping the other to achieve their goals. Their store is the only source of income they have, and this is why they work so hard, hoping to earn extra income, not only to support themselves, but with the idea of continually moving forward. 

Over is requesting a loan in order to buy beans, rice, brown sugar, cooking oil, milk, cheese, soft drinks, canned goods, flour, bread, and other items.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, cheese, soft drinks, canned goods, flour, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is 54 years old and has nine children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Grace is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Grace started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011. She decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to feed her family consistently ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Grace’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light. So with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Mikocheni Group

texts.en:
Dotto, who is in his early 50's is married with five children; two of them are still in school and three of them are grown-up. He has been running a genge (fresh fruit stand) business for ten years now.  He works from 7.00 am to 8.30 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Dotto's  third loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to keep on increasing the genge stock and has repaid his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy the fast moving items in his genge stock.  He dreams of building his own house.

Dotto will share this loan with his loan group "Mikocheni" that consists of six members, who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving items in his genge stock.

loans.name: Phelomene

texts.en: Phelomene is aged 41 years. She is married with one child who is aged 25 years and goes to school. She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 21 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy medical insurance and to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To pay workers.

loans.name: Philip's Group

texts.en:
Philip's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega, North District and is being represented by Philip, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 54 years old, is married and has four children. Philip has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Philip is not new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has been able to feed his family consistently ever since. This year, Philip will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Philip's Group will purchase a total of eight solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Grupo Sector Maxeño 2 Group

texts.es:
Aurelia Maria es una señora de 51 años de edad es casada, vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad de Santo Tomas la unión, tiene una hermosa familia de 5 hijos de las edades entre 16 y 34 años de edad de los cuales ya solo una está estudiando y los demás ya se graduaron.
Aurelia Maria (es la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) a pesar de su edad lucha de sol a sol para que su familia tenga lo necesario, ella es perseverante y muy amable Aurelia Maria se dedica a dos actividades la primera es de que vende comidas y tamales en la plaza de su comunidad y en los lugares circunvecinos de su región y la segunda actividad es la venta de pollos esta segunda actividad para ella es bastante rentable  porque le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos, Aurelia Maria se preocupa  por las necesidades de la familia y una de las necesidades prioritarias ahora es la remodelación de su baño porque ya se encuentra  en muy mal estado y lo que ella quiere es que su baño tenga una mejor presentación, pero ella cuenta con el problema de no tener el dinero suficiente para poder hacerlo, y ella ha juntado a un grupo de personas que también tienen la misma necesidad para solicitar un prestamo para comprar, arena, cal, y pisos.
El sueño de Aurelia Maria es poder seguir haciendo mejoras en su casa y que su hija la que está estudiando se gradué.
texts.en:
Aurelia Maria, 51, is married and lives with her husband in the community of Santo Tomas. They have a beautiful family of five children, between ages 16 and 34. Only one is still in school, the rest have graduated. In spite of her age, Aurelia Maria (far left in the photo) works from sunrise to sundown so that her family has what it needs. She is perseverant and very friendly.

Aurelia Maria has two jobs. The first is selling food and tamales in the town plaza and in neighboring areas in the region. Her second business is selling chickens, which is very profitable for her and augments her income.

Aurelia Maria worries about the needs of her family, and one of the priorities right now is remodeling their bathroom because it's in very bad shape. She wants a bathroom that looks nicer, but she doesn't have the money to make it so. She has joined a group of people who are also in need of a loan so that she can buy sand, lime and flooring.

Aurelia Maria's dream is to continue making improvements to her home, and that her youngest daughter graduates from school.

loans.use: to buy sand, lime and flooring.

loans.name: James's Group

texts.en:
James, pictured above, has seven children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. James is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega, North District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

James has been a farmer for 14 years, and in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. With the profits from this coming season, James is planning to invest in a business.

A total of five acres will be planted by James's Group, and between them they will receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Nguvu Moja Group

texts.en:
Riziki, who is in her mid-40s, is a widow with 4 children, 3 of whom are at school while the fourth is now grown. She has been a food vendor for 8 years now, though she has also started selling tap water. She works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit.

This will be Riziki's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to expand her mamalishe business and dig a well for collecting tap water, and she managed to repay all of her loans successfully. She used her profits to pay school fees and purchase a TV set, deck, radio, and sofa set. She was also able to cover her household expenses. 

Riziki will use her loan portion to buy both charcoal for cooking and food supplies such as rice, beans, flour, cooking oil, meat, and chicken. She dreams of owning her own food shop.

Riziki will share this loan with her loan group Nguvu Moja, which consists of 5 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying their loan.

loans.use: to buy both charcoal for cooking and food stock such as rice, beans, flour, cooking oil, meat, and chicken.

loans.name: Mpipi Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her mid 50's is single with three children who are still in school. She has been running two projects: a grocery store and a food vending business for ten years now. She works from 6 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mary's tenth loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on mama-lishe production, then opened a grocery store and has repaid all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, build two more rooms on her house for renting and covered household expenses.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She will use this loan to buy drinks for the grocery store and to buy and cook the fast moving types of food. She dreams of buying a car.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group "Mpipi" that has three members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks for the grocery store and to buy and cook the fast moving types of food.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es: Reina vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace varios años una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la variedad de productos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Reina lives in her own home along with her family. For several years, she has been managing a store that is located at her place of residence. She has many customers because of the good prices and the variety of products that she offers. With the income she earns from her sales, Reina has been able to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, sweet bread, and other products. As a result, she will have more income and be able to achieve a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, sweet bread, and other products.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel lives in Hoima Uganda. He is aged 40 married with four children and all attend school. He deals in produce mainly buying and selling of maize, rice, and beans among other items, supplemented by incomes from farming. He desires to expand and pay school fees for his children. He will use the loan facility to buy more maize to sell. Daniel faces a difficulty that greatly affects his business growth.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer de 29 años muy trabajadora, entusiasta, muy sonriente y creedora de que las cosas mejoraran, es madre de 2 hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad, los tiene estudiando y mantiene su hogar gracias a una venta de alimentos en un carro de comida ubicado en algún parque de la ciudad de Medellín.
Diana es sincera y es consciente de que inicio su negocio como necesidad, pero poco a poco le ha ido cogiendo pasión a su nuevo estilo de vida. 
Ella quiere pasar de vender en un puesto de comida a tener un local comercial, ofrecer más productos, aumentar su cantidad de clientes y sus utilidades y solo lo puede hacer vendiendo más, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de silletería, mesas y carpas  que no solo le sirvieran en su puesto de alimentos, si no que le servirán una vez consiga un local para mudarse.
texts.en:
Diana is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman who is 29 years of age. She is constantly smiling and is optimistic that things will improve. Diana is the mother of two children, ages 8 and 2. She is also studying and maintaining her home thanks to her food cart business that is located at a park in the city of Medellín.

Diana was sincere and conscientious when she started her business out of necessity. Over time, she has become passionate about her new lifestyle. Diana wants to move her business to a food stall that is located at a shopping center where she will be able to offer more products, increase the number of customers, and earn more profits as a result of selling more. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy chairs, tables, and canopies. Not only will she able to use these items at her food cart, she can continue to use them when she moves her business.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, and canopies.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 34 years old and is married with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school in Hoima, Uganda. 

Ibrahim earns a salary from teaching which has given him income to support his family. He hopes to educate his children and build a good house. His main challenges are both the long walk to his school and delayed salary payments. 

Ibrahim will use his loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Fredrick's Group

texts.en:
Fredrick's Group is formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega, North District and is being represented by Fredrick, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 40 years old, is married and has four children. Fredrick has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Fredrick is not new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has learnt a lot from farming training. This year, Fredrick will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Fredrick's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a very hardworking married man father of three children; only one attends school. He deals in produce mainly buying and selling of beans, maize, rice, supplemented by incomes from selling spare parts for motorcycles in Hoima, Uganda. He intends to prosper more and also pay school fees for his child. He is seeking for credit to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Rapheal

texts.en:
Rapheal is a very a hardworking married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of 3 children in Hoima, Uganda. 

Rapheal operates a retail shop where he mainly sells goods like salt, bread, soap, and sugar among other items. In addition, he earns some income from rentals he owns. He dreams of growing and expanding his business; however, his challenge is inadequate capital. 

Rapheal is seeking credit to buy more inventory to sell such as sugar, salt, and soap.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell such as sugar, salt, and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy charcoal.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 40 years old and is married with 9 children, 7 of whom attend school. 

John previously obtained a loan and ventured into selling spare parts for motorcycles. He also supplements his income with farming. He dreams of both developing his business and being able to pay his children's school fees. 

John will use his loan to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products, like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Taytacha Señor De Ccoyllority De Yungaqui Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Elisabeth ella es viuda y tiene 37 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganadería, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar ganado.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo en sus diferentes negocios porque no asistieron el dia de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Taytacha Señor de Ccoyllority de Yungaqui”. This bank is located in the District of Anta in Anta Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Elisabeth is one of the members. She is 37 years old, widowed, and has three children. Elisabeth works at her livestock business where she fattens and sells livestock before selling them at various fairs. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. Elisabeth wants to get ahead as a result of her work. She dreams of expanding her business of selling livestock. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to buy livestock.

The members who appear in the attached photos had their pictures taken at their respective businesses because they were not able to attend the meeting and received permission to be absent for work reasons. The other group members engage in businesses such as selling animals, raising livestock, managing a grocery store, and working in agriculture.

Elisabeth is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Abesiga Group

texts.en:
Jackline is a 30-year-old married female. She grows maize as her major crop and lives in Masindi, Uganda with one child. She runs a retail shop that sells general merchandise for additional income. The need to sustain her family led her to start up these businesses. She dreams of educating her children and modernizing her farm. Price fluctuation and weather vagaries have remained a challenge to meet her dream. She is a hardworking woman who wants a loan to weed and buy pesticides.

The extra person in the photo is also a group member who has savings with the group and has guaranteed his fellows but has not taken a loan.

loans.use: to weed and buy pesticides.

loans.name: Mukole Central Group

texts.en: Topista is a 41-year-old hardworking woman who is married with two children. All of the children attend school and they live in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She owns a retail shop and does farming for extra income. She started the business so as to have a source of income to get fees for her children. She is a member of Mukole Central Group where members guarantee one another to get a loan.  Topista needs a loan to buy beer, soda, and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 52-year-old hardworking married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Charles has operated a retail shop of general merchandise 7 days a week, 12 hours a day since 2009. Charles wanted to earn a living and be self employed. He has a dream of expanding his business in order to prepare for his old age. Charles is requesting money to buy rice, maize flour, cooking oil, cassava flour and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize flour, cooking oil, cassava flour and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, de 29 años de edad, no estudio debido a la falta de recursos económicos, está soltero y vive junto a sus padres.

Juan, se dedica a la albañilería y trabaja en la agricultura, es una fuente de ingresos que obtiene para su hogar, su padre le apoya el en trabajo del campo.

Juan, solicita el préstamo para comprar teja y madera para arreglar la casa de sus padres, ya que se acerca el invierno y la madera está dañada, de esa manera logrará que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.

El sueño de Juan es, arreglar poco a poco la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Juan is 29 years old and was not able to study due to a lack of financial resources. He is single and lives with his parents.

Juan is a bricklayer, but he also works in agriculture. The income he earns is used to sustain his household. His father helps him with the farm work. Juan is requesting a loan in order to buy tiles and wood for repairing his parents’ house. The wood is damaged, and with winter approaching, the loan will help his family live under better conditions.

Juan’s dream is to make gradual repairs to his parents’ house.

loans.use: to buy tiles and wood for repairing his parents’ house.

loans.name: Bajramsha

texts.en:
Bajramsha wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan she was given in order to facade the inside and outside of the house. By completing this home repair, she has been able to improve the insulation of her home, keeping the heat in and the cold out, resulting in both a better quality of living and comfort and savings on costs of utilities. 

Since her husband passed away, she has always worked hard at whatever she could find, and due to the hardships the situation had created, she often was depressed and had to rely on social pension and humanitarian organizations for assistance. 

Now, she is feeling much better and more confident and would like to restart her old business she ran together with her husband of selling clothing in a market. Now, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase shoes to start selling at a profit. She is looking foward to working again and being able to contribute to her family in a positive and productive way. 

She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to own her own shop and sell from there so that she can sell even during the winter and summertime, when it's difficult to be in the market. She is grateful for the lenders' continued support.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to start selling at a profit

loans.name: Mary Goret I

texts.en: Mary Goret I lives in Kasese, Uganda. She is a hardworking woman who is divorced with three children. She began a retail business of general merchandise in 2010 to be self employed and look after herself. She has a dream of expanding her business, however market competition and limited capital are her major challenges. Mary Goret I is requesting money to buy rice, maize flour, sodas, sugar, and cooking oil for selling.

loans.use: to buy rice maize flour, sodas, sugar, and cooking oil for selling.

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Agée de 39 ans, Akuvi est une femme mariée et vit seule à Akodessewa. Pour exercer une activité et disposer d’un revenu pour répondre à ses besoins, Akuvi fait la couture des habits qu’elle vend à la mesure de ses clients. Akuvi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Akuvi veut acheter des tissus de pagnes et demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande afin de satisfaire agréablement ses clients et trouver le bénéfice pour étendre son activité
texts.en:
Akuvi is 39 years old, married, and lives alone in Akodessewa. 

In order to run a business and have enough income to meet her needs, Akuvi sews clothing that she sells to her clients. Akuvi buys her supplies once a month in the Grand Market of Lomé. She would like to buy pagnes (traditional wraparounds) and is asking for this loan to pay for her order. 

This will help her satisfy her clients and earn the income she needs to keep her business going.

loans.use: buy 6 pieces of fabric

loans.name: Ruth Y Esther 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator of her group Ruth Y Esther (Ruth and Esther) 1, 2 & 3. This group is located in the Samana, a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure as a single mother with two children.

Rosa is excited to be taking her 13th loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling assorted items in the street, including balloons, candy, mints, etc. She will use the profits for her children and family by providing all that her family needs and to save to construct her own house. 

She hopes also to continue saving with Esperanza so that she can have a cushion when she can't work anymore. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy candies

loans.name: Jaison Jose

texts.es:
Jaison es un hombre muy sonriente, alegre, calculador, muy responsable y respetuoso, que con su legumbrera ha encontrado una forma para ganar el sustento diario para su familia que la conforman su pareja y un hijo de 2 años de edad.
Aunque Jaison no gane millones, no sea muy exitoso es feliz y es lo más importante, tiene lo necesario y aunque no es conformista agradece tener un trabajo que le ayuda a alimentar a su familia. 
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de verduras, frutas para abastecer su negocio, principalmente es para tener el capital de trabajo pues tiene un negocio que hay que surtirlo casi que diario ya que son productos que se vencen rápidamente.
Su sueño es ver crecer a su hijo sano, que estudie y se capacite para ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Jaison is a cheerful, calculating, extremely responsible, and respectful man who is always smiling. He owns a produce stand where is able to make a living in order to support his family, which consists of his partner and their two-year-old son.

Although Jaison does not successfully earn millions of dollars, he is happy – which is the most important thing to him. He has what he needs even though he is not a conformist. Jaison is grateful to have a job that helps him to feed his family.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy vegetables and fruits to restock his business. His primary goal is to have operating capital for his business because he needs to acquire stock just about every day since his products sell quickly.

Jaison’s dream is to see his son grow up healthy so that he can study and be trained to make something out of his life.

loans.use: to restock his business with fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy charcoal.

loans.name: Salomon 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Elsa is the coordinator of her group named Salomon 1 & 2 from the city of Samana's Peninsula - a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their three children. 

Elsa is excited to be taking her 18th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, which is a little store where she sells clothes and underwear, and she will increase her business inventory. 

She will use the profits to provide for her family and to save for a better future. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes and underwear

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Sera is 48 years old and married with 4 children. 

She has had a grocery business for 15 years. She will be using the loan to purchase fruits and cereals such as maize, beans and rice to sell to her customers and increase her income. She also hopes this will help her to expand her business and become the best cereal and fruit supplier in the area.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business by opening a cereal milling business.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, rice and fruits to sell to her customers and get more income to support her family.

loans.name: Juana Perez

texts.es: Juana de 56 años de edad es viuda y vive en casa propia con su hija quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 21 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y la ayuda de su hija, Juana ha podido salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana is 56 years old, widowed, and lives in her own home along with her daughter who works and helps out financially.

Juana has been making clothes for 21 years. Her sewing workshop is located at her place of residence and she has many customers because of the quality of her work. With the income she earns and with the help of her daughter, Juana has been able to stay ahead of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, elastics, and other supplies. As a result, she can continue her work and generate a good income.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, elastics, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 55 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from internet café.

Rosemarie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marichel

texts.en:
Marichel is 45 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marichel has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Marichel requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Marichel has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marichel would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Gloria

texts.en:
Ma. Gloria is 34 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.
