Aireen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim, 44, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of two dependent children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business, grows rice and sells her agricultural produce to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this type of business for sixteen years. On average, she can make an income of USD 5.00 per day.

Sim is facing a challenge with water utilization. Therefore, she would like to request a Kiva loan to buy a water pump for household use. With the support of this loan, she hopes she will have a convenient way for her family members to access water. She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a water pump

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever es un hombre de 27 años de edad esta simplemente unido de hecho con su esposa con la que tiene un hermoso hijo de 1 año, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Para Ever no hay nada más importante que su hermosa familia, pues para darle lo necesario,el desde hace 7 años se dedica a brindar servicios de trasporte a las personas que tienen la necesidad de trasportarse de su comunidad al centro de su pueblo, para Ever esta actividad es bastante productiva pues gracias a ello ha logrado mantener a su familia, pero él y su familia aún no cuenta con un terreno propio y en estos días los terrenos tienen un precio bastante elevado, pero para Ever no hay peor lucha que la que no se hace, es por eso que él quiere comprar un terreno pero con los ingresos que el obtiene no le alcanza para realizar esta compra, el junto a su señora han decidido realizar un préstamo para que puedan compra el terreno que es bastante necesario para ellos.
Para Ever y su esposa no hay nada más importante que poder conseguir este préstamo  y poder comprar su terreno.
texts.en:
Ever is a 27-year-old man who has a wife with whom he has a beautiful, 1-year-old son. He lives in a town in Sololá.

There is nothing more important to Ever than his beautiful family. To give them what they need, he has worked for the past seven years providing transport services to those who need to travel from his community to the centre of town. This activity is quite profitable for Ever as it has allowed him to support his family. However, he and his family don't yet have their own land, and these days land is rather expensive.

Nevertheless, for Ever, it is better to fight than just sit around ding nothing, which is why he wants to buy a plot of land. He is unable to do so with his earnings, which are insufficient. Therefore, he and his wife have decided to get a loan so they can buy some land, which they need.

The most important thing for Ever and his wife is to get this loan and buy their land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Roxill

texts.en:
Roxill is 28 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Roxill has a soft drink retailing business in the Philippines. Roxill requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of soft drinks to offer for sale.

Roxill has been in this business for two years. In the future, Roxill would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks to offer for sale.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 33 years old and is a married woman with five children. Four of her children are in school, and she is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Melanie has a hardware business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock for her hardware business.

Melanie has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her hardware business.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Sololá, para Pascual el tener acceso a los créditos le ha ayudado a superar grandemente, pues él cuenta que gracias al crédito anterior el logro comprar un terreno que actualmente lo está utilizando, pero para Pascual contar con suficiente terreno es importante para que sus hijos tengan lugares aptos donde puedan cultivar o construir, es por eso que solicita un nuevo préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar un terreno que le están ofreciendo a aun buen precio y Pascual quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad.
Ahora Pascual anhela también poder colocar una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Pascual is 52 years old and lives with his family in a town in Sololá. For Pascual, having access to the loans has really helped him to move forwards. He says that thanks to his last loan, he was able to buy a plot of land which he now uses. However, for Pascual, having enough land is important so that his sons have suitable places to grow crops or build on, which is why he is requesting a new loan which he will use to buy a plot of land which is being offered to him for a good price still. Pascual wants to take advantage of this opportunity. Today, Pascual also wants to set up a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of used shoes

loans.name: Phillipsonne

texts.fr:
Phillipsonne est une femme courageuse de 35 ans qui est née à la campagne et qui à du migrer en ville pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Elle est séparée de son mari depuis quelques année et vit seule dans une maison dont elle est locataire. Elle a 2 enfants qui vivent avec leur grands parents en zone rurale à 90 Km de chez elle. C'est elle seule qui tente de répondre aux besoins financiers de sa famille.

Elle a commencée il y a 8 ans une activité d'épicerie devant son domicile où elle vend des produits de premières nécessitées aux habitants de son quartier située dans le centre ville de la commune urbaine d'Antsirabe. Elle veut renforcer son capital en achetant des marchandises supplémentaires.

Elle veut continuer à supporter sa famille en assurant financièrement les besoins alimentaires et la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle a suivi plusieurs formation économiques sur la gestion d'une activité génératrice de revenus et souhaite aujourd'hui diversifier le nombre de produits qu'elle propose dans son épicerie. 

A terme elle souhaite acheter un terrain et construire une maison pour que ses enfants puissent vivre avec elle.
texts.en:
Vololona is a courageous 35-year-old woman, who was born in the country and had to move to the city to take care of her children's needs. She has been separated from her husband for several years and lives by herself in a rental house. She has 2 children who live with their grandparents in the rural area 90 km away from her. She is the only one who tries to take care of her family's financial needs.

8 years ago, she opened a grocery store in front of her home, where she sells basic needs products to the residents of her neighborhood in the center of the urban area of Antsirabe. She wants to increase her stock by buying more merchandise.

She wants to continue to support her family by covering her children's food and schooling needs. She has taken several trainings in business management and would now like to diversify the products she sells in her grocery store.

In the long term, she hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house, so that her children can come live with her.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products (oil, eggs, rice, flour...)

loans.name: Joanarison

texts.fr:
Joanarison est un petit agriculteur performant. Il a 38 ans, il est marié et à déjà 4 enfants. Il vit à la campagne et pratique depuis 15 ans des activités de culture maraichères. Il est notamment réputé pour produire de l’ail de très bonne qualité. 

Il est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 4 ans et a pu obtenir des prêts d’un montant de plus en plus important. Il a notamment pu acheter un cochon d’engraissement avec le prêt précédent et s’apprête à vendre celui-ci. 

L’objectif de ce prêt c’est de pouvoir développer ces cultures de tomates et d’ail en achetant des semences de bonne qualité, des engrais, des produits phyto sanitaire. 

Son objectif dans la vie c’est de pouvoir financer la scolarisation de ses enfants et de construire une maison en dur.
texts.en:
Joanarison is a high-performing small-scale farmer. He is 38 years old, married and already has 4 children. He lives in the country and has been growing vegetables for the past 15 years. He is known mostly for the production of very high-quality garlic.

He has been a Vahatra partner for the past 4 years and has obtained loans of increasing size. He has notably been able to purchase a pig for fattening with his previous loan, and is getting ready to sell the pig.

The goal of this loan is to be able to develop his tomato and garlic growing businesses by buying high-quality seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides. 

His objective in life is to be able to pay for his children's schooling, and to construct a durable home.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow tomatoes and garlic

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy piglets and flour

loans.name: Christophe

texts.fr:
Christophe est un homme de la terre. Il vit avec sa famille dans une zone rurale ou il possède une petite ferme et pratique des activités de culture et d’élevage. Il a 5 enfants et il est marié. Sa femme l’aide pour les travaux des champs et pour l’élevage des cochons. Agé de 51 ans, il a une solide expérience dans les métiers de la ferme.
 
Il est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 4 ans et a déjà pu bénéficier de plusieurs prêts d’un montant croissant ce qui lui a notamment permis de construire une étable pour ses 2 vaches. Avec ce prêt, Christophe souhaite développer des cultures de tomates et de pomme de terre. Pour cela, il a notamment besoin d’acheter des engrais, des pesticides et des semences. 

Son but à long terme, c’est d’améliorer son niveau de vie et de financer les études de ses enfants. Pour cela, il a conscience qu’il doit augmenter le capital des différentes activités de sa ferme.
texts.en:
Christophe is a man of the land. He lives with his family in a rural area where he has a small farm where he grows crops and raises livestock. He has 5 children and is married. His wife helps him with the work in the fields and raising pigs. 51 years old, he has solid experience in farming.

He is a partner of Vahatra since 4 years ago and has already received several loans with increasing amounts, which has allowed him most notably to construct a manger for his 2 cows. With this loan, Christophe would like to develop his tomato and potato crops. For this, he needs to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seeds. 

His goal in the long term is to improve his livelihood and pay for his childrens' studies. For this, he knows he needs to increase his investment in the different activities on his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and flour

loans.name: Normita

texts.en:
Normita is 43 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Normita is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Normita has been raising pigs for 12 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Isabela

texts.es:
Isabela tiene 47 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda hija de 15 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad de Sololá.
Isabela es una gran mujer porque lucha de sol a sol para que a su familia no le haga falta nada, para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo para mantener a su familia ella se dedica a la producción de banano y venta de banano esta actividad lo realiza ella desde hace 15 años, esta labor lo aprendió de sus padres, ella se preocupa porque su familia algún día cuente con un lugar mejor donde puedan construir, lugar con la que no cuentan en este momento, entonces ella ha tomado la iniciativa de comprar un terreno pero una de las dificultades que Isabela tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder hacerlo es por eso que solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de su terreno.
El sueño de Isabela es poder construir su casa en el terreno que piensa comprar.
texts.en:
Isabela is 47 years old. She is married and has a pretty 15-year-old daughter. She lives with her husband in a town in Sololá.

Isabela is a fine woman who struggles from sunup to sundown so that her family will lack for nothing. She grows and sells bananas to earn an income and help her husband support the family. She learned how from her parents, and has been doing it for 15 years. 

She hopes that her family will be able to have a better place where they might build in the future, something that they do not have now. To do this, she has taken the initiative to buy a plot of land, but one of the difficulties that Isabela faces is that she does not have enough money to do so. This is why Isabela is requesting a loan, which she will invest in purchasing her plot of land. 

Isabela’s dream is to be able to build a house on the land that she hopes to buy.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 64 years old is married with four children. For the past ten years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Corazon has borrowed 12 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Corazon is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Angel Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón es productor de café desde hace 14 años. ÉL vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Ramón ha iniciado el proceso para la  producción de café orgánico, él necesita un préstamo de 5.600.000 para construir un secadero de café que le permitirá mejorar la calidad y suplir la necesidad en cosecha de secado del café. Ramón desea certificarse como productor orgánico, sembrar 4.000 árboles más y que además del café todos los productos de su finca sean orgánicos. A nivel familiar el desea mejorar su calidad de vida, la de su familia y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.


La conversión y producción de café orgánico es un proceso integral al largo plazo independiente, saludable, balanceado y amigable con el medio ambiente lo que representa un desafío para los campesinos de Colombia y Ramón ha decidido no arriesgar su salud; la de su familia ni la de los consumidores, al seguir usando químicos. La Federación Campesina del Cauca está convencida que vale la pena apoyar y fortalecer estas iniciativas alternas. Un préstamo con Kiva representa un futuro sostenible por su producción, su tierra, y su familia.
texts.en:
Ramón has been a coffee farmer for 14 years. He lives with his wife and children. Ramón has started the process to produce organic coffee. He needs a loan of 5,600,000 to build a coffee drying room which will allow him to improve quality and meet the need to dry coffee during the harvest. Ramón wants to obtain certification as an organic farmer, plant 4,000 more trees and make not just the coffee but all of the produce on his farm organic. On a personal level, he wants to improve he and his family's quality of life and support his children in their studies.

The conversion to and production of organic coffee is a comprehensive process which is, in the long-term, independent, healthy, harmonious and environmentally-friendly. It represents a challenge to Columbian farmers, and Ramón has decided not to jeopardise the health of himself, his family or consumers by continuing to use chemicals. The Federación Campesina del Cauca (Cauca Peasant Federation) is convinced that supporting and stregthening these alternative initiatives is worthwhile.

A loan with Kiva represents a sustainable future for his crop, his land, and his family.

loans.use: to convert to organic production.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гульнара, 51 год,замужем, есть 5 детей. Сейчас Гульнара занимается полеводством на собственном участке мерою 3,0 ГА, где выращивает фасоль. Свой бизнес она начала 15 лет назад с 10,000 сом. У Гульнары также есть 3 коровы и 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход Гульнары составляет около 17,000 сом. По характеру человек очень честный, целеустремленный и трудолюбивый. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Гульнара обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закуп 2 дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации молока. Доходы от бизнеса Гульнара собирается направить на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и постройку дома.
texts.en: Gulnara is 51, married, and has five children. She currently grows beans on her own 3.0 hectare plot of land. She started her business 15 years ago with 10,000 som. Gulnara also has three cows and six sheep and her monthly income is around 17,000 som. By nature she is an honest, determined and hardworking person. In order to expand her business in the future, Gulnara applied for a loan of 100,000 som with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy two dairy cows to increase her milk sales. She plans to use her profits to invest in developing her business and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to increase her organic milk sales

loans.name: Mujeres Al Progreso Group

texts.es: “MUJERES AL PROGRESO” está conformada por socios dedicados al comercio minoristas y a prestar servicios. Marizola tiene 42 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa a través de pedidos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de uniformes para niños y adolescentes blusas camisas faldas pantalones por campaña escolar. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Marizola es la primera persona parada del lado derecho viste chompa de color lila.
texts.en: The “MUJERES AL PROGRESO” communal bank is made up of members working in retail businesses and services. Marizola is 42 years old, is married and has 2 dependent children. She works selling clothing by order. The loan will be invested in buying children's and adolescent's uniforms, blouses, shirts, skirts and pants for the school year. The group would like to thank the Kiva lenders for the loan provided. Marizola is the first person standing on the right wearing a lilac colored sweater.

loans.use: to buy school clothing.

loans.name: Juntos Triunfaremos En Cocachacra Group

texts.es: El grupo “JUNTOS TRIUNFAREMOS EN COCACHACRA”  es un grupo responsable en sus cuotas.  Rosa tiene 41 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos educando. Ella implemento su bodega en su vivienda el cual dedicarse a sus hijos y a su negocio. De esa manera puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes bebidas azúcar arroz y leche.  El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Rosa es la primera persona parada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
The “JuntosTriunfaremos en Cocachacra” group (Together We Will Triumph in Cocachacra) is responsible with their payments. 

Rosa is 41 years old, in a common-law relationship, and is raising two children. She began a small grocery store inside her home, where she devotes herself to her children and her business. 

With her business, she helps her husband with the household expenses. The loan will be invested in the purchase of more grocery supplies such as sugar, rice and milk. 

The group thanks KIVA investors for the loan they have provided. Rosa is the first person standing on the right side.

loans.use: to buy more grocery supplies such as drinks and dairy products.

loans.name: Avenida Las Palmas Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Avenida las Palmas" se conformó en una comunidad indígena de la cultura mazahua. En el lugar, las actividades más sobresalientes son la siembra de maíz y la ganadería. De hecho, otra de las características de las integrantes, aparte de la amistad que las une, es que todas ellas se dedican a criar animales, siguiendo la tradición del lugar donde viven.

Andrea es la líder del equipo, es una mujer sonriente pero el atributo que más la distingue es su amabilidad. Ella tiene 34 años y está casada con Germán quien se dedica a la construcción de casas. La pareja dio vida a 8 hijos, aunque ya sólo 3 dependen económicamente de ellos.

Hace 4 años, Andrea comenzó a criar borregos porque fue una actividad que aprendió gracias a sus padres, además de que le permite permanecer en su casa para dedicar suficiente tiempo a su familia y a sus labores del hogar. A lo largo de este tiempo, ha podido observar cambios en su negocio "Gracias a mi experiencia, ya puedo mantener sanos a mis animales". Andrea recuerda que al principio los borregos se enfermaban continuamente, pero ahora cuenta con la ayuda de un veterinario de quien ha aprendido algunas prácticas y técnicas para mantener a los animales en mejores condiciones. Además actualmente ya tiene un lugar bien acondicionado para los borregos, que logró construir con sus ganancias. Andrea necesita comprar tres borregos más, ya que recientemente vendió los que tenía y desea continuar con la actividad. 

Andrea, agradecida y orgullosa de sus logros comenta que el apoyo económico y su esfuerzo hicieron posible tener una mejor vivienda para su familia. Recuerda que antes de comenzar a criar animales, su casa era muy pequeña y con sus 8 hijos, el espacio era insuficiente. 

Su gran sueño es ver a sus 3 hijos más pequeños terminar alguna carrera profesional para que tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo. 

Al comentar acerca de los créditos, Andrea compartió su experiencia: ella no confiaba en ningún tipo de préstamo, pero uno de sus vecinos quien le inspiraba respeto y confianza, le habló de VisionFund México y la invitó a unirse a su grupo de préstamo hace 5 años. El vecino de Andrea falleció al poco tiempo, pero ella lo sigue recordando con la misma admiración por el esfuerzo que dedicaba a su propia actividad y después de varios ciclos, ella sigue confiando y solicitando crédito que representa una oportunidad para seguir mejorando.

*En la imagen: Andrea es quien viste el suéter azul y una falda roja. Los integrantes están sentados al pie del quiosco en el centro del municipio donde viven, muy cerca también se encuentran la explanada, el palacio de gobierno y la iglesia católica.
texts.en:
The "Avenida las Palmas" was formed in a Mazahua culture native community. The most outstanding activities of the community are growing corn and raising livestock. In fact one of the characteristics apart from the friendship that ties them together they all raise animals following the tradition of the place where they live.

Andrea is the leader of the team and she is a smiling women whose most distinguishing trait is her friendliness. She is 34 years old, is married to Germán who works in building houses. The pair have given birth to 8 children although only 3 still depend on them economically.

Four years ago Andrea started to raise sheep as it was an activity sh learned from her parents. Plus it allowed her to stay at home and spend enough time for her family and her housework. Throughout this time she has noticed changes in her business. “Thanks to my experience I can keep my animals healthy”. Andrea remembers that at the beginning her animals were always sick but now she counts on the help of a vet who has taught them certain methods and techniques to keep the animals in better condition. Also she now has a place that is suitable for the sheep which she manged to build with her profits.

Andrea needs to buy 3 more sheep as she has recently sold the ones she had and wants to continue with her business. Andrea is grateful and proud of her gains, commented that the economic support and her efforts made it possible to have a better life for her family. She recalls that before starting to raise animals her house was very small and with 8 children there was not enough room. Her great dream is to see her 3 youngest children finish professional training to have better employment opportunities.

Commenting on the loans Andrea shared her thought that she didn't trust any type of loan but one of her neighbors who she trusted and respected talked to her about VisionFund México and invited her to join a loan group 5 years ago. Andrea's neighbor died shortly after but she continued to remember her with the same admiration for the effort that she dedicated to her own business, and after several loan cycles she continues to have confidence and request loans that are her best opportunity to continue to grow.

In the photo Andrea is wearing a blue sweater and a red skirt. The members are seated at the bottom of the kiosk in the cnter of the municipality they live in, very close to the esplanade, the City hall and the Catholic church.

.

loans.use: to buy 3 sheep, corn and fodder.

loans.name: Cfjdt 45 Group

texts.fr: CJFDT 45 est un sous groupe de la Convergence des Jeunes et Femmes pour le Développement de Tassette (village situé au niveau de la région de Thiès). Il est composé de 7 personnes dont 4 femmes et 3 hommes qui habitent tous dans le même village de Tassette et qui ont pris leur destin en main en luttant contre la pauvreté. Ils évoluent dans la commercialisation des produits halieutiques et la vente de poisson fraîche, sèche et fumé. Ils se réunissent tous les fins de mois pour organiser des tontines et discuter sur les stratégies à prendre pour sortir le village de Tassette de la pauvreté. SOKHNA est la présidente, on la reconnait sur la photo par la main levée et elle sollicite ce montant pour aller sur la petite cote pour acheter des poissons et produits halieutiques qu'elle vient vendre au niveau du village. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans et aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l'avenir elle voudrait renforcer son stock de marchandises et avec l'aide de l'institution diversifier ses produits et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi, elle pourra épargner de l'argent et construire sa maison qui est présentement en paille et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
CJFDT is a sub-group of the Convergence of Youths and Women for the Development of Tassette (a village which lies in the Thiès region). It is made up of seven people, four women and three men, who all live in the village of Tassette and have taken their fate into their own hands by fighting against poverty. They are developing the sale of fish products and fresh, dried and smoked fish. They meet up at the end of every month to organise "tontines" (a revolving finance system where each member contributes periodically an agreed amounts and this is passed on in rotation to the other members) and to discuss strategies for getting the village of Tassette out of poverty. 

Sokhna is the president of the group and is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is requesting this amount so that she can go to the small coast to buy fish and fish products which she will bring back to sell in the village. She is married and mother to six children. She has more than ten years' experience and helps her husband out with the daily outgoings and her children's school fees. In the future she would like to be able to boost her stock and, with the help of the institution, increase her income. By doing this she will be able to save money, rebuild her house, which is currently made out of straw, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing products and fish for resale.

loans.name: Delima

texts.en:
Delima is 43 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school. For the past year, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Delima has borrowed one previous loan from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Delima is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Inocencia Rovina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma. Inocencia Rovina works hard to support her family. She runs a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from operating a general store. Ma. Inocencia Rovina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF.

Ma. Inocencia Rovina is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more snack food to sell in her food stall. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more snack food to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 52-year-old married woman with two children. One of her children is in school. For the past four years, Elizabeth has run a food-vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 53 years old and widowed with four children. For the past four years, she has earned a living raising pigs in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from running a general store.

Ermelinda is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 34 years old and married, with three children. With three children in school, Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, and groceries.

Fe has been in this business for six years now. 

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, and groceries.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 53 years old with four children. For the past year, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Leonisa works very hard to provide for her family.

Leonisa is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as bread, canned goods, groceries, and other products. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy bread, canned goods, groceries, and other products

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a 26-year-old woman with two children who are both in school. For the past five years, she has sold charcoal in the Philippines. Liezel is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Liezel is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 48 years old and has three children. She is a married woman.

Lydia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lydia has been in this business for ten years now and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
Más de 15 años, celebra la señora María Esperanza de haber puesto una pulpería los créditos obtenidos anteriormente le han permitido aumentar su inventario y obtener más ingresos en la economía de su hogar y realizar mejoras a su casa. Ella a pesar de tener 72 años, se siente una mujer productiva, trabajadora y entusiasta, pues a diferencia de muchos adultos mayores, ha podido aprovechar las oportunidades de crecimiento que ha tenido. 

Entre los sueños de María, está convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora, porque en la actualidad, su negocio es el más próspero y variado de su zona, lo que le permite atraer más clientes.  Por ello, solicita un crédito para abastecer con más productos de mayor consumo y comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, papel higiénico, café, salsas de tomate, etc.
texts.en:
Señora María Esperanza is celebrating over 15 years of having a grocery store. The previous loans she was granted have enabled her to increase her stock, boost her family income and make home improvements. Although she is 72, she feels like a productive, hard-working and enthusiastic woman, because unlike many older adults, she has been able to take advantage of the opportunities for growth she has had.

María's dreams include converting her grocery store into a distribution facility because at present, her business is the most prosperous and varied in the area, which allows her to attract more customers. This is why she is requesting a loan to stock her store with more everyday products and buy rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, coffee, tomato sauce, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, coffee, tomato sauce, etc.

loans.name: Helenda

texts.en:
Helenda is 35 years old and is a married woman with one child. For the past two years, she has operated a business selling food supplements in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Helenda is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy Vita Plus to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy Vita Plus to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 29-year-old woman with one child. For the past three years, she has operated a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jennifer is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy buckets of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy buckets of fish to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional Vita Plus products to sell. Through her earnings, she has been able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

Julie is now requesting another 50,000 PHP loan to buy natural food supplements and multivitamins (Vita Plus Products) to meet the advanced orders of her regular customers. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial assistance that will be given to her. Her loan will surely help cover her family’s everyday personal and household needs.

In the future, Julie dreams to put up branches in other areas. She desires to help her less-privileged relatives and to live a victorious life. Julie faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy food supplements and vitamins (Vita Plus Products) needed in her business

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo's greatest dream in life is for his three children to finish their studies and become professionals someday. Through his experience, it is very important to finish college in order to get a better and stable job. 

Danilo is 32 years old and married. He and his wife are engaged in a retailing business. They have a sari-sari store in their village. To get higher income, Danilo rounds and delivers soft drinks around their village and nearby villages. Sometimes he cannot reach some of his customers because he only has minimal stocks due to lack of capital. 

In this connection, Danilo is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more soft drinks to sell. He believes that by having the loan, he can now extend his service to his customers and gain greater income, as well as provide for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is thankful that she was granted a PHP 20,000 loan, which she used to purchase various products and merchandise to sell in her store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her child to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another PHP 20000 loan, which she will use to buy ready-to-wear clothing, eyewear, beads, bracelets, and other similar products to sell in her store. 

She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and, thus, increase her earnings. She is encouraged by the positive sales. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her because it is a great help in providing their daily sustenance. 

Emma dreams of expanding her store to attract and serve more customers. She aims to send her youngest child to college and continue to live a quiet and godly life. 

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise necessary to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Sopriana

texts.en: Sopriana is 50 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school. Sopriana has been raising pigs for three years in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She  has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Sopriana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening. Marilyn is borrowing 6000 PHP through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), to buy ingredients for her food production business. Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира, 39 лет, не замужем, есть ребенок, учится в 10 классе. У Назиры высшее образование, работает учителем в школе. На протяжении многих лет в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается разведением скота. У Назиры в хозяйстве есть 6 коров и 20 овец. Назира известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух дойных коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена в будущем достроить свой дом.
texts.en: Nazira is 39 years old, not married and has a child, who attends 10th grade. Nazira has a college education and works as a teacher at a school. To provide additional income for her family, she has been involved in fattening up livestock for many years. Nazira has 6 cows and 20 sheep on her farm. Nazira is known as an honest, decent, and reliable person with strong principles. Today her business yields a monthly profit in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS). To further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy two dairy cows. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to develop her business and intends to finish building her house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows in order to increase the volume of organic milk sales

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 52 years old and married, with one child in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alma has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from food-vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zhannat

texts.ru: Жаннат, 35 лет, замужем, трое детей. У Жаннат среднее образование, работает кассиром, получая заработную плату в размере около 7,900 сом (KGS), также в качестве дополнительного дохода она занимается сельским хозяйством. Есть земельный надел размером 1,3 ГА, где Жаннат выращивает фасоль. реализуя оптовым покупателям. В этом году она решила сделать пристройку к дому, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов, тем самым улучшив жилищные условия. Доходы от бизнеса и заработную плату Жаннат планирует использовать для дальнейшего ремонта дома.
texts.en: Zhannat is 35 years old, married and has three children. Zhannat has a secondary education and works as a cashier, earning a salary of about 7,900 som (KGS). To provide additional income, she is also involved in agriculture. Zhannat has 1.3 hectares of land, where she grows beans for sale to wholesale customers. This year she decided to build an addition to her house and hence requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy construction materials in order to improve her living conditions. Zhannat plans to use the earnings from the business and job to continue renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build an addition to her house

loans.name: Khay

texts.en: Khay is 35 years old and the mother of one young son. She lives in a rural area located in Battambang Province’s Koh Krolo District, Cambodia. She has been a farmer for four years growing rice and corn. She makes 28,000 KHR per day as a farmer. Khay has requested a loan of 2,000,000 KHR through Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. This is the second loan for Khay with VisionFund. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza De Corcona Group

texts.es: Carmen tiene 35 años de edad es soltera con 02 hijos educando. Ella implemento su bodega en su vivienda el cual le permite mantener a sus hijos  y puede dedicarse a ellos. El crédito lo invertía en la compra de más abarrotes bebidas golosinas y productos lácteos. El grupo “LA NUEVA ESPERANZA DE CORCONA” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Carmen es la primera persona sentada del lado derecho viste chompa beige
texts.en: Carmen is 35 years old, single, and has two school-aged children. She set up a grocery store in her home, which allows her to support her children and look after them. She will invest the loan in buying more groceries, drinks, sweets and dairy products.The “La Nueva Eesperanza De Corcona" group thanks Kiva lenders for the loan. Carmen is the first woman sat on the right wearing a beige sweater.

loans.use: to buy more sweets, drinks and groceries.

loans.name: Asilkan

texts.ru: Асилкан 60 лет, вдова, младший сын живет с матерью. У Асилкан среднее образование, с много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве Асилкан на сегодняшний день есть: 1 корова, 13 овец, а также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 1,40 ГА, она выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS), этих средств безусловно не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Асилкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы и нетели. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Асилкан и ее семьи и накопить на постройку сарая для ее семьи.
texts.en: Asilkan is 60 years old, a widow and lives with her youngest son. Asilkan has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for many years. Today, Asilkan has 1 cow, 13 sheep and 1.40 hectares of land, where she grows barley. Her monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS), but this money is not enough for a decent life. In order to further develop her business, Asilkan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a dairy cow and a heifer. The earnings from the loan will help improve Asilkan's and her family's welfare and save money to build a barn for her farm.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and a heifer to help bolster her income

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 40 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emma has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, egg, rice and other groceries. 

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zhanargul

texts.ru: Жанаргул, 30 лет, не замужем. У Жанаргул высшее образование, она много лет в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав с 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жанаргул, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы. Для животных заготовлены сено и корма, на лето отгоняют скот на пастбище. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жанаргул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Zhanargul is 30 years and not married. Zhanargul has a college education and, to provide the primary income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry for many years, having started this business with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zhanargul's hard work, currently her farm contains 4 cows. Hay and feed have been prepared for the livestock, and the livestock gets sent to a pasture in the summer. The monthly income amounts to about 8,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Zhanargul requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy sheep. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан, 53 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Бурулкан- среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Бурулкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы и 10 овец, а также 1,20 ГА собственного земельного надела, где Бурулкан в основном выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка. Она является лидером группы "Береке-3" , в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на покупку земельного надела для полеводства.
texts.en: Burulkan is 53 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. Burulkan has a secondary education and, to provide additional income for her family, is involved in farming and animal husbandry. Thanks to Burulkan's hard work, today her farm contains 2 cows and 10 sheep, and also 1.20 hectares of land, where she primarily grows beans for sale, Her monthly income amounts to 14,500 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Burulkan requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a bull. She is a leader of the "Bereke-3" group that, besides her, consists of 2 more people, with 3 of them all together. She wants to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount and plans to save money to buy a land plot for farming.

loans.use: to buy a bull for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Hourng

texts.en:
Hourng is 58 years old and has two children. She earns a living through farming rice and growing corn, which she has been doing for seven years. She earns about 55,000 KHR per day to feed her family.
 
Hourng requested another loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy sesame seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She used her past loans from VisionFund to better support her family’s living and her business. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sesame seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, iron, cement, and gravel.

loans.name: Leticia Janeth

texts.es: Leticia tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 14 años y 9 años de edad. Leticia trabaja como jornalera en una cooperativa desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera para cambiar el techo de la vivienda que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado.
texts.en: Leticia is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and two children aged 14 and 19. Leticia has worked as a labourer in a cooperative for a long time, which is how she earns a living and supports her family. With the desire to improve her living conditions, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI  to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to replace the room of her home which is currently damaged.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to replace the room of her home.

loans.name: Demps Allen

texts.en:
Despite of not fulfilling his dream to become a seaman, Demps Allen did not lose his hope to succeed in his life.  He did stop to find a way to be able to fulfill his dream and help his parents to meet their basic necessities. Demps Allen is single, and is engaged in a beauty salon business. He offers hair styling, hair cutting, and hair coloring for men and women. 

Demps Allen wants to offer more activities in his beauty salon business, and explore his skills to improve his service to his regular customers. With this, he wanted to borrow a loan of P25,000 to buy tools and materials for operating his business. 

He hopes for continuous improvement of the business, gaining more costumers to serve, and gain a larger income.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials for operating his business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marisa is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marisa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marisa has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Myrna is 57 years old and one of her children is in school.

Myrna has a charcoal-making business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy coconut shells to use in her business.

Myrna has been in this business for two years. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells to use in her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 26 years old and married with two children. Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Grace runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Grace has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 29 years old and has two children. 

Noemi is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Noemi requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Noemi has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Noemi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Joryn

texts.en:
Joryn is a 35-year-old married mother of three children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Joryn has a general store business in the Philippines. Joryn requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, and eggs to sell.

Joryn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Joryn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a 56-year-old married mother of three children, one in school. 

Teodora is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Teodora requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teodora has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 45 years old and married. Editha works very hard to provide for her family.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, cigarettes, and eggs..

Editha has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, cigarettes, and eggs.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell used shoes business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear. Melanie is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy bundles of used shoes to sell for her buy and sell used shoes business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used shoes

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Prescilla works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Prescilla is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy an additional stock of charcoal to sell to customers.

Prescilla has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of charcoal

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 35 years old, and she is married with two children, who are both in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Theresa is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Theresa has been raising pigs for two years, and she also earns income from selling food.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 45-year-old mother of one child, who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Alicia has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like nail cutters to use in her business.

Alicia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Alicia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like nail cutters to use in her business

loans.name: Ma. Mae

texts.en:
Ma. Mae is 27 years old and married with three children, two in school, she is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Mae has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Ma. Mae requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more rice to sell.

Ma. Mae has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ma. Mae would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Socheat is 29 years old and married with three children. She and her husband have worked very hard for seven years to support their family by growing rice and catching fish. The current business earns them about 26,000 KHR per day.

This is the sixth loan for Socheat with VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Samaki Meanchey District

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es:
Mario, de 53 años de edad, no pudo ir a la escuela porque empezó a trabajar desde muy temprano edad, está soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con unos sobrinos.

Mario, se dedica a cuidar un vivero de tortugas en la playa, tiene tres años de trabajar en ese lugar, antes fue pescador, aún pesca pero ya no para vender, si no para consumo de la familia.- La distancia que recorre Mario, para llegar a su trabajo es de 3 kilómetros.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar semilla de marañón, para poder comercializarla, ya que se acerca la temporada de esa fruta y quiere aprovechar para invertir.

Los sueños de Mario, son comercializar la semilla de marañón en grandes cantidades, para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, con más ingresos.
texts.en:
Mario, 53, wasn't able to attend school because he started working at a very young age.  He's single and has no children, and he lives with some nieces and nephews.

Mario has earned a living for three years taking care of a turtle hatchery at the beach.  Before that he was a fisherman.  He still fishes, but no longer to sell, only for his family's consumption.  Mario travels three kilometers to get to work.

He's going to invest the loan in buying cashew seeds to sell.  Cashew season is approaching and he wants to take advantage of his investment.

Mario's dream is to sell large quantities of cashew seeds to improve his family's quality of life with more income.

loans.use: to buy cashew seeds

loans.name: Charn

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Battambang province’s Kos Krolor district, Charn is 46 years old and married. He has a dependent son who is still in school. Charn and his wife are farmers who grow rice and plant corn as main businesses to support the family. Having been in the business for 11 years, they are able to make daily earning of 29,000 KHR.

This is the first loan for Charn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now applying for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR, he is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticide for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to extend his farmland and also grow his crops healthily to make more income to improve his living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide for his farmland

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district, Thorn is now 32 years old and married. She has three children. Thorn and her husband are farmers who have been growing rice and sesame for 10 years. The current business earns them about 32,000 KHR per day to support the family’s needs. 

Thorn is a third-cycle client with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, and she completely paid back the past loans. Her previous loans helped her to relieve her family’s financial burden and generate more income for her family. With her good business, she is applying for another loan of 1,700,000 KHR so as to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes the loan from VisionFund will enable her to produce more healthy rice to make more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Heap

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district, Heap is aged 33 years and married with two dependent children. She and her husband are farmers who have been planting corn and sesame for seven years to make a living. Together they can earn about KHR28,000 per day from the current business.

This is the third loan for Heap with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. 

Now applying for a loan of KHR2,000,000, she is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

She hopes to increase her farming production to generate more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Reap

texts.en:
Reap, 61, lives with her husband and one dependent daughter who is still in school, in a rural village of the Kos Krolo district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has struggled to feed and care for her child by farming rice and planting corn for ten years. Together, they can earn about KHR 40,000 per day.

Reap has been with VisionFund Cambodia for two cycles. She wisely and successfully used the loans from VisionFund Cambodia to relieve her family’s financial burden. She wants to use her loan to buy fertilizer and sesame for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor. 

She hopes to grow healthy rice and more healthy crops to make a better living and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and sesame for her farmland.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 46 years old and a responsible housewife who has engaged in selling fish within the public market for almost 15 years. This is her way of helping her husband in gaining income. She aims to continue and improve this business in order to earn a higher income and sustain the necessities of her family. 

Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to access an additional PHP10,000 from Kiva lenders to be used in purchasing more stock of fish to sell.

Being a patient and hardworking mother, she believes that someday she will improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Pronilda

texts.en: Pronilda is 38 years old, married to a tricycle driver and they're blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 13 years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net income from this business usually is spent on the school fees of their children. Due to insufficient capital from her business, she would like a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase rice, beverages, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, food seasonings, sugar, eggs, and coffee to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more productive so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beverages, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, food seasonings, sugar, eggs, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Jhoana Paula

texts.en:
Jhoana Paula is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. 

She is 20 years old, and a second-year student. Her mother is a retail store owner, while her father is a construction worker. She is very willing to finish her education and help her family. 

Due to insufficient funds to use for school, she is now asking a loan of P6,000 to pay her tuition fees. 

She hopes to achieve her dreams someday, with the help of her supportive parents.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Rayito De Sol Group

texts.es:
Rayito de Sol es un grupo de tradición en VisionFund México que lleva casi 8 años solicitando crédito en la institución, además de conservar un buen historial de pagos. El grupo se ubica en una comunidad mazahua en la cual la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican al comercio. Otra peculiaridad del lugar es que los mismos comerciantes salen a vender a ciudades distantes, dejando su hogar durante una semana, 15 días o hasta un mes completo. Los niños quedan al cuidado de los hermanos mayores o de sus abuelos. 

Maricela forma parte de Rayito de Sol, tiene 19 años, está casada con Eduardo y tiene una bebé. Los padres de Maricela siempre se han dedicado al comercio y de ellos aprendió la actividad. Desde hace 2 años, se ha dedicado a vender vasos y cuchillas para licuadora junto con su esposo aunque él es quien sale durante periodos largos para llegar a los lugares más lejanos, mientras que Maricela visita sólo las comunidades más cercanas para no descuidar a su pequeña.

Como buenos comerciantes, Maricela y Eduardo e incluso los demás habitantes de la comunidad, siempre están al día ofreciendo el tipo de mercancía que más compran las personas. Por temporadas también han llegado a vender almohadas y controles de televisión. Además, Maricela también cría y vende pollos y vende los huevos de sus gallinas para tener un ingreso extra. Los animales o huevos que no llega a vender, afortunadamente los puede ocupar para su propio consumo.

Hasta ahora, la pareja no ha probado establecer su negocio en un local. Para ellos es más común caminar entre las calles o entre mercados para vender sus productos. Sin embargo, Maricela está agradecida ya que los préstamos han promovido un cambio positivo en su vida: ahora tiene más mercancía para vender y siempre cuenta con suficiente dinero para cubrir sus necesidades. Recuerda que antes pedía prestado con sus vecinos para poder comprar hasta los alimentos más básicos y que esta acción era muy recurrente. Por fin, Maricela ha dejado esta práctica sólo en su memoria. Aun más importante para ella, fue que después del nacimiento complicado de su hija, contaba con el dinero suficiente para pagar un tratamiento en un hospital particular y que afortunadamente después de varios días de angustia en la familia, la niña pudo ir a casa sin mayor problema.

Después de días difíciles y grandes retos, Maricela sigue soñando con volver a la escuela y con tener una casa propia para su familia; sabe que lo logrará con su empeño y dando continuidad a sus actividades.

*En la imagen: las integrantes al pie del quiosco en el centro del municipio donde viven. Cerca también se encuentran el palacio de gobierno y la iglesia católica. Maricela viste un suéter blanco y tiene la mano muy cerca del rostro.
texts.en:
The “Rayito de Sol” is a group with an 8 year old tradition of requesting loans with VisionFund México and keeping a good repayment record. The group is located in a Mazahua community in which the majority of inhabitants are in commerce. Another notable characteristic is that these businesspeople go off to sell in distant cities, leaving their home for a week or two or a whole month. The children stay in the care of their older siblings or grandparents.

Maricela is part of the Rayito de Sol group. She is 19 years old, married with Eduardo and has a baby. Maricela's parents have always worked in commerce and she learned from them. For the past 2 years she has been selling glass containers and blades for blenders. She works with her husband although it is him that leaves for long periods to travel to distant places while Maricela only visits the closer communities so that she can take care of her child. As good merchants Maricela and Eduardo along with the other inhabitants keep up to date offering the merchandise bought most by people. At times they have also sold pillows and tv remotes.

Maricela also raises and sells chickens and sells their eggs to have another income. The ones they can't sell fortunately can be used for their own consumption. Up to now the couple have not tried to have s tore in their community. For them it is more common to go through the streets and markets to sell their products. However Maricela is grateful that the loan have made a positive change in their lives as now they always have enough merchandise to sell and always have enough money to cover their needs. She remembers before, asking for loans from neighbors to be able to buy the most basic food and that this occurred often.

Now Maricela has left this practice in her memory. Still more important to her that after a difficult birth of her daughter she still had enough money to pay for treatment in a private hospital. Fortunately after a number of agonizing days for the family the child was able to go home with no further problems. After difficult days and challenges. Maricela continues to dream of returning to school and of having their own house for the family. She knows that she can achieve this with effort and continue her activities.

In the photo the members are at the foot of the bandstand in the centre of the municipality where they live, close to City hall and the Catholic church. Maricela is wearing a white sweater and has her hand close to her face.

loans.use: to buy glass container and blades for blenders.

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 39 years old and married with two children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Merlinda has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Merlinda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a candle-making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her candle-making business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 55 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school.

Cecilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Cecilia has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Cecilia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 41 years old and married with seven children, three in school.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Mary Ann has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mary Ann aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is a 60-year-old married mother of six children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. .

Jovita has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Jovita requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Jovita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jovita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Kanyshbubu

texts.ru: Канышбубу, 54 года, замужем, 4 детей. Более 18 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день Канышбубу смогла развить свою деятельность, у нее есть 2 коровы, 10 овец. Супруг и дети активно и с удовольствием помогают по хозяйству.На участке мерою 1,74 Га она выращивает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 овец для разведения и увеличения поголовья скота. Канышбубу является участником группы "Береке-3", в которой состоят еще 2. Доходы от кредита Канышбубу планирует направить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kanyshbubu is 54 years old, married and has 4 children. She has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for over 18 years. Kanyshbubu has been able to develop her business and currently has 2 cows and 10 sheep. Her husband and children actively and gladly help with the business. She grows beans on 1.70 hectares of land. In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 4 sheep for fattening up and increasing her livestock headcount. Kanyshbubu is a member of the "Bereke-3" group that, besides her, consists of 2 more people. Kanyshbubu plans to direct the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and repairing her house.

loans.use: to buy 4 sheep for fattening up and increasing her livestock headcount

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es casada tiene 32 años de edad, tiene una linda hija, vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuela es una madre de familia que ama que las personas que quiere tengan todo lo necesario, es por eso que se esfuerza día con día para generar sus ingresos ella se dedica a la producción y venta de banano, esta labor lo realiza desde hace 10 años, para ella la producción y venta de banano es muy productiva pues gracias a ello ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, pero Manuela quiere incrementar su producción de banano pero para hacerlo se necesita de más terrenos, terrenos con los que ella no cuenta en este momento, pero ella no se limita ante nada es por eso que para conseguir lo que ella quiere solicita un préstamo  para poder comprar un terreno y aumentar su producción.
Manuela sueña poder hacer de su producción algo más grande y generar mejores ganancias  para poder tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Manuela is 32 years old, married, and has a beautiful daughter. She lives with her husband in a town in Sololá. Manuela is a mother who loves her loved ones to have everything they need. That's why she works hard every day to earn money. 

She makes a living growing and selling bananas, a job she has done for 10 years. For her, growing and selling bananas is very profitable because it has allowed her to support her family. However, Manuela wants to grow more bananas, for which she needs more land which she doesn't currently have. But she doesn't let anything stand in her way, which is why she is requesting a loan so that she can buy a plot of land and increase her banana production.

Manuela dreams of being able to grow more bananas and boost her earnings to that she can set up a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Kathreen

texts.en:
Kathreen is a 20-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband has been running his electrical appliance shop for the past 8 years. He is responsible for feeding his entire family and fulfilling their needs.

Kathreen's husband has to purchase electrical items such as fridges, washing machines and irons for his business but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to purchase these items. Therefore Kathreen has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the merchandise he needs for his business. This loan will also him to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.

Kathreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase electrical goods to increase his business

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam, 62, is married and residing in a rural village of the Sami Meanchey district of Kampong Channang province. To support the family, she has been farming rice and raising pigs for years. She can earn about KHR27,000 per day.

This is Lam’s second loan with VisionFund. She completely paid back the previous loans with VisionFund, and successfully used the loans to better support her family. 

She is now applying for a loan to buy an electric light. She hopes to have an electric light to brighten her house.

loans.use: to buy an electric light

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Samaki Meanchey District

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
