Oun, 30, is married with two children, and residing in a rural village located in the Kampong Chnnang province’s Samaki Meanchey district, Cambodia. Both of her children are too young for school. 

For the last several years, she has been raising pigs and farming rice as primary sources of the family’s income. She can earn about 17,000KHR per day. 

This is Oun’s first loan with VisionFund, and she is asking for a loan to buy a solar panel. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Samaki Meanchey District

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en:
Yeang is aged 32 years and married with two dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Presh Vihea province’s Chaeb district, earning a living by farming rice. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR20,000 per day from the current business. 

Now she is asking for a loan to plow the fields. This is Yeang’s fifth loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. 

She hopes to make more rice and sell it for a good price to make a living better.

loans.use: to plow the fields

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Presh Vihea province’s Chaeb district, Sarun is 20 years old and married with two children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice. Together, they can earn about KHR15,000 per day from the current business. 

 

Now she is applying for a loan to plow the fields. This is the third loan for Sarun with VisionFund.

She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to plow the fields

loans.name: Mukhtiar

texts.en:
Mukhtiar is a 60-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four sons and two daughters. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 10 years; he is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Mukhtiar's husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore Mukhtiar is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. 

He can also increase the size of his business, and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Mukhtiar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for her husband's business

loans.name: Oerm

texts.en:
Oerm, 59, is a married mother living with her one dependent child in a rural village of the Kos Krolo district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She earns a living through growing corn, and supplements her income by working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for ten years, earning about KHR 43,000 per day.

Oerm has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already, and she completely repaid the past loans, which have helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and support her business.

Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn a larger income to make her living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kos Krolo district of Battambang province, Ran is a 42-year-old mother of two dependent children. She is a farmer in the local area; she grows rice and corn. Having been in the business for ten years, she can earn daily income of approximately KHR35,000 for the family’s needs. 

This is the third loan for Ran with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used the loans from VisionFund to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve financial burdens. 

Now she is asking for another loan of KHR1,600,000. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and sesame seeds for her farmland. 

This loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully; she also hopes to earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and sesame seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 35-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and two sons. Her husband has been doing his own milk business for the past six years; he is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family and to manage the household.

Shazia's husband wants to purchase an animal to milk for his business purposes and other crockery equipment, but due to financial constraints he is unable to purchase these items.

Therefore Shazia has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these items to fulfill the needs of his business; this will also enable him to earn a maximum profitable income from his business.

For this financial assistance, Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase an animal to milk, as well as other crockery equipment for her husband's business

loans.name: Akawasito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario, está integrado por cuatro mujeres (Esperanza, Dalia, Olga y Lucila,), que pertenecen a la etnia miskita. Escogieron el nombre de Akawasito en honor a una comunidad del territorio de Tasba Pri, del municipio de Puerto Cabezas.  De igual manera en vocablo indígena significa “Rio del Tabaco”. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan  por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de: Pulpería, venta de ropa usada y mariscos

Esperanza: Es la  coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora amable de 58 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo mayor de edad e independiente. Su esposo atiende una pequeña pulpería que tienen que su casa de tambo de madera. Ella desde hace 9 años  vende de manera ambulante productos de belleza, de esta manera apoya con los gastos del hogar. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua: cremas corporales, perfumes, shampoo, pintura de uña, entre otros productos y cosméticos. Ella sueña con tener un tramo y ofrecer artículos y utensilios de vidrio y plásticos para el hogar.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is composed of four women (Esperanza, Dalia, Olga and Lucila) who belong to the Miskita ethnic group. They selected the name “Akawasito” in honor of a community in the territory of Tasba Pri, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. The indigenous word means “River of Tobacco.” The members are enterprising women who struggle to make their small businesses grow, including selling used clothing, selling shell fish, and operating a general store.

Esperanza is coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a friendly woman, 58-years-old, married, and has a son who is now adult and independent. Her husband attends to a small general store he has in their wooden house. For some nine years now, she has sold beauty products in the street. In this manner, she is able to help with household expenses.

Esperanza is requesting financing to make purchases in Managua, including body lotions, perfumes, shampoo, and nail polish, among other products and cosmetics. 

Esperanza dreams of having a shop where she can offer articles and utensils of glass and plastic for the home.

loans.use: to buy in Managua body lotions, perfumes, shampoo, and nail polish among other products and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Las Doncellas Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Las Doncellas, viven en un lugar muy pintoresco: las casas, las calles, el palacio municipal y los ferrocarriles ofrecen un cuadro muy atractivo a la vita. Ellas se sienten muy orgullosas de vivir en este lugar que incluso ha sido nombrado por el gobierno del país como uno de los Pueblos Mágicos por la historia, cultura y tradiciones que alberga. 
Entre las integrantes del grupo existe un lazo de amistad muy fuerte, siempre se apoyan en situaciones difíciles, pero también disfrutan juntas de las festividades de su pueblo como el próximo carnaval que se llevará a cabo en marzo. 
Ma Luisa es la líder del grupo, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, tiene 47 años y es madre soltera de cinco hijos; todos ellos continúan estudiando afortunadamente.
Desde hace 5 años Mary, como le dicen de cariño, emprendió su propio negocio. Muy emocionada comentó “A mí siempre me ha encantado la cocina por eso mismo decidí preparar postres para venderlos”. Anteriormente ella trabajaba  en un restaurante y fue allí donde adquirió experiencia, que también contribuyó a motivarla para iniciar su actividad. 
Mary prepara postres como gelatinas, galletas, pasteles y flanes para venderlos a sus familiares, amistades y conocidos. Platica que está muy contenta y agradecida con VisionFund porque gracias a los préstamos ella pudo iniciar su negocio y con ello ayuda a solventar sus gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Ahora necesita comprar insumos como harina, huevos, leche y mantequilla para seguir horneando y vendiendo por pedido o de casa en casa.
A pesar de que en ocasiones la venta de postres en baja, las ganancias aún son de gran beneficio para ella y su familia. Uno de sus sueños es comprar in terreno y comenzar a construir “Me encantaría tener mi propia casa y darles un patrimonio a mis hijos”.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Zujey quien invertirá en ropa interior, borregos, pollos y pavos, Bertha y Lilia en ropa interior, Felipa en tienda de abarrotes, Magdalena en cosméticos y tejidos y Juana en joyería y cosméticos.

*La fotografía fue tomada afuera de la casa de Lilia,  una de las integrantes. Mary es quien viste el suéter blanco.
texts.en:
The members of the “Las Doncellas” group live in a very picturesque place. The houses, the streets, the municipal palace and the railways offer a very attractive square. The members feel very proud of living in this place that has even been named by the government of the country as one of the “Pueblos Mágicos” (“Magical Towns”) because of the history, culture, and traditions it is home to.

Among the members of the group there is a very strong bond of friendship. They always support each other in difficult situations, but together they also enjoy the celebrations of the town, including the next carnival that will come in March.

Ma Luisa is the leader of the group. She is a very happy and hard-working woman. She is 47 years old and is a single mother of five children. All of children continue studying, fortunately.

Five years ago, Mary—as they call her affectionately—started her own business. Very emotionally, she said that she has always loved cooking, and for this reason, she decided to make pastries to sell. Previously, she worked in a restaurant, and it was there where she gained experience, which also contributed to motivate her to start her business.

Mary makes desserts, including gelatin, cookies, cakes, and flans to sell to her relatives, friends, and acquaintances. She says that she is very happy and thankful for VisionFund because thanks to the loans, she has been able to start her business. With this help, she has been able to pay for her household experience and for the education of her children. Now, she needs to buy supplies, such as flour, eggs, milk, and butter to continue baking and selling based on orders or door-to-door.

Despite the fact that on occasion, the sales of desserts are low, the earnings are still a big benefit for her and her family. One of her dreams is to buy land and to begin building. She says that she would love to have her own house and to give her children an estate.

The other members of the group are Zujey, who will invest in undergarments, sheep, chickens, and turkeys; Bertha and Lilia, who will invest in undergarments; Felipa, who will invest in a grocery store; Magdalena who will invest in cosmetics and fabric; and Juana who will invest in jewelry and cosmetics.

The photograph was taken outside the home of Lilia, who is one of the members. Mary is seen in the white sweater.

loans.use: to buy supplies, including flour, eggs, milk, and butter to continue baking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school-related expenses, including buying school supplies.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, 32, lives in a small community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has three children who are currently in school. 

She is a tailor and earns, on average, an income of USD 5.00 a day. Her husband, Roth, 39, is a car driver and earns, on average, a net profit of USD 5.00 per day.

She is now applying for a Kiva loan to a buy a used car. This loan will allow her family to have a personal vehicle so that her family can experience a convenient way of travelling. 

She and her husband are thankful for all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: a buy a used car

loans.name: Wirlyn

texts.en:
Wirlyn is 35 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Wirlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Wirlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Wirlyn has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Wirlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Cristalina Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras (Kenya, Juana Elmaira y Myurel), viven en la comunidad de Lamlaya, que en miskito significa agua mansa. Se localiza a 15 kilómetros del municipio de Puerto Cabezas; se unieron hace 8 meses, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios de: Venta de mariscos y pulpería. 

Con el primer crédito otorgado por Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA, le permitió a Juana Elmaira, integrante del grupo solidario comprar mercadería para su pulpería y mejorar un poco la calidad de vida de su familia.

Kenia: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven jovial de 21 años, con deseos de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, con cualidades de líder,  está casada. Desde hace 5 años de dedica a la venta de mariscos de manera ambulante en las paradas de buses, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar más productos de mariscos y pescados, para vender e incrementar sus ingresos y atender a más personas que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 3 enterprising women (Kenya, Juana Elmaira y Myurel), who live in the community of Lamlaya, which in Miskito means thick water. It is located 15 km from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They got together 8 months ago with the aim of working together to access loans from Pana Pana to have the opportunity to increase the inventories of their small businesses of : selling seafood and a small store.

With the first loan awarded by Pana Pana and funded by Kiva allowed the communal bank member Juana Elmaira to buy merchandise for her store and improve the quality of living for her family a little.

Kenia is the leader of the communal bank. She is a friendly 21 year old youth with desire to improve the condition of her family. She is married and has leadership qualities. For the past 5 years she has been working selling seafood itinerantly at bus-stops. Doing this she makes her own income and contributes to the household expenses. She is requesting this loan to buy more seafood and fish to sell and increase her sales and serve more people who want this product. It is one of the staple foods in Bilwi. She dreams of having enough money to open a store.

loans.use: to buy more seafood and fish products.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana es una señora de 29 años de edad, tiene una linda familia de 3 hijos, vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad de Sololá.
Juliana una madre con un corazón inmenso que su mayor prioridad son sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerza día con día para generar sus ingresos ella produce y vende bananos en un lugar circunvecino de su comunidad, ella cuenta que gracias a esta actividad ha logrado mantener a su familia, pero a ella le preocupa también  que sus hijos no tengan algún día un lugar donde puedan construir o cultivar es por eso que ha decidido comprar un terreno para que algún día sus hijos tengan un mejor lugar donde puedan vivir, pero el terreno tiene un precio muy alto que dentro de las posibilidades de Juliana ya no cuenta con ese dinero por eso solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para compra un terreno.
El sueño más grande de Juliana es comprar el terreno y que sus hijos sean grandes profesionales y útiles para la sociedad
texts.en:
Juliana is a 29-year-old woman with three beautiful children. She lives with her husband in a town in Sololá. Juliana is a mother with a huge heart, whose number one priority is her children. That's why she works hard every day to earn a living. She grows and sells bananas is a place near her town. She says that thanks to this activity, she has been able to support her family. But she still worries that one day, her children won't have anywhere to build or grown crops. This is why she has decided to buy a plot of land, so that one day, her children have somewhere better to live. However, land is very expensive, and Juliana doesn't have that kind of money. That's why she is requesting a loan to buy a plot of land.

Juliana's biggest dream is to buy the land and for her children to become successful professionals who serve society.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with school costs (to buy school supplies).

loans.name: Jennyca

texts.en: Due to financial hardship, Jennyca has been engaged in the hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 22 years old and has only one child. She aspires to improve more of her business but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy the needed hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for the proper growth of her hogs. She is hoping that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta, 54, is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jaime, a van operator, and has four children, two of whom are already in high school; the other two are working. She manages their household while operating her business to augment their income and provide for the needs of her family.

Marietta runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of anything. Marietta is selling used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked up on a table or mat. Some special kinds are displayed on hangers. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from “ukay-ukay” stalls. These are very much cheaper compared with brand new clothes sold in malls.

Marietta earns a minimum of 900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) net sales every day. To help her expand the business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to buy additional slightly used but quality clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. She plans to add more pants or jeans, and used bags and footwear as well. She is encouraged by a good return on her investment and is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help fund their everyday needs and for the school needs of her children.

Marietta dreams to have her own space in a commercial building to attract and serve more customers. She aims to send her children to college and see them become professionals. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for slightly used or surplus clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 51 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anita is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anita has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Micheline

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans, Micheline est une femme veuve et vit avec ses trois enfants  à Yokoè. Pour exercer une activité et disposer d’un revenu pour répondre à ses besoins, Micheline vend du riz en parcourant tout son quartier. Micheline s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé pour revendre à ses clients. Pour acheter des sacs de riz, Micheline demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande afin de satisfaire agréablement ses clients et trouver le bénéfice pour étendre son activité
texts.en: 48 years old, Micheline is a widowed woman and lives with her three children in Yokoè. In order to conduct a business and have an income to meet her needs, Micheline sells rice by traveling throughout her neighborhood. Micheline stocks up three times per month, at the Adidogomé market, to resell to her customers. To buy bags of rice, Micheline asks for a loan to finance her order, so as to agreeably satisfy her customers and realize a profit in order to expand her activity.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 49 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school.

Angela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase assorted goods to sell in her store.

Angela has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Angela aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Soerm

texts.en:
Soerm, 55, lives in a rural village of the Presh Vihea province’s Chaeb district. She is a married mother of two children. Her family’s income is from leasing rice paddy. She has been in this business for 36 years to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 30,000 per day.

Soerm has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already and she completely repaid the loan. With the loan from VisionFund, she has successfully used it to better support her living. Now applying for another loan of KHR 2,000,000, she is going to use it to plow her fields. With this loan, she hopes to extend her farmland to increase her business so as to earn more income for supporting her family.

loans.use: to plow her fields

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира, 44 года, замужем, мать героиня 8 детей. У Элмиры среднее образование, с 1993 года занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 5 коз. Супруг и дети с радостью помогают Элмире в ведении ее бизнеса. Есть все условия для содержания скота, на зиму заготовлен корм. Элмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телят для откорма и реализации. Оня является участником группв "Береке-3". Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Elmira is 44 years old, married and a mother-hero of 8 children. Elmira has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture since 1993. Her farm currently contains 1 cow and 5 goats. Her husband and children happily help Elmira with running the business. She has all of the necessary conditions for keeping livestock and has prepared livestock feed for the winter. Elmira requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 2 calves for fattening up and resale. Elmira is a member of the "Bereke-3" group. Elmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies and uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in new merchandise for her business, which will permit her to improve sales and benefit her children financially.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 42 years old and has three children. She is married and all of children are in school.

Betty is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Betty requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Betty has been raising pigs for five years now, and she has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Betty would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cerconsicion

texts.en:
Cerconsicion is 42 years old and married with seven children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cerconsicion is borrowing PHP 8,500 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

Cerconsicion has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa habite à Yokoè avec une personne à sa charge. Elle est une femme célibataire et âgée de 24 ans. Pour faire face aux charges quotidiennes qu’elle éprouve, Kossiwa vend des sacs de sortie pour femme. Cette activité lui permet  d’avoir un revenu leur permettant de se nourrir. Kossiwa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois pour avoir les sacs. Kossiwa demande ce crédit pour acheter de nouveaux sacs d’où elle peut tirer du bénéfice pour avoir un bon épanouissement.
texts.en: Kossiwa lives in Yokoeè with one dependent. She is a single woman and is 24 years old. In order to cope with the daily needs that she experiences, Kossiwa sells women’s handbags. This activity allows her to have an income that permits her to feed herself. Kossiwa stocks up four times per month in order to have the bags. Kossiwa asks for this loan to buy new bags from which she can draw a profit to flourish.

loans.use: to buy 6 handbags.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her four children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family, and he has been running his own cosmetics store for past 2 years.

Ishrat's husband wants to purchase different types of cosmetics items, specifically creams, kangans, hair bands, clips, and other items for his business purpose. Unfortunately, due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, Ishrat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Ishrat will enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business purpose so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.
Ishrat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Ley

texts.en:
A villager from the Presh Vihea province’s Ro Veang district, Ley is 32 years old and married. She has two dependent children who are still small. The main sources of her family’s income are from cassava and rice plantation. Having been in this business for 13 years, she is able to earn a daily income of KHR 27,000 to support her family.

This is the fifth loan for Ley with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy more plots of farmland and use a portion of it to spend on purchasing household supplies. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living and have a bigger house to live in.

loans.use: to buy more plots of farmland

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a responsible mother of nine children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for four years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Zareena has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Zareena's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And then he can provide better transport service to earn the profitable income they need. 

Zareena also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Zareena is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her husband's taxi

loans.name: Ogulhon

texts.ru: Огулхон 48 лет, в рзводе, мать 3 детей. У Огулхон средне-специальное образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже 25 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с покупки одной коровы. В хозяйстве Огулхон есть 3 коровы, 12 овец. На земельном наделе она выращивает горох и кукурузу для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду Огулхон, ее деятельность приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Однако этих средств катастрофически не хватает на содержание семьи.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Огулхон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Огулхон улучшить материальное положение и условия проживания ее семьи.
texts.en: Ogulhon is 48 years old, divorced and a mother of 3 children. Ogulhon has specialized secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she has been involved in agriculture for 25 years, having started this business with a purchase of one cow. Today, Ogulhon's farm contains 3 cows and 12 sheep. She grows peas and corn for sale on her land plot. Thanks to Ogulhon's hard work, her business yields about 20,000 som (KGS) per month; however, this money is catastrophically insufficient to support the family. In order to further develop her business, Ogulhon requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock. The earnings from the loan will allow Ogulhon to improve her family's financial situation and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her business income

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Agée de 46 ans, Yawavi est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses trois enfants  à Yokoè. Pour entreprendre une activité et disposer d’un revenu pour répondre à ses besoins, Yawavi vend des chaussures dans tout son quartier. Yawavi achète deux fois par mois au marché ses chaussures pour revendre à ses clients. Pour acheter des paires de chaussures, Yawavi demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande afin de satisfaire agréablement ses clients et trouver le bénéfice pour permettre à ses enfants une bonne éducation.
texts.en: 46 years old, Yawavi is a married woman who lives with her three children in Yokoè. In order to start a business and have an income to meet her needs, Yawavi sells shoes throughout her neighborhood.  Two times per month, Yawavi buys her shoes from the market to resell to her customers. To buy pairs of shoes, Yawavi asks for this loan in order to finance her order, so as to agreeably satisfy her customers and realize a profit to allow her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the raw materials for her husband's plastic molding work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, steel supports, cement and gravel in order to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Susana Elizabeth

texts.es: Susana tiene 26 años de edad es soltera. Ella se encuentra estudiando la maestría en derecho. Además participa en actividades parroquiales como catequista y también trabaja en la sunarp como técnico registral. Ella eligió la carrera de derecho porque su objeto de estudio es la interrelación de las personas sus derechos y deberes. A Susana le falta un año para terminar su maestría. Y al culminar sus estudios ella quiere seguir trabajando en el área de sunarp.  El crédito lo invertirá  en al pago de las pensiones de su maestría. Ella agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Susana is 26 years old and single. She is currently pursuing her master's degree in Law. In addition to this, she participates in church activities as a catechist, and she also works as a registrar technician at the SUNARP (National Office of the Superintendent of Public Registries).

She chose Law because her object of study is the interrelationship between people's rights and obligations. Susana has one more year left to finish her master's degree. When she finishes, she wants to continue working at the SUNARP. 

She will use the loan to pay her master's degree tuition fees. 

She is grateful to Kiva lenders for granting her the loan.

loans.use: to pay her master’s degree tuition fees.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a 50-year-old woman who is married and has 2 children. 

She has managed and owned a sari-sari (convenience) store business for 10 years now. It has been a successful one because her husband has been helping her in their business. 

Ofelia joined GDMPC just this year (2015) and decided to take a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy additional grocery goods for her sari-sari store and increase her inventory so that she can earn more income. 

Ofelia's plan for the future is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Charina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Charina works hard to support her family.

She has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Charina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more gallons of gasoline to sell.

Charina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 30 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband operates a clothing business, which he has been doing for five years. He is solely responsible for feeding the family and managing the household. 

Shabana's husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk to sell, but due to insufficient funds he is unable to purchase these clothes. Shabana requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to purchase clothes in bulk for his business. He hopes to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for her husband to sell

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Akoko est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans et mère de quatre enfants. Akoko vit  à Wonyomé pour entreprendre son activité. Elle vend des glacières et des bassines en parcourant le quartier et les marchés. Akoko s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Akoko demande ce crédit pour acheter les glacières et les bassines. Akoko désire réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Akoko is a 30-year old married woman and the mother of four. She lives in Wonyomé, where she also works. She sells coolers and bowls at the market and as an itinerant street vendor. Akoko stocks up twice a month. She is requesting this loan to buy coolers and bowls. She hopes to earn this revenue to help her husband support their family and provide a good education for their children.

loans.use: to buy six coolers and 24 bowls for resale.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi vit à Yokoè et est âgée de 49 ans. Akouavi est une femme mariée et habite avec ses trois enfants. Pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille, Akouavi vend des éponges en lin et en fer. Ce commerce lui permet d’avoir un revenu pouvant aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes. Akouavi s’approvisionne  une  fois par mois pour avoir ses articles. Akouavi demande ce prêt pour acheter les catégories d’éponges afin de réaliser son bénéfice.
texts.en: Akouavi lives in Yokoè and is 49 years old. Akouavi is a married woman and lives with her three children. To better fulfill the needs of the family, Akouavi sells linen cloths and steel brushes. This business allows her to have a revenue to help her husband with daily expenses. Akouavi resupplies her wares once a month. Akouavi is requesting this loan to buy the kind of materials she needs to achieve her profit..

loans.use: to buy 50 packs of sponges

loans.name: Munduzbek

texts.en:
Munduzbek is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of European Studies. Here is his story:

“One day I went to meet my friend, who studied at AUCA. As she was late, I went to the Admissions Office of this university and learnt about how to be admitted and what departments they had. When I heard the tuition fee, I was surprised, as it was too much for my family and unaffordable for us, so I shared my family’s financial situation with them. They suggested I go to the New Generation Academy, a one-year Preparation Program at AUCA. I was too surprised again when I was told about 70 full Scholarships to study there. In fact, they supported children from poor families from the villages of Kyrgyzstan. I thought that I was blessed by God and should try it. In the 11th form I learnt English very hard and set an aim to be admitted at New Generation Academy at AUCA. My dream came true and I had a chance not only to study for free there, but also to live and have meals for free there. My next step was to get ready for the AUCA Entrance Exams, and God blessed me here too.

There are eight people in my family: my parents, my two elder and one younger brother, one elder and one younger sister, and me. My elder brother and sister have their own families and live separate from us. My younger brother has had epilepsy from 2010. Last year he wanted to enter the university. Unfortunately, due to the lack of money, he couldn’t do it. My parents are farmers; we grow fruits and vegetables and sell them at the local market in my town. My father is 68 and my mother is 67, and they do their best to support us, even though they are retired. As my second brother studies at another university and we rent a room in Bishkek, we are always short of money. My parents try to earn additional money to send us, but they are not always successful. We buy food at the market and walk to the university in order to save money somehow. We always feel how my parents try the damnedest to treat my sick brother and to pay for my and my other brother’s tuition fee. I hope to get a Degree and help my family make its life simpler. The Kiva loan will be of great help for me. I am requesting this loan to pay university costs for my degree, which will allow me to keep fighting to grow every day.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for six years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Yasmeen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Yasmeen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide the better transport facilities to earn a profitable income.

Yasmeen also plans to make savings with the profit amount from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Yasmeen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is 44 years old and has five children, all of whom are still in school.

Minerva is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Minerva requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Minerva has been doing this for 5 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Neda

texts.en:
Neda is 51 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom is in school.

Neda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like diapers, sardines, noodles, and other groceries.

Neda has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Neda aspires to save enough money to expand her business in order to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more items like diapers, sardines, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an ice cream making machine for her husband's ice cream selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's embroidery shop

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is a cheerful woman who was born in 1966. She lives in a remote district. She is a widow with two children. Fifteen years ago, her husband died and she was left with her children alone. Her mother helped to raise her children.

In order to feed and keep the family, she started to work as a charwoman at a medical clinic. After a while, she entered university to get a higher education. She become a nurse and stayed at that medical clinic to work. She is now a nurse in a physiotherapy center and earns 520 TJS monthly.

The salary she earns from her job cannot cover all of the expenditures involved in making renovations to her apartment. Nasiba needs financial support from Kiva lenders to buy needed materials and renovate her apartment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to make some renovations to her apartment

loans.name: Julia Solanda

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Julia, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos  de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo no trabaja por motivos de salud.
Doña Julia es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ante la necesidad por la enfermedad de su esposo tuvo que redoblar sus esfuerzos para salir adelante, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres de primera necesidad, además de  legumbres, verduras, frutas y ciertas cosas de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden, lleva más de 13 años con su negocio el cual les permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes y otros víveres para surtir más su tienda. Está en el Grupo de Crédito  desde el inicio y esta muy agradecida porque con un crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es que nunca les falte nada a su familia.
texts.en:
In Montecristi, Ecuador, the “Para el Futuro de la Mujer” loan group meets every fortnight. Montecristi is very well-known for its rich, traditional culture. Here, you can find a great variety of handicrafts produced by locals.

And it is here that 61-year-old Julia lives. She is married and has four grown children, two of whom still live at home. Julia’s husband does not work owing to health reasons.

Julia has always liked to work and, owing to the need created by her husband’s illness, had to double her efforts to move forward in life. Julia therefore has a small grocery shop in her house. There she sells all sorts of staple goods, including vegetables, fruits, as well as stationery and miscellaneous items. Julia works every day from 6am until 8pm, sometimes even later. Her children help with this work when they can. Julia has had the business for more than thirteen years and it has allowed her to earn a living.

This loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, detergents and other supplies to stock up Julia’s shop. Julia has been with the loan group since it began and she is very grateful to it as she started her business with a loan. Julia’s dream is for her family never to need for anything.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, detergents and other supplies.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo is thankful that he was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which he used to pay for additional supplies for his electronics store. Through his earnings he is able to support his family's daily needs.

He would like to apply for another PHP 10,000 which he will use to buy more mobile and cellular phone units and casings to sell at his store. He earns a minimum of PHP 800 a day. He thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him for it will definitely help sustain their everyday personal and household needs and pay for his children's education.

Timoteo hopes to grow his business and put up another branch in another area. He aims to improve their quality of living and send his children to good schools. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of mobile and cell phone units and casings to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 54 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, eggs, rice and other groceries.

In the future Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 51 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Virgie is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virgie has been in this business for 30 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is 60 years old and married with seven children. Bibiana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP  loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Bibiana has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a  year and also earns an income from raising pigs. Bibiana aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie is a married woman with three children. She is 36 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nelsie has a business selling coconut wine in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. Nelsie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more coconut wine to sell.

In the future, Nelsie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Rega

texts.en:
Rega lives in Serang, West Java, which is about a two-hour drive from Jakarta. He lives there with his wife and his only child. He owns a small stall where he provides a mobile payment service. He joined Ruma in 2013 and is now applying for his second loan from Kiva. The first loan helped him process more mobile airtime credits and he thanks all his lenders for that.

Rega has a strong will to learn about everything. His community sees him as a trusted mobile payment service provider as well. With Ruma's support, he has seen improvements in his business. As it grows, he hopes to get more loans from Kiva. Your support will be very helpful to Rega's business and his community, which needs access to such services. He will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Sreysor

texts.en:
A 37-year-old married mother of three children residing in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Lek Dek district, Sreysor and her husband earn a living through working as paid workers. Having been in this job for several years, she can earn about KHR 30,000 per day to make a living.

This is the first loan for Sreysor with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a bigger house to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 52-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and four daughters. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 10 years. He is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Perveen is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Perveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his clothing business.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 43-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of five children. Her husband has been running his electronics shop for the past six years. He is responsible for feeding his entire family and fulfilling their needs.

Rabia's husband has to purchase electronics merchandise such as irons, washing machines, pump motors, and other electronics devices but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to purchase these items for business purposes.

Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase this merchandise as per his business needs. This loan will also help her husband to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.

Rabia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his electronics business.

loans.name: El Renacer Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL RENACER”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia ella es soltera y tiene 38 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron premiso por motivos de trabajo.
El socio que esta tapado con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal El Renacer.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cerámicas, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank “El Renacer” [“The Rebirth”]. This group is located in the district of Cusco which belongs to the Province of Cusco in the Department of Cusco. 

The partner Sonia is single and 38 years old. She works in a craft business selling fabrics, sweaters, blankets, looms, and different cloths. She works from 8 am to 7 pm. Sonia already has 8 years in this business and is doing very well. This woman’s dream is to expand her business selling fabrics and weaving. Sonia is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, sweaters, and looms.
The members who are added on to the group photo had their picture taken after the meeting; he requested permission for work reasons.

The partner that is blocked out with a circle on his face no longer belongs to the communal bank “El Renacer.” 

The other partners are in the business of selling ceramics, selling fruits, a grocery store business, and a business selling food. 

Sonia is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this medium. She agrees to comply with the payment of her repayments by the deadline.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, sweaters, and looms for weaving

loans.name: Melissa Yomayra

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Melissa, tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 1 año  de edad, Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Melissa junto a su esposo tienen un taller de artesanía donde fabrican  todo tipo de figuras en barro o en cerámica, trabajan todos los días, entregan sus productos semiterminados y acabados a comerciantes de su localidad y también venden al público en un local que tienen. Llevan más de 5 años dedicados a esta actividad. 
 Este crédito es para comprar pinturas, cerámica y moldes  para elaborar sus productos. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan en el grupo. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su pequeño.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Crédito para el Futuro de la Mujer meets in the La Pila area of Montecristi twice a month. This place is known for its rich traditional culture where a great variety of handicrafts made by local people can be found. 

Melissa, who is 21 years old, lives here. She is in a common-law marriage from which she has one son. Her husband is an artist. Melissa and her husband have an artists' workshop. There they make all types of clay or ceramic figures. They work every day. They deliver their semi-finished and finished products to dealers in the area and also sell to the public at a local shop they own. They have worked in this capacity for more than five years.

This loan is for buying paints, ceramics and molds to make their products. Melissa has already participated in two loan cycles in the credit group. She likes the support she receives from the group. Her dream is to provide the best for her son.

loans.use: buy paints, ceramics and molds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Koe Rory Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Koe Rory es un grupo nuevo que está en su primer ciclo del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que es un medio para que puedan conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar por mejorar sus vidas.
Mariela forma parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura, y es por medio de este trabajo que ella tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Mariela es muy buena en lo que hace y comenta que ya tiene una muy buena clientela que siempre le lleva mucho trabajo para hacer.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros, de manera a poder seguir cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes y con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
This group named “Koe Rory” is a new group that is in its first loan cycle with the poverty elimination program. By participating in this program, the members will become familiar with their living situations so that they can work toward improving their lives.

Mariela is a member of this group. She is a seamstress and works so that she can have the means to help her family and loved ones. Mariela is very good at what she does and says that she has an excellent clientele who provide her with a great amount of work.

She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of fabrics, thread, buttons, and other supplies so that she can continue fulfilling the demands of her customers and complete their orders.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Horizonte es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Santaní,  se encuentra en el primer ciclo con 18 integrantes. Todas con espíritu emprendedor y ganas de superación. Son de una zona de la ciudad eminentemente rural, donde cada una de ellas se dedican a actividades rurales.
Todas son mujeres rurales, que trabajan la tierra y crían animales ya que sus condiciones así lo permite, entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Liza, la misma es quien encabeza este comité debido a su actitud activista, ella se dedica al cultivo y comercializa su producción en diferentes barrios aledaños a su casa.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de semillas y abonos para poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The committee named “Horizonte” (Horizon) is a group formed in the city of Santaní. This group is in its first loan cycle with 18 members. All of them have an enterprising spirit and the drive to succeed. They live in a part of the city that is predominantly rural, so they engage in businesses that reflect this area.

These rural women work the land and raise animals as the conditions will allow. One woman who stands out is Sra. Liza. She also serves as the head of this committee because of her activist attitude. Liza farms and sells what she produces in different neighborhoods around her house. She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and compost so that she can continue her work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Amigas se encuentra en el 2do Ciclo del programa de comité De Mujeres Emprendedoras. Este comité se encuentra dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas y cada una de ellas ha ido mejorado y capacitándose para poder superar su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, ella mantiene a su familia por medio de la venta de prendas nuevas y usadas, ella vende de manera ambulante en una zona muy estratégica, lo cual le es de mucha ayuda. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que pese a las dificultades que ha sufrido no se dejó vencer jamás.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas nuevas y usadas para la venta, lo que le será de mucha ayuda y podrá seguir creciendo  mediante sus ventas.
texts.en:
The “Las Amigas” committee is in the 2nd cycle of the Entrepreneurial Women Committee program. This committee is under the poverty elimination program, where each and every one of them has improved and been trained to overcome their poverty situation.

One of the members is Mrs. Maria, she supports her family by selling new and used clothing on the streets, in a very strategic area, which is very helpful to her. She is a very hardworking woman who, in spite of the difficulties she’s suffered, has never allowed herself to be defeated. She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of new and used garments to sell, which will help her to continue to develop through her sales.

loans.use: purchase of new and used garments for sale

loans.name: 24 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama 24 de Mayo están en el 4to. ciclo del programa de comités de mujeres, está conformado por 17 mujeres, es un grupo muy unido y emprendedor, están agradecidas por la ayuda que les da la fundación a través de su programa y de las capacitaciones.
La Sra. Carmen, se distingue por su humildad y ganas de sobresalir, tiene un copetín en su casa donde prepara comidas, vende bebidas, entre otros, tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre compra de ella, y es por ello que le va muy bien.
Todas estas mujeres sostienen como base la ayuda mutua, la solidaridad,.
Carmen pide este préstamo para poder comprar comestibles, bebidas, golosinas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The committee named “24 de Mayo” (May 24th) is in its fourth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. This group consists of 17 women who are unified and have an entrepreneurial spirit. They are grateful for the assistance that Fundación Paraguaya has provided through this program and the training seminars.

Sra. Carmen stands out because of her humility and her drive to succeed. She has a snack bar at her house where she prepares and sells food, beverages, and other items. Carmen has a well-established clientele who always buy from her. For this reason, she is doing very well.

All of the women help one another through their mutual support and camaraderie.

Carmen is requesting a loan in order to buy food, beverages, snacks, and other products so that she can continue her sales just as before.

loans.use: to buy food, beverages, snacks, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a sink, install a toilet and repair the bathroom in his home as well as the sewage escape.

loans.name: Alex Ranier

texts.en:
Alex Ranier is 25 years old, single and the fifth child among seven siblings. He is a first-year student studying Industrial Technology. He aims to finish his studies despite poverty. 

Alex Ranier requested a loan for 6,000 PHP, which he will use to pay his tuition fees. His mother is a vegetable vendor and willing to help pay the educational loan in order to achieve his dreams and help alleviate the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Jamaica

texts.en:
Jamaica lives at Ugac Sur with her parents. She is 19 years old, single and a student. She is an engineering student and wanted to finish her education to help her family someday.

Her mother manages a talipapa (vegetable stand) for income. Due to an unstable income, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay school tuition fees. Her mother will support her other needs in school.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
To have an additional source of income, Herminia has been engaged in direct selling of Avon, Natasha, and MSE products within her community, which she has been doing for almost three years. She wants to make this business profitable in order to earn a sufficient income and support the needs of her family. 

Due to capital insufficiency, Herminia requested a loan for 5,000.00 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks of  Avon, Natash, and MSE products to sell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of Avon, Natash, and MSE products to sell

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Minerva works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns income from clothing sales. Minerva is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Minerva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 59 years old, married, and has seven children. She has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 10 times so far from NWTF to sustain it. She has now requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins.

In the future, Diosdada would like to save enough money to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 59 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 6 children. Her husband is an electrician and he has been running his electric store for the past 10 years. He is responsible for feeding his entire family and fulfilling their needs.

Nasreen's husband has to purchase electrical merchandise e.g wires, tube lights, plug shoes, and other electric devices, but due to insufficient financial means, he cannot afford to purchase these items for his business purposes.

Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase this merchandise for his business needs. This loan will also help her husband to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy electrical supplies to improve her husband's electrical business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 35 year old married woman and has four children, three of whom are in school.

Catherine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.

Catherine requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Catherine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 30 year old woman, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 2 children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Nazia also provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute with her husband in managing the household.

She needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories. It will also be helpful to her in increasing her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Nazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies to improve her tailoring business.

loans.name: Haris

texts.en:
Haris is married and has two children. He lives in Serang, located about two hours from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he provides mobile payment services for his community. His community sees him as a trusted, friendly, and informative mobile payment service provider. 

Haris joined Ruma in 2013. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Haris sees improvements in his business. He requested a loan, which he will use to provide more mobile payment services to his community. This loan will help Haris improve his business and his community which needs access to such services.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community

loans.name: Eduardo Steven

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive el señor Eduardo, tiene 21 años de edad, está soltero y  vive en casa de sus padres. Para el este es su segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta ya que con los créditos él está logrando aumentar su negocio.
Don Eduardo es un joven muy trabajador que desde muy pequeño aprendió la elaboración de artesanías actividad que actualmente le permite ganarse la vida y forjarse un mejor porvenir, el tiene un taller de artesanía, allí fabrica  todo tipo de figuras las mismas que elabora  en barro o en cerámica, trabaja todos los días ya sea en la elaboración y venta de sus obras ya que cuenta con un pequeño local, el vende a personas que pasan por el lugar y también entrega a otros comerciantes ya sea en productos terminados o sin pintar. Lleva más de 5 años dedicados a esta labor con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar cerámica, pinturas, pinceles, etc. para elaborar sus productos. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the town of Montecristi, the Grupo De Crédito Para el Futuro De la Mujer (Credit Group for the Future of Women) meets every fifteen days. This place is well-known for is rich traditional culture. You can find a great variety of crafts made by its inhabitants. 

In this place lives Eduardo, 21, single, and living in his parents' house. For him this is the second cycle in the Grupo De Crédito and he likes that with the loans he has managed to increase his business. Eduardo is a young, hard-working man who learned the production of craftmaking very young. Now it allows him to earn a living and build a better future. 

He has a craft shop; there he makes all kinds of figures in clay or ceramic. He works every day either in the production or sales of his works because he has a small shop. He sells to people who pass by and also delivers finished or unpainted products to other shopkeepers. It takes more than 5 years of dedication to this work to get ahead. This loan is to buy ceramics, paints, brushes etc. to make his products. Eduardo's dream is to keep improving his business.

loans.use: to buy ceramics, paints, brushes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animals like chickens and ducks amongst others as well as buying balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Munavarhon

texts.en:
Munavarhon is a generous woman. She was born in 1974 and is from the southern part of the country. She lives in a remote district. She is married and has three children and her husband is a tractor driver.

For about twenty four years, she has been doing a business, working at a collective farm. Munavarhon is an experienced person in the agricultural sphere. Two years ago, the collective farm gave land to her as a gift. With this land, she is planning to make a garden, planting agricultural products. She is supported by her family.

Munavarhon wants to purchase corn and additional chemical fertilizers for maintaining her land safely. She is asking financial support from the Kiva project to buy fertilizer and corn.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and corn.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fruit and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elvie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fruit and vegetables to sell.

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business .

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Amilita

texts.en:
Amilita is a 50-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur in the Philippines and has a vinegar vending business. She has been in this business for one year. 

Amilita requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy gallons of vinegar to sell.

Her future goal is to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy gallons of vinegar to sell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 52 years old and is married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Concepcion has a buy-&-sell rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. Concepcion requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell in her business.

In the future, Concepcion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell in her business

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana is 48 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Emiliana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, groceries, etc. Emiliana has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits, candies, detergent soap, snack foods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Emiliana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée âgée de 34 ans et mère de deux enfants. Abla vit  à Yokoè pour entreprendre son activité. Elle vend des pommades en parcourant le quartier et les marchés. Abla s’approvisionne une fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Abla demande ce crédit pour acheter des cartons de pommades. Abla désire réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Abla is a 34 year old married woman and mother of two children.  Abla lives in Yokoè to start up her activity.  She sells ointments by moving around the neighborhood and markets.  Abla restocks her supply once a month from her suppliers.  Abla requests this loan to buy some cartons of ointments.  Abla wants to gain profits to support her husband in the family costs and allow her children to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy 13 ointments

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 51 ans, Kossiwa est une femme mariée et vit avec ses quatre enfants  à Yokoè. Kossiwa vend des friperies dans le quartier et se promène pour satisfaire ses clients. Kossiwa s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois. Pour acheter des tricots et des robes, Kossiwa demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande afin de répondre favorablement à l’attente de ses clients et trouver le bénéfice pour étendre son activité.
texts.en: 51 years old, Kossiwa is a married woman who lives with her children in Yokoè.  Kossiwa sells second-hand clothing in the neighborhood and walks around to different areas in order to satisfy her clients.  Kossiwa restocks her clothing supply five times per month.  To buy sweaters and dresses, Kossiwa asks for a loan to finance her order.  This will help her to respond favorably to the needs of her clients and gain the profits to extend her activity.

loans.use: to buy 35 sweaters and 25 dresses

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 37  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 4 años el cual está en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora que junto a su marido luchan día a día para darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo, ella se dedica a pintar artesanías para fabricantes de la zona, por este trabajo recibe un sueldo mensual. Ella también compra artesanías, les da el acabado y luego las vende al público en general.  Mientras ella realiza esta actividad su marido también tiene un pequeño local en el centro de Portoviejo en el cual elabora y vende sellos de caucho, actividad con la cual el siempre se ha ganado la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar pinturas, cerámicas y caucho para fabricar los sellos. Este es su primer ciclo y le gusta por la rapidez con que le dieron el crédito.  Sus metas son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The "Para el Futuro De la Mujer" (For the Future of Women) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi. The area is well-known for its rich, traditional culture. One can find a large variety of handicrafts made by the area residents there.

This is where Señora María lives. She is 37-years old, married and together with her husband has one 4-year old son. Her son goes to nursery school and her husband is a shop keeper.

Doña María is a hard-working woman who, alongside her husband, fights day after day to give their best to their young son. Doña María makes her living painting handicrafts that are made locally. She earns a monthly salary for her work. She also purchases handicrafts, puts on the finishing touches and sells them to the general public. Her husband, meanwhile, has a small storefront in downtown Portoviejo where he makes and sells rubber stamps. He has always made his living with that business.

This loan is for the purchase of paints, ceramics and rubber for making stamps. This is doña María's first lending cycle, and she likes how quickly she was able to receive the loan. Her goal is to be able to give her son all the best.

loans.use: to purchase paints, ceramics and rubber.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo vit à Adidogomé et est agée de 22 ans. Elle est une femme mariée et habite avec ses trois enfants. Pour mieux subvenir aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve, Adzo vend des chaussures et des tapettes afin d’avoir un revenu pouvant aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes. Adzo s’approvisionne  deux  fois par mois. Adzo demande ce prêt pour acheter des chaussures et tapettes afin de tirer du bénéfice nécessaire pour relever ses défis et étendre son commerce.
texts.en: Adzo lives in adidogomé and is 22 years old.  She is married and lives with her three children.  To better fulfill her daily needs, Adzo sells shoes and fly swatters.
