This allows her to have a revenue to help her husband with the daily costs.  Adzo restocks her supply two times per month.  Adzo requests this loan to buy shoes and fly swatters so that she can make the necessary money to overcome her challenges and extend her business.

loans.use: to buy 4 batches of shoes and two batches of fly swatters

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites, 32 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. Marites has been raising pigs in the Philippines for twelve years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Marites works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
San Lorenzo se formó en la ciudad de Santaní,  está en el 4to. ciclo con 17 integrantes, son todas ellas mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras que se esfuerzan por su familia para poder darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes la señora Sonia, es  muy  emprendedora trabaja desde su propia casa, confecciona ropas deportivas y uniformes para colegios tiene varios clientes, es muy reconocida debido a la calidad de su trabajo y su buena atención a los clientes.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y seguir ayudando a su familia con los ingresos que tiene.
texts.en:
“San Lorenzo” is the name of a group that was formed in the city of Santaní. It is in its fourth loan cycle with 17 members. All of them are enterprising and determined women who strive to provide their families with everything that they were not able to have.

One of the members is Sra. Sonia. She is an enterprising woman who works from home. Sonia produces sportswear and school uniforms for various clients. She is well-known because of the quality of her work and the good service she provides to her customers.

Sonia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of fabrics and thread. As a result, she can continue her work and keep supporting her family with the income she earns.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread for her sewing business.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es de la ciudad de Villarrica, es estudiante de la carrera de odontología, por medio de su profesión quiere ser una profesional útil, no solo a sí misma, sino también a la sociedad.
Ella está poniendo todo de si para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su cuota de la carrera, y con ello poder seguir luchando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
Natalia is originally from the city of Villarrica. She is studying Odontology with the objective of becoming a useful professional for herself and the society. 

She is doing her best to improve her life conditions and those of her family. She is requesting this loan to cover tuition expenses, so that she can fight to improve her family's life.

loans.use: to cover University tuition expenses.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Doña Alicia
Ella es originaria del municipio  Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 52 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la siembra de tomate y a la producción de hongos chinos
Ella a empezado este negocio desde hace varios años y gracias a Dios a podido salir adelante.
Con el crédito que ella recibió lo utilizo en compra de insumos para agricultura e insumos para sus siembras de hongos.
Ella sueña  ampliar mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias  y asi mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de abono y semillas para el cultivo de hongos
texts.en:
Alicia is from the municipality of Tecpan, Guatemala.  She is 52 years old and she has young children under her care.  She grows tomatoes and mushrooms for a living.   

He started this business several years ago and thanks to God she has been able to get ahead.  

She used the loan she received to buy farming supplies and supplies for her mushroom crops. 

She dreams of expanding her business more to make more profits so she can send her children to school for a better future.  She is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer and seed to grow mushrooms.

loans.use: to purchase mushroom seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy potatoes so he can make and sell hot chips

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es: Maritza de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace varios años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, Maritza está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maritza, who is 42 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their four children. She has had a little store located in her residence for a number of years. She sells a variety of products such as candies, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc., and she has many customers because of the good prices. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to get ahead. 

Maritza is applying for a loan for the purchase of more wholesale products, since this is her only source of income, and thus she will have greater earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candies, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc., for her store

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.en:
Ibodat is a hardworking woman. She grew up in and lives in a remote district. She is married with four children. Her husband is a service expert.

Ibodat has a good loan repayment history. She is a responsible, honest, punctual and creative person. She makes her payments on time.

She has a clothing store in a domestic market. She attracts a lot of clients from around the area. Her customers are always satisfied when they purchase from her store. She is well known among the sellers too.

She is planning to renovate her apartment and improve the conditions where she lives. Ibodat is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to renovate her apartment.

loans.use: to renovate her apartment

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 47 years old, has chosen to live as a single woman in Oroquieta City, Philippines. In order to survive, she has found ways to attain income through her sari-sari (convenience store). It began by displaying a few inventories of canned goods, noodles, sugar, eggs, shampoo and soap. 

Susan joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari store in January of 2012. She became a Member in Good Standing with an excellent repayment record, which is why she has received her 23rd loan. Susan has now applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP to pay for additional merchandise to draw more customers to her store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise to draw more customers to her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 64 years old and widowed. She was blessed with seven children and they live happily in a rural community. Aside from farming, Mercedes also engages in a hog raising business to earn additional income. She aspires to continue and improve this business in order to gain higher profits. 

Due to capital insufficiency, Mercedes is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy the needed hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs. She is hoping that she will avail her request amount to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Delsa

texts.en:
From Manila in the Philippines, Delsa has been an active member of CCT for years now and she was able to acquire several loans to make good profits from her business. At the age of 52, she is helping her husband to provide for their daily needs and she was inspired to improve their lives because she wants to give her children the best for their future. She works hard each day and she is pretty sure enough that she is closer to reaching her goals.

Delsa owns a variety store. She believes that business is her stepping stone of making her dreams come to happen. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, an egg, toothpaste, or even ice tubes. She gets her product from a wholesaler at a lower price and then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit.

She desires to manage a bigger store someday so she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she will become a successful businesswoman in the future and and she looks forward to seeing her children finish their studies through all her hard work and perseverance.

Delsa meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week, and here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional grocery items and other goods and products she needs to expand her inventory and increase her sales.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 44-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like socks, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like socks, etc.

loans.name: Meris Idania

texts.es:
Meris, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, actualmente está casada y tiene un hijo, su esposo tuvo un accidente anteriormente, que le impedía trabajar, pero gracias a Dios, ahora está trabajando como cobrador en una comercial de muebles.

A Meris, siempre le ha gustado mucho el trabajo del campo, desde que era una niña, siempre le había gustado  ayudarle a su padre, con los trabajos del campo; también ayudaba a su padre a criar ganado, actualmente ella ayuda a su esposo en la crianza de ganado, ya que tienen tres vacas con sus respectivas crías.

El dinero de este crédito será invertido para comprar alambre y polines para la construcción de un corral, ya que actualmente tiene ganado y el corral que tiene está muy dañado.


El sueño de Meris, es poder tener su ganado en un lugar seguro, en donde puedan dormir tranquilamente sin pensar en que se las pueden robar en la noche.
texts.en:
Meris, 20, studied up to the third grade. She is married and has a son. Her husband had an accident and could not work for some time. Thanks to God he has recovered now and works collecting payments for a furniture company.

Meris has always liked to work the land. When she was a girl, she loved helping her father to take care of the land and the animals. She is now helping her husband to take care of their cattle. They have three cows with their calves.

She will use this loan to buy wires and dimensional lumber to build a pen, since the one she has is in bad conditions. Her dream is to have a safe place for her cattle, where they can sleep comfortably and safe from being stolen at night.

loans.use: to buy wires and dimensional lumber to build a pen

loans.name: Ambreen

texts.en:
Ambreen is a 29-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a printing shop; he is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members. Ambreen has been running her own beauty salon for the past 5 years. She contributes her income, along with her husband, to manage the household. 

Ambreen needs to buy different types of cosmetics, creams, hair brushes and other accessories for her beauty salon but, due to financial constraints, she is not able to buy these items for her business. Ambreen has applied for a Kiva loan to help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family. Ambreen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy supplies so that she can increase her parlor business

loans.name: Akpédzé

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée, Akpédzé vit à Logogomé. Akpédzé est âgée de 28 ans et exerce une activité de couture. Grâce à cette activité, Akpédzé vend des habits qu’elle coud et met à la disposition de ses clients. Akpédzé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Pour acheter des pièces de pagne, Akpédzé demande ce nouveau crédit pour financer son achat et réaliser le bénéfice nécessaire pour son épanouissement.
texts.en: Akpédzé, a married woman, lives in Logogomé.  Akpédzé is 28 years old and is an expert seamstress.  Thanks to this activity, Akpédzé sells clothing that she sews and makes herself available to her clients.  Akpédzé restocks her supply two times per month from her suppliers.  Akpédzé requests this new loan to finance her purchase of new pieces of fabric and gain the necessary earnings for her to thrive.

loans.use: to purchase three sheets of cloth for pagnes (traditional West African skirt)

loans.name: Malis's Group

texts.en:
Malis’ group lives in a rural village in Battambang province, Cambodia. Malis makes a living cultivating rice; she also does extra work as a farmer and radio repairer to support her family. 

There is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water in their village. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Taingkeu's Group

texts.en:
Taingkeu’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Taingkeu makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their group's village there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families. They will also save both money otherwise spent on medical expenses and time needed for collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ñemity Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ñemity es un grupo nuevo, está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas también hacen la encuesta de eliminación  de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer su situación de vida y conforme a eso poder luchar por mejorar. 
La Sra. Lorena se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas y también vende chipas que es un alimento típico paraguayo, ella está muy contenta por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que a través de las capacitaciones podrá ir creciendo, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas varias para la venta, como ser naranjas, manzanas, bananas, melones y otros, para poder continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Ñemity group is a new group from the women's committee program and is in its first loan cycle. They also do surveys about eliminating poverty which allow them to understand their living situations and, based on that, be able to fight to improve them. 

Lorena works selling fruit and "chipas," traditional Paraguayan corn cakes. She is very happy to have the opportunity she receives, as through the trainings she will be able to grow, not only economically but also as a person. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase various types of fruit such as apples, bananas, melons, oranges to sell. She appreciates the opportunity this gives her to continue growing and improving every day.

loans.use: to buy oranges, apples, bananas, melons, etc. To sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, es una joven muy trabajadora y responsable vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella posee desde hace algunos años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face has been blurred is 27 years old and lives in a high risk area.  She is a hardworking and responsible person who lives in a house that she owns with her husband and their daughter.  For a few years, she has had a small store located in her home.  She has many customers because she offers good prices and good customer service.  With the income she earns and the help of her husband, she is moving forward.

She is requesting a new loan to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, sodas, snacks, and pastries so that she can earn more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, sodas, snacks, and pastries.

loans.name: Fayzi

texts.en:
Fayzi is a responsible woman. She was born in 1960. She is living in remote district, and she is from the southern part of the country. She is married and her husband is a teacher. Fayzi is a brave, honest and a communicable person. She dreams to make her living conditions better at her house. 

She has a good story of taking a loan. She is punctual and makes her payments on time. Fayzi hopes that Kiva project will support her to make better conditions for living. She is asking financial support to renovate her house and to buy needed construction materials. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to renovate her house and to buy needed construction materials.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer de 46 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 6, 8, 12 y 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de gaseosas.
Ella es buena madre, amable, solidaria, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el ‘plan 3000’ barrio Aymará, Quechua y Guaraní, ubicado al sur de la ciudad, migrantes del todo el país se reunieron y formaron un gran comercio, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-36 grados centígrados. 
Teresa es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, Su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de gaseosas; ella se encarga de comprar gaseosas de varios tamaños para ponerlas en hielo y enfriarlas, sus clientes agotados por el clima cálido y el sol agobiante, compran gaseosas de todo tamaño y sabor para refrescarse por unos minutos y continuar con sus labores. Labor que realiza al aire libre, bajo una sombrilla que la cubre del sol, viento y hasta la lluvia. “el calor es insoportable, y los clientes ya saben dónde hay refrescos fríos, por eso tengo ventas constantes y clientes continuos…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y ofertar variedades de gaseosas, jugos, refrescos y otros. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una heladera, para mantener frío por más tiempo las gaseosas. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamo s con la institución en 2 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Teresa solicita un préstamo para la compra de una heladera para enfriar gaseosas y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Teresa is a woman of 46. She lives with her partner and has four children, ages 6, 8, 12, and 18. Her business is selling soft drinks.

She is a good mother, friendly, caring, responsible, and hard-working. She runs her business in the "Plan 3000" neighborhood located at the south of the city, where people of Aymará, Quechua, and Guaraní descent, transplants from the entire country, meet and form a large business area. This location has a warm, tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 18 and 36 degrees centigrade.

Teresa has a dark complexion, long, dark hair that she wears loose, dark eyes, short stature, and a medium build. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her partner, who works in commerce, and their children, who are in school. They live in a rented house made of bricks that has potable water, electricity, and sewer service.

Her business is selling soft drinks. She buys soft drinks of various sizes to put them on ice and chill them. Her customers, worn out by the warm climate and the oppressive sun, buy soft drinks of all sizes and flavors to refresh themselves for a few minutes and then continue with their work. She does her work outdoors, under an umbrella that covers her from the sun, wind, and even the rain. "The heat is unbearable, and the customers know where there are cold soft drinks. For this reason, I have constant sales and regular customers, " she comments. 

Her dream is to expand her business and offer a variety of soft drinks, juices, and other cold beverages. She wants to expand her business through the purchase of a refrigerator, in order to keep the soft drinks cold for a longer time. 

This is her second loan with the institution in the two years that she has been running this business independently. It is for these reasons that Teresa is applying for a loan to purchase a refrigerator to chill soft drinks and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to chill soft drinks and increase her sales.

loans.name: Flor De Angel Group

texts.es: Flor del Ángel es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras que solicitan por tercera ocasión el financiamiento en ADIM, con el fin de seguir creciendo en sus negocios y ofreces los recursos necesarios a sus familias, quien lo coordina es Hilda una mujer laboriosa que a sus 34 años se ha dedicado por cinco años a la comercialización de ropa en su comunidad, cuenta con la ayuda financiera de su compañero de vida y solicita el crédito para la compra de camisetas, blusas, pantalones, ropa interior, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar la clientela, lo que le permite aportar más a los gastos familiares y otra parte reinvertir en los productos que oferta. El resto de las integrantes son, Meyling que tiene la edad de 26 años y comercializa ropa en su comunidad desde hace tres años, y Leonor una señora que tiene la edad de 36 años y ha dedicado los últimos tres años de su vida a la venta de ropa en su comunidad. Estas mujeres con negocios similares han visto el incremento de sus clientelas y por ende mejoras en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“Flor de Ángel” is a solidarity group that consists of three enterprising women. They are requesting their third loan from ADIM so that they can continue growing their businesses and provide for the needs of their families. Hilda, the group coordinator, is an industrious woman who is 34 years old. She has been selling clothes in her community for five years. With financial assistance from her life companion and with the loan she is requesting, Hilda will be able to buy T-shirts, blouses, trousers, undergarments, and other items. With her previous loan, she was able to increase her clientele and contribute more toward her family’s expenses. Part of her profits were reinvested in the products that she offers.

The other members are as follows:
• Meyling is 26 years old and has been selling clothes in her community for three years.
• Leonor is a 36-year-old woman who has spent the last three years of her life selling clothes in her community.

These women who have similar businesses want to increase their clientele so that they can improve their incomes.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, blouses, trousers, undergarments, and other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS CORAZONES VALIENTES DE MORRO SAN JUAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Vilma  se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cacao y café, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The applicant is a member of the community bank "Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan." The bank is located in the district of Santa Ana, in the province of La Convencion, department of Cusco. Vilma works in agriculture, she has a plot of land where she grows cocoa and coffee. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. She has several years in this business, and she is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her plot of land. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is happy for the loan and she promises to meet her payment installments.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is gaining a profit through his retailing business, buying and selling a variety of commodities like rice in the local community. Rogelio is married, and he never gets tired of displaying and tending his store since he is driven in his passion for selling, and he earns a meager income from it that sufficiently supports his family. 

Rogelio is a full fledged member of PMPC and he has taken several loans already. He maintains his membership in good standing without records of default. Now, he has applied for a loan to purchase 2 whole bags of rice for retail and pay for store inventories. 

Rogelio continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that he has the determination and the energy to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 whole bags of rice for retail; and pay for store inventories

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia, a hardworking mother, has requested a loan from Paglaum MPC to buy more items to sell in her store. By doing this, she will be able to increase her sales and earn more money, which she will use to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy items for her store.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 59 years old and single. He lives in LowerLamac, Oroquieta City. For the past seven years, Abraham has been a farmer, focusing on a pig raising business. He earns a good return, enabling him to support his needs. 

Abraham is a new member of PMPC. Recently, he requested a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase bags of grower pellet feed. In the future, he hopes to expand and improve his business and to be able to extend help to his nephews and nieces in their education.

loans.use: to purchase bags of grower pellet feed.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 63 years old, married, and runs a snack-vending business in Oroquieta. This is how she supports her family with a meagre income of PHP 4,000 per month. Recently, Phoebe requested a loan to buy nails, plywood and sticks to repair her house. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership in the Cooperative.

loans.use: to buy nails, plywood and sticks to use for home repair.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna, 50, is married and has four adult children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 11 years. The business has helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially for the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides a good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She took out loans previously to increase her additional stock of goods, and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is 66 years old and has 4 children. Concepcion is the only one who provides for her children, because she is a widow. She been engaged in food vending for 10 years, which has enabled her to keep her children in school. Concepcion joined GDMPC in 2010. Recently she took out a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional ingredients and new utensils to make burgers. Concepcion’s future plan is to expand the business so that she can continue to meet her children’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and buy new utensils in making burgers for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children in Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta. 

Since the early years of their marriage, Jocelyn and her husband have been farmers. She earns 10,000 PHP each cropping focusing on her rice farm. 

Jocelyn became an active member of PMPC in 2013. She is now requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer to have a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm. 

In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business to improve the general living conditions of her family and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Rosvilla

texts.en:
Rosvilla is a businesswoman from Oroquieta. She is 56 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari, or variety store. While she earns a meager income, it nevertheless manages to support her family, with help from the income her husband also earns. 

Rosvilla has applied for her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in order to gain access to financial assistance. Now, she has applied for her 1st loan so she can restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Rosvilla continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the determination to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Rucardo tiene 26 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge, tiene un hijo menor de 2 años, vive en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de Santo Tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café variedad catimore, actividad que realiza hace 4 años en terreno propio, contando con experiencia en este sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. También se dedica al cultivo de maíz amarillo y a la venta de animales menores como patos, gallinas, pavos, chanchos y cuyes. El destino del crédito sera para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, con ello obtendrá buena producción y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a 26-year old man who lives with his wife and 2-year old son. Their house is made of rustic material and located in the rural area of Santo Tomás district, province of Cutervo, region Cajamarca, north mountains of Perú. He lives in a small community that mainly lives from agriculture and stock breeding. 

He works in agriculture, mainly in coffee plantations (catimore variety). He has been cultivating coffee in his own land for 4 years and counts on a lot of experience in the field, as well as very good personal and professional references. He also cultivates yellow corn and sells small animals, such as ducks, hens, turkeys, pigs and guinea pigs. 

He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizers for the coffee plantations. Thanks to them he will have a good harvest and better income to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to maintain his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Nenita works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising livestock businesses. 

Nenita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell to customers. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment for her transport.

loans.name: Rodilyn

texts.en: As a married mother of two children, Rodilyn works hard to support her family.  She has a native bag-making business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rodilyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her native bag-making business.  Rodilyn has been sustaining her business activities with her past eight loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her native bag-making.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor y tiene 2 hijos.
 
Ana, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, decidió realizar este negocio porque ya tiene experiencia, el negocio lo tiene en su casa.

Ana, necesita el crédito para comprar maíz y leña para la venta de tortillas.

Los sueños de la Ana, es hacer una casita de bloque por donde vive de la madre .
texts.en:
Ana is 27 years old, and left education after the ninth grade, She has a partner who works as a farmer and has two children.

Ana makes a living selling tortillas. She decided to set up her business because she already had experience in it. Her business is in her home.

Ana needs the loan to buy corn and firewood to sell tortillas. Her dream is to build a cinderblock house where her mother lives.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to sell tortillas.

loans.name: Santos De Jesus

texts.es:
Santos, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene tres hijos que aún viven en casa y están estudian.

Santos,  se dedica al comercio de ganado y a la siembra de granos básicos, eventualmente también trabaja como seguridad privada, la parcela donde el trabaja está a 1 kilómetro de su casa, en la agricultura le ayuda el hijo más grande.

Santos, utilizara el dinero para colocar una tienda en su casa, ya que la tienda más cercana está a ½ kilómetro, el espera que sea de beneficio para su comunidad y para él.

El sueño de Santos, es poco a poco ir aumentando la cantidad de productos en la tienda.
texts.en:
Santos, age 37, went to school up through sixth grade.  He is in a common-law marriage, and his partner works doing household tasks.  He has three children who live at home and who are in school.

Santos works selling cattle and growing staple grains.  He also occasionally works as a private security guard.  The plot of land where he works is located one kilometer from his house.  His oldest son helps him with the agriculture.

Santos will use the money to put a store in his house, since the closest store is ½ kilometer away.  He hopes it will benefit his community and him.

Santos’s dream is to, little by little, increase the quantity of products in the store.

loans.use: to put a store in his house.

loans.name: Franklin Miguel

texts.es:
Movido por sus ganas de defender a quienes lo necesiten, Franklin va todos los días a clases. Él es un joven de diecinueve años de edad, que estudia la carrera derecho. Con una actitud firme y teniendo la justicia como su principal valor, va descubriendo su pasión por las leyes. Además tiene en casa un gran apoyo de parte de sus padres, los cuales son abogados. 
Franklin es un muchacho entusiasta y muy dedicado al estudio, él necesita una computadora portátil para agilizar sus trabajos asignados en clases, además que desea tomar un curso de inglés a la par de sus clases en la universidad. Por esta razón es que el recurre a KIVA junto a MiCrédito, para que le otorguen un préstamo y así cumplir ahora con estas dos meta con las que tanto soñó siempre. En sus planes está convertirse en un abogado capaz de asesorar el área legal de alguna empresa.
texts.en:
Moved by his desire to defend everyone who needs it, Franklin goes to classes every day. He is a 19-year-old young man who studies for a law degree. With a firm attitude and having justice as his principal value, he is finding his passion for the law.  In addition, he has a lot of support at home from his parents, who are lawyers.

Franklin is an enthusiastic guy and is very dedicated to his studies. He needs a laptop computer to make his assigned work easier in class, in addition, he wants to take an English course at the same time as his university courses. For this reason, he comes to Kiva with MiCrédito, so that they offer him a loan and in this way, achieve these two goals now that he has always dreamed of so much.  In his plans are becoming a lawyer capable of consulting a business in the legal area.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop and pay for an English course.

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en: The members of Ret’s Group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Ret makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of them to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Agée de 42 ans, Ama est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses cinq enfants  à Yokoè. Pour entreprendre une activité et disposer d’un revenu pour répondre à ses besoins, Ama  vend des bananes dans son quartier. Ama achète deux fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé pour revendre à ses clients. Dans le but d’acheter des bananes, Ama demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande afin de satisfaire agréablement ses clients et trouver le bénéfice pour permettre à ses enfants une bonne éducation.
texts.en: Ama is a 42 year old married woman who lives with her five children in Yokoè.  To continue her activity and have an available income to support her needs, Ama sells bananas in her neighborhood.  Ama buys bananas two times per months at the market of Adidogomé to resell to her clients.  Ama requests this loan to finance her purchase of bananas which will satisfy her clients and allow her the income to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy 22 bunches of bananas

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokhom makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khong's Group

texts.en: The members of Khong’s Group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Khong makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas esta estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas, comenta que es un joven que se esfuerza mucho por poder mejorar su vida, por medio de su aplicación a sus estudios. El es una persona muy luchadora que quiere ser alguien en la vida, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza para poder salir adelante. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para el pago de sus carreras, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
El pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder pagar otra vez las cuotas de su carrera, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir luchando.
texts.en:
Blas is studying for a degree in Systems Analysis. He comments that he's putting a lot of effort into improving his life through his commitment to his career studies. He works very hard and he wants to be somebody in life, every day striving to move forward.

His previous loan was used to pay tuition fees so that he could continue with his studies, and he is again requesting a loan for this purpose. 

Blas is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrian vive en la Ciudad de San Pedro, comenta que está estudiando la carrera de administración agropecuaria, Comenta que sus padres son quienes lo inspira en poder luchar para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Él es una persona que se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida y poder ayudar a las personas que necesitan ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto y seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Adrian lives in the city of San Pedro and says that he is studying for a degree in Agricultural Administration. He comments that his parents are who inspire him in being able to struggle to be able to be someone in life.

He is a person who works hard in order to be someone in life and be able to help people who need help.

He asks for this loan to be able to pay the fees for his degree, so as to be able to cover this expense and continue fighting for his goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 40 years old. He is married and has one child. He has been one of the jeepney (small bus) drivers of his community for almost five years. Because it is hard to make a living, he would like to continue to improve this business in order to earn a higher income.

Having insufficient capital, he is asking for an additional PHP 5,000.00 to buy car lights, oil and auto parts needed for the maintenance of his jeepney. Through this financial assistance, he believes that he will continue using his jeepney and provide safe transportation to his passengers.

loans.use: to buy car lights, oil and auto parts to maintain his jeepney

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: Marhabo is a responsible woman. She was born in 1981 and is from the southern part of a country. She lives in remote district with her husband and four children. Her husband is a builder and she earns an income by sewing pillows and blankets, making about 800-1000 TJS profit. Marhabo is committed to improve her family's life, and has requested a loan from Kiva to improve her family's living conditions by renovating her apartment. She looks forward to your support.

loans.use: to renovate her apartment

loans.name: Elorde

texts.en:
Elorde is aged 49 and married to an overseas Filipino worker (OFW).  They’re blessed with one child. He has owned and operated a transportation business in their town for almost 21 years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. His income from this business is usually spent on their daily expenses. 

Due to insufficient capital on his business, he would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 23,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle. He's hoping that his transportation business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is 44 years old and married with one child.  He lives in Potungan, Dapitan City. He has been a motor mechanic for three years, doing this type of work with a monthly income of 10,000 PHP.  Raul proves to anyone that disability is a not a hindrance to succeed in life.  

Raul is very happy and thankful that he became a member of Paglaum MPC, because of the opportunity offered to the members.  Raul has applied for a loan on his 2nd cycle amounting to 30,000 PHP to buy additional spare parts for motor repair.  He plans to expand his spare parts store someday and is very thankful to God for the talent he has.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for motor repair.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2009 and she appreciates the program’s, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She has a small piece of farmland near her home. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000. This loan is intended to pay for labor cosst on land preparation for growing crops. Veronica dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life, and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs on land preparation for growing crops.

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel, 53 years old, resides in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidenta, Philippines, where she is a married mother of five children, one of whom is still in college. 

Maridel joined PMPC on April 17, 2011 in order to access its programs and services. Recently, she requested her fourth loan for PHP 10,000 to buy a variety of food products to sell in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se caracteriza por la elaboración de sus dulces tradicionales a base de leche, maní e higos, celebraciones religiosas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pavos, gallinas y cerdos, también se dedica al cultivo de frutales y venta de leche fresca y panca en el mercado de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales y así tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes y una segunda parte para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos, generando mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Walter is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Zaña, a community that is known for making traditional milk-based sweets, peanuts and figs, and religious celebrations. Their population generally makes a living in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. This area is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, in the north coast of Perú.

He makes a living raising and selling small animals such as turkeys, chickens, and pigs. He is also involved in growing fruits and selling those, fresh milk, and chili peppers in the local market.

He is asking for a loan to buy balanced feed for his animals and thus improve production to offer his customers and additionally to pay for maintenance of his crops. This will enable him to generate better income for his family and allow him to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals and pay for maintenance of his crops.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos en casa propia de material rústico en una comunidad de clima templado, abundante vegetación, sus pobladores son amables y se dedican al cultivo de frutales, café, maíz y hortalizas, ubicado en el distrito de Santo Tomás, Provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café Variedad catimore resistente a enfermedades, actividad que realiza hace 4 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Adicionalmente cría animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, asegurando de esta manera una buena producción, lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
German is 49 years old, lives with his spouse and his four children in his own house made of rustic material in a community with a temperate climate, and abundant vegetation. The population is friendly and works growing fruit, coffee, corn, and vegetables, and it is located in the district of Santo Tomás, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works growing Catimore variety coffee, resistant to disease, which he has done for 4 years. He has experience in the field of coffee growing and has good personal and work references from his neighbors. In addition, he raises small animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others. The loan will be used to purchase manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop, assuring in this way a good production, which will be reflected in a larger volume of sales and in the end, he will get more income to, so as to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Mewa Begum

texts.en:
Mewa Begum is a 48-year-old woman, and mother of two sons and three daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a hotel where he sells different types of eatable items like chicken karahi, chicken tikka, kabab, beef karahi and etc. He is the only person responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Mewa Begum's husband needs to purchase different types of eatable and other items for his business purposes so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth, and earn a maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase these items for his business.

Therefore Mewa Begum has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.  She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his hotal business.

loans.name: Born's Group

texts.en:
Born’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Born makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has five children who are in school. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Maria Fe has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Maria Fe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria muy agradecida con el primer crédito financiado a través de COMIXMUL y los inversionistas KIVA compro los diferentes productos que ayudaron a mejorar sus cultivos de café, pago mano de obra calificada la cual ayudo a la aplicación del abono, fertilizantes, foliares, y de-sombrar para que la planta de café tenga lo necesario e ideal para su desarrollo. Doña Maria como mujer luchadora solicita se le apoye con su segundo crédito para la cría de gallinas ponedoras lo cual será un ingreso extra para el mejoramiento económico de su familia mientras sus entradas mayores las cuales provienen de sus cultivos de café son generadas en los últimos meses del año y los primeros de cada uno comprando los diferentes insumos que ayudaran al proceso adecuado para la mismas.
texts.en: Maria is very grateful for the first loan financed through COMIXMUL and the Kiva investors; she bought different products which helped her to improve her coffee crops, hire qualified labor which helped her to apply the manure, fertilizer, liquid fertilizer for the leaves, and provide shade so the coffee plants have what they need and is ideal for their development.  Maria, a determined woman, asks for the support of a second loan to raise laying hens which will be extra income for the economic benefit of her family while her greater input, coming from the coffee crop, is generated at the end of the year, and at the beginning of each year she purchases different supplies which will support the best process for them.

loans.use: to purchase feed to fatten the hens.

loans.name: Lutfiah

texts.en: One of our Ruma agents, Lutfiah, lives in Serang, a suburb located about a two-hour drive from Jakarta. She lives with her husband and two children (one daughter and one son) and earns a living by running a small stall where she sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services to people in her community.  Lutfiah has a cheerful, kind personality, as well as a strong will to improve her life. She joined Ruma in 2013 after learning about our organization from a sales executive who came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she wanted to try a new business opportunity. Because this business has grown, Lutfiah is hoping to get a loan from Kiva which she can use to provide more mobile payment services, especially on weekends. This loan will help Lutfiah improve her business, and help her community access mobile services.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for this community

loans.name: Yeut's Group

texts.en: Yeut’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Yeut makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sopheary's Group

texts.en: The two members of Sopheary’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sopheary makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work making food to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel to boil drinking water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Da's Group

texts.en: Da’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Da makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Corpusa

texts.en:
Corpusa is a businesswoman from Oroquieta, in the Philippines. She is married, and Corpusa owns and manages a retail store business, operating a retail store selling shoes, sandals, and slippers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns a good income each month, enabling her to provide for the needs of her family. 

Corpusa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. Corpusa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory of various items to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of various items to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, a 37-year-old married father of two, has had a clothes and ornaments business for six years. He will use this loan to purchase more clothes, beads and ornaments, hoping this will help him to meet high customer demand and increase his income to provide for the basic needs of his family.

In the future, Robert aspires to open a boutique shop and sell a wide variety of clothes, ornaments and shoes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a retail store in Aloran and earns a promising income to support her family, in addition to her husband.

She has signed up for her membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she availed herself of a loan to purchase more assorted goods to sell.

Corazon hopes to sustain her business and dreams to renovate and expand her house.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted goods to sell

loans.name: Maria Jane

texts.en:
Maria Jane is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Jane is 32 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Maria Jane has a barbershop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy equipment such as combs, hair clips, etc.

Maria Jane has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment such as combs, hair clips, etc.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is a 26-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family.

Haleema is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also will be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Haleema is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and other items for her daughter's beauty salon

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en: Maria del Carmen lives in San Martin, Puebla. She works as an assistant of a construction engineer. Her parents recently give her a piece of land where she can start building her own house. She has been saving for the last months so she can start the construction and now she is asking for a loan to complete the money she needs to buy the materials for the foundations and the walls of her new home. Maria del Carmen is excited to start a dream house and to give her family a house that can last a lifetime. She also feels proud of what her work can contribute to the well being of the people she loves the most. Maria del Carmen makes around $400 USD a month. Due to her low income and the informality of his job, Maria del Carmen is not able to ask for a credit from other institutions. With this credit, she will receive technical training and supervision from certified technicians to make sure that the construction is done and that it meets all safety and quality standards. Maria del Carmen is grateful for this opportunity and the hope of a better life.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to start with the foundations of her house.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is from Oroquieta. She is 55 years old and is married. 

Editha owns and manages a sari-sari store business, operating a small retail store selling assorted goods, particularly basic commodities in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. 

Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and develop her skill in business engagements. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Recently, Editha is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and be used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th loan from PMPC. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide her family a standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel had the skills and expertise in peanut butter processing, yet she had no capital to make it for business. As a mother from Aloran, she never gets tired of supporting her family in any way she can, and helping her husband earn an income. Isabel joined PMPC after she learned she could gain financial assistance and she decided to start a business, which is peanut butter processing. It has been doing well as she has worked to perfect the taste and quality of her product. Isabel has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. She has requested another loan from PMPC to purchase additional raw ingredients and cooking materials for her business. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and continue to benefit her family. Today, other retail businesses sell her product, which in turn helps them earn an income for their own families.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients and cooking materials for her business.

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.en:
Maria Delia is 56 years old and is widowed with 2 children. With 1 child in school, she works very hard to provide for all of them.

Maria Delia runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, junk foods, groceries, etc.

Maria Delia has been in this business for a year now. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ya's Group

texts.en: Ya’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Ya makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Surgir Group

texts.es:
Graciela es una mujer de 54 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos varones de 27, 24 y 19 y una hija mujer de 25 años, y su negocio es una tienda de barrio con alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, amable, generosa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Mirador’ un área caracterizada por el comercio de buen gusto, de clima templado, con una temperatura aproximada de 21 grados centígrados durante el verano.
Graciela es de tez morena, cabello largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de pie al centro, usa chompa floreada color naranja). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos; los cuatro mayores son independientes y tiene sus familias, el hijo menor estudia y trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus ganas de superación y su espíritu emprendedora la llevaron a conformar una banca de personas con negocios como; comercio de leche, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de chuño, comercio de bisutería, transporte libre, atención de fotocopias y taller de soldadura, para solicitar un préstamo y amplias sus actividades. Su negocio es una tienda de barrio con alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad, como; pan, azúcar, fideo, arroz, refrescos, papel higiénico y otros, labor que realiza todos los días de la semana desde muy tempranas horas del día hasta la media noche, en un cuarto propio. “heredé mi negocio de mi mamá, toda mi vida me dedique a la venta en mi tienda, trabajo con mucho empeño y dedicación…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un almacén grande donde pueda atender a muchos clientes, ella desea realizar la compra de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda y ofertar mayor variedad. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 35 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Graciela solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda, ofertar mayor variedad y conseguir más clientes.
texts.en:
Graciela is a 54-year old woman who lives with her husband. They have three sons, who are 27-, 24- and 19-years old respectively and a 25-year old daughter. Graciela's business is a neighborhood store where she sells foodstuffs and basic necessities.

Graciela is a good mother who is enterprising, friendly, generous, responsible and hard-working. Her business is in the ‘Mirador’ area, which is characterized by healthy commerce and a temperate climate with an approximate temperature of 21 degrees centigrade during the summer.

Graciela has a dark complexion and long hair that she wears in a braid. She is short, has dark eyes and a hardy build, and she wears traditional clothing (a brimmed hat, shawl and a traditional skirt). Graciela's first language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish with the general public and in her business. In the above photo, she is standing at the center and wearing an orange, flowered shawl).

Graciela shares her life with her husband, who makes his living in trade, and with her children. The four oldest live independently and have their own families. Her youngest son goes to school and works. They live in their own brick house that has potable water, electricity and sewage service.

Graciela's desire to improve her personal situation and her enterprising spirit brought her to form a communal bank of people with businesses such as: milk sales, selling second-hand clothing, selling freeze-dried potatoes, photocopy services and a welding workshop. They are requesting a loan together to expand their businesses.

Graciela's business is a neighborhood store that sells foodstuffs and basic necessities such as: bread, sugar, noodles, rice, beverages, toilet paper and other items. She works every day of the week from very early in the morning until midnight in her own space. She says, "I inherited the business from my mother. My whole life, I dedicated myself to working in my store with a lot of determination and dedication." Graciela's hope is to have a big store where she could serve a lot of customers. She wants to purchase foodstuffs and basic necessities to stock up her store and offer a greater variety of products for sale. This is her second lending cycle with the institution in the 35 years she has had her store.

This is why Graciela is requesting a loan- to purchase foodstuffs and basic necessities to stock up her store, offer a greater variety of products for sale and thereby get more customers.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs and basic necessities to stock up her store, have a greater variety or products for sale and thereby have more customers.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1991. She lives in a remote district. She is married and has one child. Mavluda is a responsible, conscious and honest person. She is a sewer. She sews traditional and stylish women dresses. She sews dresses well, but for embroidering she uses other services. She is planning to make own traditional and creative dresses with embroidering. She wants to buy computerized sewing machine for the productivity of her business. Mavluda attracts a lot of customers for her traditional dresses. She is asking 3000 TJS loan from KIVA project to buy her sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry is 44 years old and married. He is raising his family in a rural community. He aims to uplift their status of living in order to give his family a better life. Aside from planting and harvesting rice and vegetables, he also operates his motorcycle transport to earn additional income. To continuously operate his motorcycle, he would like to avail a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy motor parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. Through hard work and strong determination, Jerry believes that someday, he will improve their status of living.

loans.use: to buy motor parts and accessories needed

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is now 71 years old and has had a farming business in Olkalau town for more than 25 years. She used her previous loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk to sell and thereby increase her overall income.

She will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer and hopes this will help her grow more maize, beans and vegetables to generate more income.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to buy more farm inputs and become a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer in hopes that this will help her grow more maize.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 38 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are in school.

Ofelia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Ofelia requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill.

Ofelia has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood and tools for her son's furniture work.

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en: Vy’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Vy makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria de 43 años de edad se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Maria vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 43 years old. For the past 6 years, she has made a living selling tortillas. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers. With what she earns through her work she aims to pay for household expenses. She lives in her own home with her life partner and their three children. She is applying for a loan to buy corn in quintales (100 lbs) and lime to continue making tortillas and in this way be able to make greater earnings to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn in quintales (100 lbs) and lime

loans.name: Ricamar  Sr.

texts.en: Ricamar Sr. has a mango farm in Aloran. This is his primary source of income for his family. Ricamar  Sr. makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and good income. Recently, he needed money to purchase herbicides for growing mangoes and to pay for labor costs for preparing his land. He asked PMPC for the loan. Ricamar Sr. wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply mangoes to fruit stands in neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides for growing mangoes and to pay for labor costs for preparing his land.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila is managing her eatery business in Ozamiz. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. She has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts catering for added income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 29 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school. Teodora is married.

Teodora is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Teodora requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Teodora has been in this business for 1 year now and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood and tools for her son's furniture work.

loans.name: Tasneem

texts.en:
Tasneem is a responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For five years, her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to repair his taxi because its current condition is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore, Tasneem has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Tasneem's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income.

Tasneem  also plans to use the profits for savings to meet her family's needs in future.

Tasneem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Madnur

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Madnur. Madnur lives in Serang, located about two hours drive from Jakarta. Madnur lives there with his wife and two sons. Madnur is a civil servant.

He joined Ruma in 2013. At first, he knew about Ruma from one of his friends who already had become a Ruma agent. Then, because he was getting curious about Ruma, he came by himself to one of Ruma’s branches near his house. After he got a complete explanation about Ruma from Ruma field staff, he was interested to join Ruma. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to become an entrepreneur.

Now, he owns a small stall where he provides mobile payment services for his community. His community sees him as a trusted, friendly and informative mobile payment service provider.

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Madnur sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Having known about the importance, Madnur knows your loan will be very useful to help him improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Madnur is the one who is standing in front of his own small stall. He will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community.

loans.name: Savong's Group

texts.en:
