Savong’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. 

Savong works as farmer and raises cows to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel to boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Tho's Group

texts.en:
Tho’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Tho makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel to boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Theng's Group

texts.en:
Theng’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. 

Theng makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as construction labourer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel to boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ruom's Group

texts.en:
Ruom’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia.  

Ruom makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farmer to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel to boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her salon.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma tiene 32 años de edad y vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella posee desde hace 9 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con las ventas que realiza y las ganancias que obtiene es como ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Norma is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her three children. For the past 9 years she has owned a small store located in her place of residence. She has many customers because of her good prices and the courtesy with which she makes sales. With the sales she makes and the profits she obtains she has achieved success with her family. She is applying for a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc. and in this way be able to have better earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of threads, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls for her embroidery work.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, 48, is a married man from Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has four children, three are in school and one is a teacher. He is a school principal and earns, on average, USD 5 a day. He has been in this career for fifteen years.  

Recently, some parts of his house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living situation for the household. Due to the lack of funds, he has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for his house renovation. He and his family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for his house renovation.

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en: Chenda’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chenda works as farmer and she also does work as farm teacher to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Caribeans Girl Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujer de la etnia creole (Jeammie Eugenia, Liza Merly y Nora Isabel). Ellas luchan día a día para llevar el sustento a sus hogares y seguir mejorando sus pequeños negocios de: Pulpería, ropa usada, venta de mariscos y bastimentos. Se unieron hace seis meses con el propósito de obtener financiamiento para mejorar su nivel de ingresos y calidad de vida de sus familias.

Con el primer crédito otorgado por Managua y financiado por KIVA, le permitió a Jeammie Eugenia, coordinadora del grupo solidario comprar insumos e ingredientes para elaborar vigoron y frito, a Nora Isabel integrante del grupo solidario, le permitió vender nuevos productos, como prensapelos, cosméticos. 

Nora Isabel: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, trabajadora de 33 años de edad, soltera. Con el propósito de tener su propio ingreso y apoyar a su mama con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de verduras, bastimentos, frutas y mariscos de manera ambulante en las paradas de buses de Bilwi. Solicita financiamiento para diversificar sus productos, comprar accesorias para damas, cosméticos entre otros productos de belleza. Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio y establecer una tienda de ropa y calzados.
texts.en:
This communal bank consists of three creole women: Jeammie Eugenia, Liza Merly, and Nora Isabel. They struggle daily to support their families and continue to improve their small businesses, which consist of a small grocery store and sales of used clothing, seafood, and provisions. The women joined forces six months ago with the objective of securing financing to improve their family's income and quality of life. The first loan granted by Managua and financed by Kiva enabled Jeammie Eugenia, the group coordinator, to purchase supplies and ingredients for preparing traditional dishes such as vigorón and fritters; it also enabled Nora Isabel, another group member, to sell new products such as flat irons and cosmetics.

Nora Isabel is one of the communal bank members. She is 33 years old and a kind, hardworking, single woman. In order to have her own income and help her mother with household expenses, she has worked as a street vendor for the last five years. She sells vegetables, provisions, fruits, and seafood at the Bilwi city bus stops. Nora Isabel is requesting a loan to diversify her products by purchasing women's accessories, cosmetics, and other beauty products. She dreams of growing her business and establishing a women's clothing and footwear store.

loans.use: to purchase women's accessories, cosmetics, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Yit's Group

texts.en: Yit’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Yit makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is a businesswoman in Tangub City. She is 33 years old, married, and a microfinance member of PMPC. Jenilyn runs a retail store selling assorted goods. Running this type of business has supported her husband in sustaining their family, especially in the education of her children. 

Recently she applied for a loan to purchase more assorted consumable goods for her store. 

Jenilyn believes having enough inventory would allow her to cater to her customers' needs. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted consumable goods for her store

loans.name: Jacqueline Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Jacqueline, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores  de edad e  independientes. Su esposo es empleado público. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte  confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Jaqueline es una mujer que le gusta a base de esfuerzo ganar sus propios ingresos y así mejorar su situación económica, ella tiene un local en su casa  donde realiza varias actividades, tiene su  taller de costura, unas cabinas telefónicas y unas vitrinas en las cuales exhibe ropa, artículos de catalogo y útiles escolares. Ella no se complica en su trabajo ya que se da tiempo para todo lo que sus clientes necesiten, así ella se entretiene y se gana sus propios recursos, lleva 10 años con su local el cual le da muy buenas satisfacciones.
Este crédito es para comprar telas, ropa y útiles escolares. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y bajos intereses. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the community of Montecristi the Credit Group "Para el Futuro de la Mujer" meets every fifteen days. This place is well known for its rich and traditional culture, and one can find a large variety of artisanal goods made by its inhabitants. 

Jacqueline lives in this area. She is 48 years old, married and has three adult children from this marriage, who are independent. Her husband is a government employment. Many years ago she learned to cut clothing at a local school.

Jacqueline is a woman who likes to earn her own living from her own work and in this way better her economic situation. She has a shop in her home where she does many activities. She has a workshop, a telephone booth and display case where she shows clothing, catalog items and other supplies. Work is not difficult for her, since she makes time for everything that her customers may need. In this way she keeps herself busy and earns her own living. She has spent 10 years working in her community, and it is a job that gives her much satisfaction. 

This loan is to buy fabric, clothing and other supplies. She has been with the Credit Group since its founding and she likes it because the loans are quick and come with a low interest rate. Her dream is to continue bettering her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, clothing and supplies

loans.name: Salimahon

texts.en:
Salimahon is a generous woman. She was born in 1977. She is from the southern part of a country. She is divorced. She has two children. 

Salimahon has a canteen where she serves a lot of clients. She cooks tasty and delicious dishes; she attracts satisfied and permanent customers to her canteen. 

Salimahon is planning to buy an oven and a microwave oven for increasing the productivity of her service. She requested a 5,000 TJS loan to increase the productivity of her canteen.

loans.use: to buy an oven and a microwave oven

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 42 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from selling cosmetics.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia.  Horn makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as farmer to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and the man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sary makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a soldier and seller to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and the man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Dezire

texts.en:
Dezire lives in Kasese, Uganda. He is married and is responsible for taking care of six children. He is a health worker by profession who earns a monthly salary. With his salary, he was able to educate his children, and some of them are graduates. 

His dreams are to live a modest life and build a residential house. 

Dezire intends to use the loan to buy construction materials, such as bricks and sand, to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as bricks and sand, to complete his house.

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en:
Dilshad is a 32-year-old woman, and a mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a stall chat, he sells different types of eatable items e.g channa chat, dahi bhalay, fruit chat, etc. He is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Dilshad's husband needs to purchase different types of edibles and other items for his business purposes so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth, and earn the maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase these items for his business purposes.

Therefore Dilshad has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different types of edibles and other items for husband's business purposes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 61,  a widow in Ozamiz City, she runs a store that primarily supports for her family. She never gets tired of tending her store. 

Rosa is a full fledged member of PMPC, and has took several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. 

Now she has borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities.

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en: Merilyn operates a motor transport business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For her to continue her business, she availed a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. She dreams of owning motor units and being able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts/repair.

loans.name: Julieto

texts.en: Julieto lives in Gango, Ozamiz and supports his three children by building houses from the ground up. He has successfully repaid his whole loan, which he used to buy building material and paints and to pay his workers. He wants his daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work he has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material and paints and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie has enthusiasm in managing her farming activities in Silangit, Tangub City. Aside from doing her hobby, she is earning as well. Since she wants to be more productive, Josie engages in a snack vending business to expand her resources. Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from her earnings. Josie hopes to provide her family with safe and comfortable living quarters, so she requested a loan to purchase marine plywood, nails and plain sheet for house roofing. Josie wishes to earn more from her business to continuously benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase marine plywood, nails and plain sheet for house roofing

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 67 years old and is married with seven children. He has had a tree nursery business for 14 years in Nakuru town, and it has been profitable. 

He will be using the loan to purchase a motorcycle and start a motorcycle transport business. This will help him increase his income, and also supply nursery trees to his customers. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business and care for his grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to start a motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's welding work

loans.name: Franklin Alexander

texts.es:
Franklin, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y su pareja administra un pequeño cafetín y solo tienen una niña de 1 año de edad.

Franklin, tiene un cafetín cerca de la escuela de su comunidad, coloco este negocio junto a su pareja que es quien actualmente lo administra, con el fin de generar ingreso para el hogar, Franklin, también trabaja cuidando unas vacas de un vecino. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar productos como: golosinas, dulces, pan, café, gaseosas, entre otros, con esta inversión, mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia, porque tendrá la oportunidad de obtener más ingresos.

El sueño de Franklin, es tener un cafetín más grande.
texts.en:
Franklin, who is 21 years old, studied until the ninth grade. He is in a relationship and his partner runs a small cafe. They only have one daughter who is 1-year-old. 

Franklin has a small cafe near the school in his community. He started the cafe together with his partner, who currently manages it. With the goal of generating additional income for the home, he also works caring for a neighbor's cows. 

The loan will be used to buy products such as: candies, sweets, bread, coffee, and soft drinks, among others. With this investment, he will improve the quality of life of his family, because he will have the opportunity to earn more. 

Franklin's dream is to have a bigger cafe.

loans.use: to buy products such as: candies, sweets, bread, coffee, and soft drinks, among others.

loans.name: Chansoline

texts.en:
Chansoline is 30 years old. She is married with three children aged between 1 and 8 years. Two of her children go to school. Chansoline is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 7 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and increase her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.en: Anselmo is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of his home. Anselmo hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing supported by his loan of PHP 40,000. He hopes to sustain his business so that he can promptly pay off his loan in a timely manner. He is thankful for having all of his financing needs for his retailing business supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for housing renovations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer, and to pay the rent for the land where he grows.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her.

Fely is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sandra, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tienen 3 hijos, solo el mayor está en la escuela. 

Sandra, tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y golosinas desde hace 3 años, por la necesidad de ayudar en los gastos del hogar, tuvo que dedicarse a este negocio; además, le ayuda a cultivar maíz a su pareja.- El negocio que ella tiene, se encuentra a unas 5 cuadras de su vivienda y se levanta a las 5:00 de la mañana para preparar el desayuno a su familia y luego se va hasta la escuela que es donde ella vende sus frutas, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar frutas como: sandia, naranja, melones, papaya, pepino, manzana, etc.

Sus sueños son ver a sus hijos graduarse en la universidad, ya que ella no lo logró y también, llegar a tener  su propio  cafetín, porque donde ella vende es propiedad de la escuela.
texts.en:
Sandra, 23 years old, attended school until the 7th grade.  She is married and her partner works in agriculture.  They have 3 children and only the oldest is in school.

Sandra has had a business selling fruit and snacks for 3 years.  She had to engage in this business because of the need to help with the household expenses.  She also helps her partner cultivate corn.  Her business is located about 5 blocks from her home.  She gets up at 5:00 in the morning to prepare breakfast for her family and then she goes to the school, which is where she sells her fruit.  Her work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m.

The loan will be used to buy fruits like watermelons, oranges, melons, papayas, cucumbers, apples, etc. 

Her dreams are to see her children graduate from university, since she wasn’t able to do that, and also to come to have her own small café, because where she sells now is property of the school.

loans.use: to buy fruits like watermelons, oranges, melons, papayas, cucumbers, apples, etc.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, por la pobreza en que vivía, ya no pudo seguir estudiando, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tienen 3 hijos, 2 de ellos están estudiando.   

Rosibel, tiene una tienda desde hace 5 años, la necesidad de ayudar en los gastos del hogar la llevo colocar la tienda; antes de tener la tienda, ella cultivaba maíz junto a su pareja, ella se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. porque a las 5:30am están los primeros clientes tocando la puerta, para comprar el pan y el café para el desayuno.

El crédito será para comprar productos de la canasta básica, detergentes, entre otros para su tienda.

Sus sueños son, ver a sus hijos graduarse en la universidad y que su pequeña tienda se convierta en un mini-super.
texts.en:
Rosibel, 39 years old, attended school until the 3rd grade.  Because of the poverty in which she lived, she wasn’t able to continue studying.  She is married and her partner works in agriculture.  They have 3 children; 2 of them attend school.

Rosibel has had a store for 5 years.  The need to help with the household expenses led her to set up the store.  Before having her store, she cultivated corn with her partner.  She gets up at 5:00 a.m. because at 5:30 a.m. the first customers are knocking at the door to buy bread and coffee for breakfast.

The loan will be used to purchase basic staple products and detergents, among other things, for her store. 

Her dreams are to see her children graduate from university and that her small store becomes a mini-supermarket.

loans.use: to buy basic staple products and detergents, among other things, for her store.

loans.name: Sutrisna

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Sutrisna. Sutrisna lives in Serang, located about two hours drive from Jakarta. Sutrisna is a young man who has a strong will to learn about business. At his young age, he already owns a small stall where he sells daily consumer products, mobile phone accessories and provides mobile payment services for his community. His community sees him as a trusted, friendly and informative mobile payment service provider. 

Sutrisna joined Ruma in 2013. He learned about Ruma from one of sales executives who came to his stall. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Sutrisna sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Sutrisna improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Sutrisna is the one who is sitting in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Lowossoubé Group

texts.fr: Rihanata, est une femme dynamique, mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous majeurs. 2 de ses enfants travaillent, une de ses fille est mariée et le dernier de ses enfants est encore en quête de travail. Rihanata et les autres membres du groupe Lowossoubé sont à ACFIME depuis mars 2011 et elles sont à leur 9ème contrat de prêt avec l’institution. Ce groupe à toujours bien fait ses remboursements. Rihanta a besoin de prêt pour améliorer ses services à l'endroit de ses clients. Ce prêt lui sera vraiment utile. A la fin du prêt, les bénéfices de Rihanata lui permettront de continuer son commerce et de subvenir à certains de besoin de sa famille.
texts.en: Rihanata is a dynamic woman, married and mother of 4 children, all adults. Two of her children work, one of her daughters is married and the last of her children is still looking for work. Rihanata and the other members of the group Lowossoubé have been with ACFIME since March 2011 and they are on their 9th loan agreement with the organization. This group has always repaid their loans in time. Rihanata needs this loan to improve her services in her establishment. This loan will really be useful for her. Because of the loan, Rihanata's profits will allow her to continue her business and to fulfill certain needs of her family.

loans.use: To grow their restaurant and to offer a larger menu to their clientele.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos que viven con ella y están estudiando.


Rosa, vende plátanos, desde pequeña se ha dedicado al negocio, su padre se lo enseño; también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, la platanera está a una cuadra de casa, la venta la hace una vez por mes.

Con el préstamo ella comprará abono para la platanera, de está manera ella logrará que sus cultivos sean más productivos.

El sueño de Rosa, es sembrar más plantas de plátano en su terreno, para hacer crecer más el negocio, ella espera que sus hijos se encarguen del negocio cuando ella no este.
texts.en:
Rosa, 44, studied up to the seventh grade.  She is a single mother and has two children who live with her and are studying.
Rosa sells bananas.  From a very young age, she has been making a living in this business.  Her father showed her how.  She also makes a living raising pigs.  The banana plot is a block from the house.  She sells one time per month.
She will buy manure for the banana plot with the loan.  In this way, she will make it so her plants will be more productive.
Rosa's dream is to plant more banana plants on her land so that her business will grow more.  She hopes that her children will take charge of the business when she is not there.

loans.use: to buy manure for the banana plot.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургуль, 42 года, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Нургуль среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 1993 года занимается животноводством, полеводством и продажей молока. Благодаря упорному труду Нургуль в хозяйстве имеется: 3 коровы, 20 овец и 4,0 Га земельной доли, на которой она выращивает фасоль. В общей сложности деятельность Нургуль приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и 20 овец. Доходы от кредита Нургуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также накопить средства на постройку собственного дома для ее семьи.
texts.en: Nurgul is 42 years old and the married mother of two children.  She has a secondary education.  As an additional source of income for her family, she has been raising livestock, growing crops and selling milk since 1993.  Thanks to her very hard work, she has come to the point where she now owns three cows and 20 sheep.  She also grows beans on four hectares of land.  In total, her activity brings her about 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  This loan will help her to buy one cow and 20 sheep.  Nurgul is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her activity and to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy one cow and 20 sheep in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Arcenio

texts.es:
Arsenio es un hombre de 25 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno.
Él es emprendedor, paciente, de buena actitud, comprometido con su trabajo, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Huayrocondo’ que se encuentra a 60 kilómetros de la ciudad, Al pasar por la carretera la localidad no parece de gran tamaño, pero esto cambia cuando se decide conocerla. Frente a sus enormes campos abiertos, sus montañas protegidas por la Cordillera Real y sus vientos aguerridos, los habitantes de los tres pisos ecológicos de este municipio tratan de escribir una nueva historia en su actividad como criadores y productores, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-16 grados centígrados.
Arsenio es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de sus padres, que son mayores y ya no trabajan, viven en una casa construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno, él se dedica a visitar las diferentes ferias de la zona en busca de ganado lechero, terneros, mejorado y todas las variedades para criarlos, engordarlos y venderlos, actividad que lleva realizando toda su vida, primero ayudando a sus padres y actualmente de forma independiente. “las ferias de ganado comienzan muy temprano en la madrugada, inclusive antes que salga el sol y existen varias ferias ganaderas, en todas me conocen y tengo clientes constantes porque sabes que conozco esta negocio desde toda mi vida…” comenta. Su sueño es contar con un establo grande y en buenas condiciones para incursionar en lechería, él dese realizar la compra de ganado lechero para su cría, engorde y comercio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Arsenio solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero y realizar su emprendimiento en la lechería.
texts.en:
25-year old Arsenio is single and has no children. He earns his living selling cattle.

He is enterprising, hardworking, has a good attitude, is committed to his work, and responsible. His farm is located in the community of Huayrocondo, about 60 km from the city. When you pass the community on the highway, it doesn’t seem at all large, but that changes once you get to know it. 

In front are enormous open plains with mountains protected by the Cordillera Real and strong winds. The inhabitants of the three ecological zones of this municipality are trying to write a new chapter through their work as cattle breeders and producers. The climate is cold and dry, with a daily temperature that ranges between 2 and 16C.

Arsenio has a dark complexion, short black hair, dark eyes, and is of medium build. His native language is Aymara which he speaks at home, but he also speaks Spanish for cultural and business purposes. He lives with his parents who are older and no longer work. They live in a brick house with a metal-sheet roof; they get water from a well and have electricity.

Arsenio sells cattle and he keeps an eye open for milk cows, calves and other animals in the different markets in the area. He then raises, fattens, and sells them. It’s a job he’s been doing his whole life, first of all assisting his father, and now independently. He notes that cattle markets begin very early in the morning, sometimes before the sun rises. He says he is well known in the various markets, and he has regular customers because they know he has worked in the business for his whole life. Arsenio’s dream is to have a large number of well-cared for animals. He wishes to move into dairy farming so he wants to buy milk cows to raise, fatten, and finally sell. This is the first loan he’s had with this institution in the five years he has been working independently.

For these reasons Arsenio is seeking a loan to buy dairy cows and begin his new business venture.

loans.use: buy dairy cows and start his new business venture

loans.name: Gulzina

texts.ru: Гулзина, 29 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, она работает воспитателем в детском саду. Также занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве Гулзины на сегодняшний день имеется корова, 6 овец. Также арендует 0,60 Га земли, где выращивает ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулзина обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и хочет построить сараи для скота.
texts.en: Gulzina is 29 years old, married, and raising two children.  She works as a preschool teacher, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  In addition, she is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture.  She currently has one cow and six sheep on her farm.  She also leases 0.6 hectare of land on which she grows barley.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy five sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her farming activity and to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy 5 sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Sim’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. 

Sim makes a living cultivating rice, though she also earns extra income by making and selling cakes to support her family.  

In the group's village there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families. They will also be able to save both money otherwise spent on medical expenses and time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a administrar una tienda en su casa, tiene un hijo que aún no estudia, actualmente viven en casa de su madre. 

Cesar, es empleado y trabaja dando mantenimiento a piscinas desde hace 8 años, no tiene otro tipo de ingresos, antes solo estudiaba.- Su casa está a tres cuadras del trabajo y viaja en moto, su horario es desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta 4:30 p.m.  

El necesita el crédito para comprar material para construir su vivienda, pues quiere tener su propia casa.

Su sueño es construir su propia casa y dejársela como herencia a su hijo.
texts.en:
Cesar, who is 24-years old, went to school until ninth grade.  He is married, and his wife earns her living running a store out of the house.  They have one son who does not yet go to school.  They are currently living in Cesar's mother's house.  

Cesar is an employee who has worked for the last eight years providing maintenance for pools.  He doesn't have any other source of income.  Before working, he only went to school.  Cesar's house is three blocks from his work, and he gets there on motorcycle.  He works from 7:00 a.m. until 4:30 p.m.  

Cesar needs to the loan to purchase materials to build his house, as he wants to have his own home. 

Cesar's dream is to build his own house and leave it as an inheritance for his son.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build his house.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Ее зовут Дилрабо. Она живет в городке Конибодом и ей 36 лет. Дилрабо ответственная, гостеприимная и приятная в общение женщина. Она проживает вместе свекровью и  двумя дочерьми. Муж находится за приделами страны на заработках. Дилрабо занимается шитьем женской одежды и халатов на заказ. Она прекрасно справляется со своей работой и количество клиентов постепенно возрастают. Она продвигает эту деятельность более 5 лет. Дилрабо обратилась за кредитом, потому что хочет улучшить деятельность. За счет кредита она купить ткани, чтобы сшить больше разные одежды.  Это кредит поможет ей приобрести больше ткани и привлечь больше клиентов. Помогите ей достичь своих целей. Дилрабо будет очень рада на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Meet Dilrabo, a 36-year-old resident of the city of Konibodom.  Dilrabo is a responsible, welcoming and pleasant woman.  She lives with her mother-in-law and her two daughters, as her husband is currently working abroad.  Dilarbo sews women's clothes and coats from individual orders that she receives.  She does an excellent job and she is attracting an increasing number of customers.  She has been involved in this activity for more than five years now. She has applied for a loan in order to improve her activity.  She will use her loan to buy fabrics, so that she can sew a greater variety of clothes.  This loan will allow her to purchase more fabrics and attract a larger number of customers.  Please help Dilrabo to meet her goals.  She will be very happy to receive your support.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and increase her activity.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru: Это Шарифа. Она серьезная и шустрая женщина. Шарива проживает в городе Конибодом. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Шарифа живет со своей семьей. Она 2008 году начала занимается бизнесом продажей фрукты. Шарифа занимается бизнесом с мужем. Они продают виноград, мандарин, яблоко и груша. Сейчас Шарифа собирается привезти больше фрукты, чтобы расширить бизнес. У нее есть постоянные клиенты. Она хорошо зарабатывает и не хочет потерят ежедненый доход. По этой причине она обратилпсь за кредитом.
texts.en: Meet Sharifa, a serious and intelligent woman from the city of Konibodom.  Sharifa is married and the mother of three children.  She lives with her family and she has been selling fruits since 2008.  She and her husband work together, selling grapes, tangerines, apples and pears.  Sharifa is getting ready to bring in more fruits, which will help her to increase her business.  She has some regular customers.  She makes a decent living and does not want to lose her daily income.  For this reason, she is taking a loan.

loans.use: to bring in more fruits and increase her business.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es: Jose de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose, 33, lives in his own house with his life companion.  He has been making a living from agriculture, planting corn and beans, for several years.  When the harvest is ready, he stores it in the grain bags seen in the photograph for future sales in the outskirts of the zone where he resides.  
He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, blight control, herbicides, etc. in order to continue with his crops and thus obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, blight control, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Abril Group

texts.es:
Yajaira, Noemi Noruel y Delmy Lee), pertenecen a la etnia miskita, de la comunidad de Lamlaya que en vocablo miskito significa agua mansa, se localiza a 15 kilómetros de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que venden mariscos y nacatamal, con cuyos ingresos aportan para las necesidades básicas de sus hogares. Se organizaron hace 4 meses para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

MAYAJAIRA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una joven de 28 años de edad, casada con un hijo de 6 años de edad estudia su primer grado. Su esposo trabaja como chofer. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de su hijo. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar más productos de mariscos y pescados para vender e incrementar sus ingresos y atender a más personas que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
Yajaira, Noemi Noruel, and Delmy Lee belong to the Mosquito ethnic group of the community of Lamlaya, which in the Mosquito vocabulary means "calm water".  It is located 15 kilometers from the city of Bilwi in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas.  They are enterprising women who sell seafood and tamales which brings them income for the basic necessities of their households.  They organized six months ago in order to access loans with a solidary guarantee from Pana Pana.
Mayajaira is a member of the solidary group.  She is a young woman of 28 years who is married with a six-year-old son who is studying in the first grade.  Her husband works as a driver.  For six years, she has been making a living from the sales of fish and seafood.  In this way, she generates her own income and contributes to the household expenses and to her son's studies.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy more seafood and fish products to sell, to increase her income, and to serve more people who demand this product which constitutes one of the basic foodstuffs in Bilwi.  She dreams of being able to amass enough capital to establish a small restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more seafood and fish products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for her husband's embroidery material sales shop.

loans.name: Roxana Valeriana

texts.es: Roxana de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la crianza de ganado, comercializa su producto con las procesadoras y ganaderos de los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de toretes para continuar con la crianza y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roxana, 33, lives in her own house with her family group.  For 15 years, she has been making a living raising cattle.  She sells her product to processors and ranchers in the small towns and she already has established customers.  With what she obtains from her sales, she is able to come out ahead.  
She is requesting a loan to buy young bulls in order to continue with the cattle raising and thus be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy young bulls.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина жительница города Конибодом. Ей 33 лет. Она проживает вместе мамой, мужем и детьми. Парвина долгое время печет вкусные и красивые самбусы. Она печет самбусы на заказ. Парвина 8 лет своей жизни занимается этой видом бизнеса. Ей в работе помогает мама. У нее больше клиентов. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Парвина хочет получить кредит и за счет кредита отремонтировать комнаты. На счет наемных средств она намерена приобрести строй материал (краски, обои и другие), принадлежности. Она много лет жила в старом доме и несколько лет копила деньги на ремонт. Парвина была очень расстроена признав, что ее денег не хватит для завершения ремонта и для ее единственный выход получения кредита.
texts.en:
Parvina, age 33, lives in the city of Konibodom with her mother, her husband and her children.  For the past eight years of her life, she has been baking delicious and beautiful "samboosas" (Tajik-style samosas).  She bakes from individual orders that she receives from her many customers. Her mother helps her with this activity.

Parvina is applying for a loan to renovate a room inside her house.  She will use this loan to purchase construction supplies (paints, wallpaper etc.).  She has been living in the same old house for many years and, for a few years already, she had been saving money for renovations. She was very upset when she realized that she still didn't have enough money to complete those renovations, so she sees this loan as her only solution.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renovate her house.

loans.name: Holmirzo

texts.en:
Holmirzo, 53, is a hardworking, responsible, conscientious, confident and gentle person. He is married, has three children and lives in a remote district in Tajikistan.

Holmirzo is an experienced farmer. His family helps with the farming. He is asking for a 10,000 TJS loan through IMON International to buy fertilizer, seed, corn and pay for tractor services. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, corn and pay for tractor services on his farm

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol, 58, lives in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has nine children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farm, which is located in her community. So far, she has been in this type of business for 16 years. She is able to make an earning of 5 USD per day.

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of traveling. 

She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Ret, 48, is residing in the Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has three children. 

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farm located in her community. So far, she has been in this type of business for 25 years. She is able to make an earning of 2 USD per day.

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of traveling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 40 years old and married. She lives with her husband and four children in Bonifacio, Tangub City. For the past 15 years, Elena and her husband have been farmers. She earns 12,000 PHP each cropping season, focusing on her rice farm.  

Elena became an active member of PMPC in 2013. She is now requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer in order to have a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business, in order to improve the general living conditions of her family and to provide her children with a good education. 

In the future, Elena wishes to live a happy and comfortable life and be able to arrange a decent home for everyone in her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Jocelyn is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business through her past four loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling spare parts in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Norma is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more spare parts for resale.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Josie works hard to support her family.

She has a native bag-making business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Josie is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy raw materials for her native bag-making business.

Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making her native bags.

loans.name: Nelissa

texts.en:
Nelissa is 42 years old and married with seven children. Four of her children are in school.

She earns a living by selling livestock in the Philippines. Nelissa is borrowing 10,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more livestock for resale.

Nelissa has been selling livestock for seven years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more livestock for resale.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fattening pigs. Warlita is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Warlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma.Cecilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a personal products sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more personal products for resale.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Ma.Cecilia's business profile, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more personal products for resale, like body lotion, perfume and other items.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of goods to sell at her general store.

Luisa successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Luisa's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of goods to sell.

loans.name: Sorng's Group

texts.en:
Sorng’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sorng makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer and construction worker to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each group member to safeguard the health of their families and to save money on medical expenses, as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter in order to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta secundaría, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a cuidar el hogar, todavía no tienen hijos y vive en casa de sus padres.

Israel, se dedica a la fontanería desde hace seis años, lo aprendió debido a la necesidad y porque no encontró trabajo de su profesión; un amigo le enseño a operar la bomba de agua.- Antes de este trabajo estudiaba, su trabajo le queda a un kilómetro de distancia, recorre este tramo en una bicicleta y su horario de trabajo es de 5:00 a.m a 7:00 de la noche.

El préstamo será para comprar 18 pliegos de lámina, 18 cuartones de madera, 3 vigas, clavos y costaneras, para arreglar el techo de la vivienda.

El sueño de Israel, es tener una casa digna, para vivir cómodamente con su familia y en un futuro desea especializarse en trabajos de electricidad.
texts.en:
Israel, 28, studied up to secondary school.  He is married and his wife takes care of the home.  They still have no children and live in his parents' house.
Israel has been making a living from plumbing for six years.  He learned it out of necessity and because he did not find work in his profession.  A friend taught him how to operate the water pump.  Before this work, he was studying.  His works one kilometer away from home and he travels this route on a bicycle.  He works from 5:00 a.m. to 7:00 at night.
The loan will be for the purchase of 18 sheets of corrugated tin, 18 wooden planks, three beams, nails and washers in order to repair the roof of his residence.
Israel's dream is to have a worthy house in order to live comfortably with his family and in the future he would like to specialize in electrical work.

loans.use: to buy 18 sheets of corrugated tin, 18 wooden planks, three beams, nails and washers in order to repair the roof of his residence.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 60 years old and married. She owns and has managed a small retail store in her community for almost 20 years. 

She aims to increase her product offerings and satisfy customer demand, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to access a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more stocks of grocery items, soft drinks, beverages and hog feed for resale. 

Being a patient and industrious mother, she believes that she will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, soft drinks, beverages and hog feed for resale.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 44 years old and married. She lives in Minsubong, Tangub City. 

Liza manages a rice farm to earn a living, and she is also engaged in raising swine to potentially add income for her family. Liza has been doing these business activities for 15 years now. 

She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative on June of 2012. She is hardworking and has a strong determination to pursue her goals in order to sustain her needs and to alleviate poverty. Liza requested a loan to provide her family with a decent and comfortable living space. This loan is intended to be used for the purchase of construction materials for house renovations. 

Someday, she hopes to buy a parcel of rice land to cultivate and venture into the rice retailing business. 

Liza is now supporting her son in his college education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house renovations.

loans.name: Jeannete

texts.en:
Jeannete is 33 years of age. She is married with two children who are two and five years old; one of them goes to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 11 years, while her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay for workers. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for workers.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 57 years old. He is married with four children. He has had a farming business for 12 years. 

He will be using the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer and hopes this will help him to grow more potatoes, vegetables and maize for sale. His hopes and dreams for the future are to increase his income and be able to educate his children and provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 20 years old. He is not married and has no children. 

He has had a motorcycle passenger transport business for three years. He will be using the loan to purchase another motorcycle and hopes this will help him serve more customers and increase his income. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his transportation business and start a taxi business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle in order to serve more customers and increase his income.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 28 years old. She is married with two children, who are one and three years old. She is a farmer and has been producing rice for 12 years. Her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay for workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for workers.

loans.name: Turan

texts.en: Turan is a master. He is 26 years old and lives with his parents in the Baku region. Turan builds stone walls and constructs concrete foundations of houses, etc. This is Turan's second loan, and he he repaid his first loan on time. Now Turan needs a loan of 1,100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair his tools  that he uses in construction because his tools were broken, and to improve his business. He gives great thanks to the Kiva organization and its lenders.

loans.use: to repair tools and increase business

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en: Emelinda lives in Piat and manages a store selling grocery items and vegetables to earn income. Her spouse is a tricycle driver. They had a child. Emelinda wanted to keep increasing her profits to save funds for her family's expenses. She needs to increase her merchandise, that is why she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits, eggs, vinegar and soap to sell. Additional revenues will be kept for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, eggs, vinegar and soap to sell

loans.name: Zayda Carolina

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee un negocio de venta de productos de uso personal y para el hogar como: papel higiénico, detergentes, shampoo, cremas, desodorantes, jabón, etc. su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal y ya tiene muchos clientes, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar,  ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman in the photo has her face blurred because she is 26-years old and lives in a high-risk area.  She has a business selling personal products and household products such as: toilet paper, detergents, shampoo, lotions, deodorant, soap etc.  Her business is located in the city market, and she has a lot of customers.  The young woman lives in her own home with her family.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale products so she can continue with her sales and be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase toilet paper, detergents, shampoo,  lotions, deodorants, soap etc.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.en:
Sayohat is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1985, and she lives in a remote area. She is married and has three children. 

Sayohat has a family business. Her husband and children are helping her to do the business. Their family is busy with trading women's and children's clothing at a domestic market. They have been doing this business for seven years. Sayohat is a salesperson at their store. 

Three years ago, they started to build a house in an empty part of their house. Sayohat is planning to complete their building (renovation). She is asking for financial support to buy construction materials in order to complete the building of her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to complete the building of her house.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en: Crisanta is a businesswoman from Ozamiz. She is 46 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Crisanta is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Crisanta continues to look for better business opportunities; proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina is grateful that she was granted a 13,000 PHP loan, which she used to pay for grocery items like rice, coffee, soda and rice noodles to sell at her grocery store. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

Aside from her store, she also has a farming business. She would now like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm supplies for a more productive banana harvest on her farm. It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education. 

She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Ceferina dreams for her farm to grow and flourish and to have a happy and prosperous life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farm seedlings, fertilizer and other items needed for her farm.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is thankful that she was granted a 9,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another 9,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Annaliza dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Marina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods.  Marina is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is widowed mother and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Letecia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Borseth district of Kampong Spue province, Ret is 65 years old and married with two children. To support her family, she has been farming rice and raising pigs for 28 years. To supplement the income, she also sells grocery items. From the current business, she can earn about 25,000KHR per day. 

Ret has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Now she is applying for a loan to buy pig feeds and more grocery items to resell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds

loans.name: Toeng

texts.en:
Toeng is 35 years old and lives with her family members in a rural village located in the Boseth district of Kampong Spue province. She is married with five children, all of whom are in school. Rice farming has been the only main source for her family’s income for 17 years. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day for the needs of her family.

Toeng has been with VisionFund for four cycles. She successfully used the loans from VisionFund to improve her family’s living conditions and now she is confident in making a better living. Now she is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Altamira Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras (Flor de María, Romelia, Laura). Todas viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Es un grupo nuevo que se organizó recientemente con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para accesar a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de: venta de frito y mariscos, aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.

Flor de María: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven afable de  26 años de edad, con deseos de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, con cualidades de líder.  Está casada, tiene tres hijos menores de edad. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de su hijo. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar más productos de mariscos y pescados para vender e incrementar sus ingresos y atender a más personas que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up of three hard-working women (Flor de María, Romelia and Laura).  All of them live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas.  This is a new communal bank that was formed recently with the goal of the women working together to access loans from Pana Pana and to have the opportunity to improve their small businesses selling fried foods and shellfish.  They want to increase their incomes and improve their families' standards of living. 

Flor de María is the communal bank's coordinator.  She is a 26-year old, friendly young woman who wants to improve her family's standard of living through leadership qualities.  She is married and has three young children.  For the last three years, she has made her living selling seafood and shellfish, which allows her to generate her own income and contribute to the household expenses as well as her son's education.  Flor de María is requesting this loan to purchase more shellfish and seafood to resell so she can increase her income and serve more of the people wanting her products, which are part of the basic diet in Bilwi.  Flor de María hopes to continue counting on enough capital to open a small grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more shell-fish and seafood products.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Aged 52 years, Ya is a married mother of four children living in the Boseth district of Kampong Spue province. She is a rice farmer. She has been in the business for 30 years and she can earn about 16,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs. 

This is Ya's fifth loan with VisionFund. Now she is applying for another loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice production. This will increase her family’s income. She hopes to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is engaged in buying and selling frozen foods. She buys the products at a wholesale price and then sells them at retail in her village. She gains almost 25% percent from the cost of the products. Sometimes she offers her regular customers one week to pay for the products. She needs to collect all her customers’ payments before she can buy additional products to sell. Evangeline wants to borrow a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy sausage, hotdogs, ham, and other frozen foods to sell. With the loan, she will be able to sell frozen foods daily.

loans.use: to buy sausage, hotdogs, ham, and other frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es: Jose de 63 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra maíz, frijol, pipianes, tomates y hortalizas, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa y su nieta en casa propia, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
José, who is 63 years old, has worked in agriculture for a number of years. He plants corn, beans, squash, tomatoes, and vegetables. He sells his products in the various markets that are located near his house. He lives with his wife and his granddaughter in his own house.

José is applying for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc., and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph in order to be able to continue with his work and have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc, and to improve the land

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, el posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young man, whose face has been pixelated because he is 28 years old and lives in a zone of high risk, has a little store located in his place of residence. He has many customers because of the good prices. With the earnings that he obtains, he manages to pay some household expenses. The young man lives in his own house with his wife.

He is applying for a loan to purchase soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc., and thus be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc. for his store

loans.name: Deceria

texts.en:
Deceria had the skills and expertise in peanut-butter processing, yet she had no capital to make it her business. As a mother from Tangub, she never gets tired of supporting her family in any way she can, and helping her husband earn an income. 

Deceria joined PMPC after she learned she could gain financial assistance, and she decided to start a business, which is peanut-butter processing. It has been doing well as she has worked to perfect the taste and quality of her product. Deceria has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

She has requested another loan from PMPC to purchase additional raw ingredients and cooking materials for her business. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and continue to benefit her family. Today, other retail businesses sell her product, which in turn helps them earn an income for their own families.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients and cooking materials for her peanut-butter business

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve, age 25, is from Tangub City, Philippines. She is a single parent bravely raising her daughter. PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her retailing business. She is happy tending and displaying assorted goods to sell. 

Genevieve is now trying to expand her business. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more assorted items to sell. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and to build good business management for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she wishes to provide her daughter a good education.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted items to sell

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Ronald's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Ronald, often described as an extremely friendly person. He is 35 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  He is married and has one child.

Ronald is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to earn enough to feed his family, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Ronald says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2014, he has been able to save more money, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Ronald will use the profits from this season to repair his home.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta, de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a cuidar una hacienda particular y tienen un hijo.
