Marta, tiene venta de tortillas desde hace 15 años, su mamá le enseñó a hacer tortillas, el negocio está en su casa y comienza la venta desde las 10:00 a.m. hasta la 1:00 de la tarde.

Marta, necesita el préstamo para comprar material para terminar de construir su casa.

Marta, sueña con tener su propia casa y que sea de su hijo.
texts.en:
Marta, who is 49 years old, went to school through sixth grade. She is married, and her partner cares for a private farm. They have a son.

Marta has sold tortillas for 15 years. Her mother taught her to make tortillas. The business is located in her house, and she begins sales at 10:00 am [and continues] until 1:00 in the afternoon. 

Marta needs the loan to purchase material to finish building her house.

Marta dreams of having her own house and that it will [eventually] be her son's.

loans.use: to buy material to finish building her house.

loans.name: Phoerng

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village of the Boseth district of Kampong Spue province, Phoerng is aged 58 years and a mother of one son. For the last 10 years, Phoerng has been working as a rice farmer to support her family’s needs. To add more income, she also works as a garment worker. She can earn about 85,000 KHR per day.
 
Phoerng has been a member of VisionFund for six loan cycles already and she completely paid back the loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has used them to better support her business and family’s living conditions. 

Now she is asking for a loan to buy cows for helping her in operating her farming business. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a cow to use for labor in helping her farming business, and she also hopes to increase rice yields so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cows for helping her in operating her farming business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Kampong Speu province’s Borseth district, Ann is 41 and married with three children. For the last 23 years, she has been farming rice and raising pigs as primary businesses for her family. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day to make a living. 

This is the third loan for Ann with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy pig feeds and will use a portion of it to spend on buying household supplies. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income from her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en: Marichu, single, is a businesswoman. She is 28 years old, Marichu is living with her parents in Mantic, Tangub City. She has the expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her parents in sustaining the needs of their family. Marichu is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Marichu continues to look for better business opportunites, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for the barn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest a little more in spare parts for motorcycles, with the goal of improving sales and thus being able to give more support his family.

loans.name: Narlie

texts.en:
Narlie is thankful that she was granted a prior 10000 PHP loan that she used to pay for spare parts, accessories of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 15000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for the license, tire and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Narlie dreams to buy additional tricycle units to grow her business. She hopes to send her children to College to allow them better opportunities to improve their lives. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for license, tire  and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther's Group is formed of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Esther, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 34 years old, married and has three children. Esther has been a farmer for five years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Esther isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money ever since. This year, Esther will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Esther's Group will purchase a total of nine solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer, to improve her maize harvests

loans.name: Huyly

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Kampong Spue province’s Borseth district, Huyly is a 26-year-old mother of two dependent children. To support her children, Huyly has been farming rice for six years while her husband has been working as an auto repairer. Together, they can earn about KHR 45,000 per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Huyly received her first loan two cycles ago and she completely repaid the loans with VisionFund. She is applying for a new loan to buy cows to help her in farming business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her business.

loans.use: to buy cows to help her in her farming business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 28-year-old married father of one child. He has worked in the construction field specializing in painting for 15 years. He is working hard to satisfy his family's needs and expenses.
 
Hasan is an ambitious man who is trying desperately to develop his business. Thus, he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a new toolkit to facilitate his business and provide his customers with better and quicker service.

Hasan hopes to expand his business further in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new toolkit to facilitate his business

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Aged 52 years, Nen lives in a rural village located in the Kampong Speu province’s Borseth district, Cambodia. For the last 28 years, Nen has been farming rice and raising pigs to make a living. Together, they can earn about KHR 40,000 per day from the current business.

This is the third loan for Nen with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now requesting a loan of KHR 2,000,000, she is going to use this loan to buy pig feed for her pig. She hopes this loan will enable her to fatten her pigs in order to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for her pig

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: Sherly is a businesswoman in Tangub. She is 38 years old, married and a microfinance member of PMPC. Sherly runs a retail store selling a variety of commodities including food and other consumable items. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially in the education of her children. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase an additional variety of commodities. Sherly believes that having enough inventory will allow her to cater to her customers' needs. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase an additional variety of commodities

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Kampong Speu province’s Borseth district, Seng is 44 years old and married with one daughter who is still in school. For the last 25 years, she has been farming rice and planting various kinds of vegetables to make a living. Together, they can earn about KHR 30,000 per day.

This is the third loan for Seng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow rice and vegetables successfully in order to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 49 years old and lives in Lumbia, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is single and the breadwinner of her family. She has a stall in front of their house that sells a variety of food. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan to buy more ingredients for her business. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Josephine wants to build her own family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio has mastered his hog raising business in Tangub. This is how he makes a living and is able to support his family. 

Tangub was at his lowest point when he didn't have enough capital for his business. When he joined PMPC, he was truly grateful of the credit to fully support his business. He is as careful with his PMPC membership as he is with his hog raising business, and he wants to maintain his membership in good standing so he can always apply for any financing needs.

Now the loan of PHP 50,000 will help him to buy additional heads of pig and bags of feeds, and to build a concrete pig pen that will support sanitation and be environmentally friendly.

loans.use: to buy additional heads of pig and bags of feeds, and to build a concrete pig pen that will support sanitation and be environmentally friendly

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Jafari, who is in his late 30s, is single with two kids who are still in school. He has been running a retail shop for five years.  He works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Jafari's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to keep increasing the shop stock and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. He will use this loan to increase his shop's inventory of things like sugar, salt, beans, flours, rice, cooking oil etc.  He dreams of building his own house.  

Jafari will share this loan with his loan group "Wazo Tegeta", which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his shop inventory of sugar, salt, beans, flour, rice, and cooking oil
